ACT205.title: Fundamentals of Accounting
ACT205.description: Understanding of financial statements to support financial and managerial decision making.

ACT210.title: Introduction to Financial Accounting
ACT210.description: Use of accounting information by decision makers; development of the basic accounting model, and issues concerning income and cash flows.

ACT211.title: Accounting Professional Skills
ACT211.description: Survey of accounting profession career options, certifications, and professional skills.

ACT220.title: Introduction to Managerial Accounting
ACT220.description: Use of accounting information in internal decision making.

ACT311.title: Intermediate Accounting I
ACT311.description: Preparation and analysis of financial statements under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP); accounting for revenue and assets.

ACT312.title: Intermediate Accounting II
ACT312.description: Equity structure of corporations; analysis and interpretation of accounting data.

ACT321.title: Cost Management
ACT321.description: Utilizing budgetary and cost accounting information for planning, controlling, and decision-making.

ACT330.title: Introduction to Taxation
ACT330.description: Introduction to U.S. taxation, with emphasis on federal income tax; impact of taxation on business decisions.

ACT350.title: Accounting Information Systems
ACT350.description: Design, administration and control of accounting information systems; use of accounting systems software.

ACT411.title: Advanced Accounting
ACT411.description: Accounting for branches and subsidiaries, partnerships, and business combinations. Accounting for multi-national business transactions.

ACT441.title: Auditing Practices
ACT441.description: Environment, professional standards, and practices involved in auditing financial statements and performance of other assurance services.

ACT487.title: Internship
ACT487.description: Supervised work experience in public, industry, not-for-profit, or governmental accounting.

ACT541.title: Forensic Accounting and Fraud Auditing
ACT541.description: Professional practices for addressing the related areas of forensic accounting and fraud.

ACT550.title: Accounting Information Technologies
ACT550.description: Best practices for information technologies used in accounting systems worldwide.

ACT561.title: Legal and Regulatory Issues in Accounting
ACT561.description: Contracts, ownership, bankruptcy (debtor/creditor relationship), formation of business entities, regulation of accounting profession.

ACT570.title: Government and Nonprofit
ACT570.description: Theory and practical application of accounting principles and auditing standards to governmental entities and not-for-profit organizations.

ACT575.title: Oil and Gas Accounting
ACT575.description: Specialized financial accounting procedures related to the oil and gas industry.

ACT601A.title: Professional Practice: Taxation
ACT601A.description: Management of professional tax practice; professional ethics and regulation; research techniques.

ACT601B.title: Professional Practice: Accounting
ACT601B.description: Management of professional accounting practice; professional ethics and regulation; and research techniques.

ACT605.title: Accounting for Sustainable Enterprises
ACT605.description: A survey of financial, managerial, and sustainability accounting systems and reports.

ACT612.title: Issues in Financial Reporting and Auditing
ACT612.description: Contemporary and emerging issues at the intersection of financial reporting and auditing.

ACT614.title: Financial Statement Analysis and Valuation
ACT614.description: Tools and techniques of financial statement analysis and application to equity valuation.

ACT631.title: Corporate Taxation
ACT631.description: Federal income tax principles pertaining to formation and operation of corporate entities.

ACT633.title: Flow-Through Entities
ACT633.description: Federal income tax principles and problems pertaining to flow-through entities.

ACT635.title: State and Local Taxation
ACT635.description: Tax planning and compliance issues for entities doing business in multi-jurisdictional locales.

ACT636.title: Taxation of Corporations and Shareholders
ACT636.description: Federal income tax principles and problems relating to reorganization, consolidation, and termination of corporations.

ACT639.title: Special Topics in Taxation
ACT639.description: Taxation of not-for-profit entities; international tax issues; other contemporary topics.

ACT641.title: Information Systems Audit and Control
ACT641.description: Exploration of organizations' information systems, and the considerations involved in controlling and auditing these systems. Topics range from the general, such as organizational governance, to the very technical, for example, data encryption. Addresses material found on the CPA exam and the Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) exam.

AS101.title: Heritage and Values of the US Air Force I
AS101.description: Introduction to the United States Air Force. Overview of the basic characteristics, missions, and organization of the Air Force.

AS102.title: Heritage and Values of the US Air Force II
AS102.description: Deeper overview of the basic characteristics, missions, and organization of the Air Force.

AS196A.title: Aerospace Group Study I
AS196A.description: Leadership Group Study is mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Professor of Aerospace Studies.

AS196B.title: Aerospace Group Study I
AS196B.description: Leadership Group Study is mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Professor of Aerospace Studies.

AS201.title: Air Force Team & Leadership Fundamentals I
AS201.description: Focus on the foundation for teams and leadership. Topics include skills that improve leadership on a personal level and within a team. Prepare for field training experience practicing the concepts learned. Instill a leadership mindset and motivation for transition from AFROTC cadet to AFROTC officer candidate.

AS202.title: Air Force Team & Leadership Fundamentals II
AS202.description: More in-depth lecture foundation for teams and leadership in a military environment. Topics include skills that improve leadership on a personal level and within a team. Intense preparation for field training experience practicing the concepts learned.

AS296A.title: Aerospace Group Study II
AS296A.description: Leadership Group Study is mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Professor of Aerospace Studies.

AS296B.title: Aerospace Group Study II
AS296B.description: Leadership Group Study is mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Professor of Aerospace Studies.

AS301.title: Leading People and Effective Communication I
AS301.description: Advanced skills and knowledge in management and leadership. Emphasis on enhancing leadership skills and communication. Cadets explore these leadership and management techniques in a supervised environment.

AS302.title: Leading People and Effective Communication II
AS302.description: Enhance skills and knowledge in management and leadership while in leadership positions. Cadets explore these leadership and management techniques in a supervised environment.

AS333.title: Operational Air Force Writing
AS333.description: Common writing practices and procedures encountered by junior officers in the Air Force. Emphasizes proper writing content as well as form.

AS396A.title: Aerospace Group Study III
AS396A.description: Concept of leadership; relationship between leadership and management; importance of leadership in the operation and success of any organization.

AS396B.title: Aerospace Group Study III
AS396B.description: Concept of leadership; relationship between leadership and management; importance of leadership in the operation and success of any organization.

AS401.title: National Security Affairs/Active Duty I
AS401.description: Evolution and formulation of U.S. defense policy and strategy, regional conflict studies, Air Force roles and missions.

AS402.title: National Security Affairs/Active Duty II
AS402.description: Professionalism, military justice system, military ethics, commissioning essentials, and emphasis on communication skills.

AS496A.title: Aerospace Group Study IV
AS496A.description: Concept of leadership; relationship between leadership and management; importance of leadership in the operation and success of any organization.

AS496B.title: Aerospace Group Study IV
AS496B.description: Concept of leadership; relationship between leadership and management; importance of leadership in the operation and success of any organization.

AB120.title: Agricultural Biology--Freshman Orientation
AB120.description: Introduction to information and skills necessary to succeed in the agricultural biology major.

AB130.title: Working with Agricultural Biology Data
AB130.description: Introduction to the scientific method and systems thinking in terms of agricultural biology. Develop a hypothesis based on field observations, collect and analyze data to determine if findings align with the hypothesis. Results are communicated in a written report, and oral presentation.

AB230.title: Becoming an Agricultural Biology Professional
AB230.description: Design professional resumes, and develop interpersonal skills to succeed in a professional environment. Develop criteria to write a report from internships, and develop skills in interpretation of qualitative and quantitative agricultural biology data.

AB270.title: Agri. Biology Orientation for Transfers
AB270.description: Introduction to the scientific method and systems thinking in terms of agricultural biology. Develop a hypothesis based on field observations, collect and analyze data. Prepare to become agricultural biology professionals by designing resumes and practicing skills to succeed in a professional environment.

AB310.title: Understanding Pesticides
AB310.description: Identification, properties, use, labeling, environmental interactions, and application of major classes of pesticides.

AB330.title: Applications in Agricultural Biology  I
AB330.description: Knowledge, skills, and abilities to propose sustainable solutions to biological problems in natural or managed ecosystems. Collectively discuss a diverse set of case studies that incorporate systems approach in solving agricultural biology issues. Hone career plans and professional skills.

AB430.title: Applications in Agricultural Biology II
AB430.description: Apply systems thinking and dynamic systems modeling to case studies and a capstone project that poses sustainable solutions to biological problems in natural or managed ecosystems. Hone career plans and professional skills.

AB509.title: Herbicide Selectivity and Action
AB509.description: Explores the physicochemical properties of herbicides, their selectivity (through placement and metabolism), their mechanism of action, uses in weed management, visual symptoms of herbicide treatment, how plants can evolve resistance to these compounds, and controversial topics related to the use of herbicides.

AB511.title: Microbiome of Plant Systems
AB511.description: Emphasizes interdisciplinary and cross curricular education with training in disciplines that support an increased understanding of plant associated microbiome and their optimization.

AGED110.title: Agriculture Production Systems
AGED110.description: Broad survey of the diverse aspects of Colorado agriculture.

AGED210.title: History of Agriculture in the United States
AGED210.description: Relationships in agriculture. Historical/Native American/early practices, industrial agriculture, technologies, philosophy, green revolution.

AGED220.title: Understanding Agricultural Education
AGED220.description: Understanding different agricultural education systems. Understanding delivery models of agricultural education programs.

AGED240.title: Technical Tool Applications in Ag Education
AGED240.description: Development of safe competencies and applications related to power and technical tools utilized in school-based agricultural education programs.

AGED244.title: Power, Structure, and Tech. Systems in Ag Ed
AGED244.description: Development of competencies and theory related to agricultural power, structure, and technical  systems utilized in school-based agricultural education programs.

AGED320.title: Technology Lab for Ag Education
AGED320.description: Laboratory applications related to the power, structure, and technical systems pathway utilized in school-based agricultural education programs.

AGED330.title: Program Design and Evaluation in Ag. Literacy
AGED330.description: Design and evaluate programs in agricultural literacy using experiential methods.

AGED420.title: Developing School-Based Ag Education Programs
AGED420.description: Developing knowledge in the approach and delivery of school-based agricultural education programs.

AGED430.title: Methods of Agricultural Literacy
AGED430.description: Prepare and conduct agricultural literacy instructional units to work with a variety of audiences and instructional topics.

AGED440.title: Managing Experiences in Ag Ed Laboratories
AGED440.description: Theory, management and pedagogy of delivering safety instruction and experiential curriculum in secondary agricultural education laboratory settings.

AGED486A.title: Practicum: Agricultural Literacy
AGED486A.description: Experience in the agricultural literacy field.

AGED486B.title: Practicum: On-site Experience in Agricultural Outreach
AGED486B.description: Formalized training on conducting non-formal agricultural education at the National Western Stock Show.

AGED486C.title: Practicum: FFA
AGED486C.description: Formalized training on managing FFA experiences, including Career Development Events and Leadership Development Events.

AGED510.title: American Agricultural Values and Ideology
AGED510.description: Explore how people have conceptualized agriculture in the United States, how agricultural ideologies have shaped our agricultural values, and how differing agricultural ideologies impact the work in agriculture today and in the future.

AGED525.title: Agricultural and Extension Teaching
AGED525.description: Use research on effective teaching methods to define and deliver educational programs, courses and presentations in formal and non-formal educational settings in agriculture. Apply organization and instructional methods to evaluate, plan, deliver and assess effective educational programs.

AGED540.title: Ag Ed Laboratory Management and Safety
AGED540.description: Theory, management, and pedagogy of delivering safety instruction and experiential curriculum in secondary agricultural education laboratory settings.

AGED600.title: Evaluation and Applied Research in Extension
AGED600.description: Train extension and other outreach specialists in the basics of program evaluation and research methods. Work with real world scenarios and/or their own field experiences to learn how to strategically design evaluation plans and effectively analyze the data collected. Emphasizing how to improve programming with the collected data.

AGED692.title: Agricultural Education Seminar
AGED692.description: Agricultural education focusing on current trends in Extension.

AGRI192.title: Orientation to Agricultural Systems
AGRI192.description: Freshman inquiry course in agriculture. Information and skills necessary to succeed in majors in the agricultural sciences.

AGRI292.title: Transfer Seminar
AGRI292.description: The university and its resources, college success skills, careers in the various disciplines of agriculture; current issues in agriculture.

AGRI300.title: Issues in Agriculture
AGRI300.description: Scientific, technical, cultural, and social issues facing agriculture, and their interrelationships.

AGRI500.title: Advanced Issues in Agriculture
AGRI500.description: Scientific, technical, cultural, and social issues facing agriculture, and their interrelationships.

AGRI510.title: Sustainable Agriculture
AGRI510.description: An interdisciplinary study comparing conventional and alternative land management practices, using an agroecosystem analysis approach.

AGRI511A.title: Study Abroad: Field Applications in Sustainable Agriculture
AGRI511A.description: Travel to Todos Santos, Mexico for a seven day experience where in-the-field laboratory skills in sustainable agriculture are practiced. Investigate and implement unique, real-time initiatives developed in class while in Todos Santos.

AGRI521.title: Emerging Issues and Challenges for Global Agr
AGRI521.description: Interdisciplinary course containing tools and knowledge to discuss the emerging challenges of the global agriculture, water, and food system.

AGRI545.title: Plant Tissue Culture
AGRI545.description: Theory, technology, and techniques of cell, organ, tissue, and protoplast culture of plants.

AGRI546.title: Principles of Cooperative Extension
AGRI546.description: Traditional and contemporary delivery systems of Cooperative Extension emphasizing structures of nonformal education.

AGRI547.title: Delivery of Cooperative Extension Programs
AGRI547.description: Methods, techniques, and procedures in planning, implementation, and delivery of Cooperative Extension programs.

AGRI550.title: Capacity Building for a Changing Workplace
AGRI550.description: A framework for competence in workplaces applies situation analysis/problem-solving to solve real-life agricultural situations shared by experts.

AGRI562.title: Sociology of Food Systems and Agriculture

AGRI575.title: Livestock-Wildlife Conflict & Law
AGRI575.description: Investigation of the laws and policies surrounding livestock wildlife interaction and conflict at the federal, state, and international levels.

AGRI602.title: Bioenergy Policy, Economics, and Assessment
AGRI602.description: Bioenergy policy; economic principles applied to biofuel production; evaluation of environmental impacts on bioenergy production.

AGRI630.title: Integrated Decision Making/Management Skills
AGRI630.description: Motivation for management, decision making, introduction to systems, information management, introduction to statistics.

AGRI631.title: Building the Business
AGRI631.description: Skills required to organize and implement a modern business enterprise with focus on land-based operations.

AGRI632.title: Managing for Ecosystem Sustainability
AGRI632.description: Impacts of ecological processes, use of mechanism-based understanding, and tools used to manage the ecosystem for sustainability.

AGRI633.title: Understanding and Managing Animal Resources
AGRI633.description: Evaluating nutritional requirements of a variety of animals, how and why requirements vary according to level of production.

AGRI634.title: Animal Production Systems
AGRI634.description: Developing animal management systems for a variety of animal species in a forage-based environment.

AGRI635.title: Integrated Forage Management
AGRI635.description: Development of management plans that integrate diverse forage resources including native rangeland and cultivated forages.

AGRI636.title: Analyzing and Managing the Business
AGRI636.description: Assimilating, preparing, and analyzing records; reading financial statements to manage a land-based business.

AGRI637.title: Understanding Policy and Emerging Issues
AGRI637.description: Origination, purpose, and policy effects on land-based enterprises; policy effects on management decisions.

AGRI638.title: Ecosystem Services on Agricultural Lands
AGRI638.description: Within an economics framework, explores the unique management challenges involved in a modern, diversified agricultural operation.

AGRI639.title: Products to Profit
AGRI639.description: Marketing all aspects of the enterprise, beginning with land and forage resource and tracking all revenue generation.

AGRI640.title: Integrated Resource Management Plan
AGRI640.description: Formulation of an optimal land management plan for a specific site based on specific goals and objectives.

AREC202.title: Agricultural and Resource Economics (GT-SS1)
AREC202.description: Introduction to decision-making by consumers, firms, and government and the resulting allocation of resources through markets.

AREC224.title: Introduction to Agribusiness Entrepreneurship
AREC224.description: Introductory exposure to entrepreneurship for agribusinesses through presentations by industry professionals.

AREC305.title: Agricultural and Resource Enterprise Analysis
AREC305.description: Use of records in agricultural and resource enterprise management; analytical methods, budgets, and planning techniques for improved decision making.

AREC310.title: Agricultural Marketing
AREC310.description: Market structure, behavior, and performance including futures market and market games theory.

AREC311.title: Agricultural and Resource Product Marketing
AREC311.description: Theory and practice of marketing-differentiated agricultural products and natural resource amenities with focus on strategies and market trends.

AREC325.title: Personnel Management in Agriculture
AREC325.description: Human resource issues for agribusiness firms. Managing employees, legal issues, negotiation methods, and benefits packages. Workplace professionalism.

AREC328.title: Small Agribusiness Management
AREC328.description: Apply business principles to small food enterprises, agribusinesses and cooperatives.

AREC341.title: Environmental Economics
AREC341.description: Economic theories and analytic frameworks are developed and applied to contemporary problems of the use and protection of the natural environment.

AREC342.title: Water Law, Policy, and Institutions
AREC342.description: Legal water issues within the context of historical, social and economic development with emphasis on the southwestern United States.

AREC375.title: Agricultural Law
AREC375.description: Laws, regulations, case decisions affecting ranching and farming in the Rocky Mountain area.

AREC405.title: Agricultural Production Management
AREC405.description: Economic principles of agricultural production decisions with linear programming analysis of production choices and farm planning.

AREC408.title: Agricultural Finance
AREC408.description: Monetary affairs of agribusiness and agricultural production emphasizing credit institutions and procurement, investment, and management.

AREC412.title: Agricultural Commodities Marketing
AREC412.description: Agricultural marketing and agribusiness principles applied to current marketing problems relating to livestock and field and horticultural crops.

AREC415.title: International Agricultural Trade
AREC415.description: Agricultural trade patterns and institutions; trade theory with applications to agriculture. Current issues in agricultural trade.

AREC428.title: Agricultural Business Management
AREC428.description: Economic analysis, organization, and management practices of agriculture and food industries studied through simulation, case study, computer labs.

AREC440.title: Advanced Environmental and Resource Economics
AREC440.description: Microeconomic techniques to rigorously explore economic decision-making and policy as they apply to environmental and natural resource problems.

AREC442.title: Water Resource Economics
AREC442.description: An in-depth exploration of the role of economics in water resource planning.

AREC460.title: Ag- and Resource-Based Economic Development
AREC460.description: Indicators, tools and approaches for agriculture- and natural resource-based economic development in resource dependent countries and communities.

AREC461A.title: Study Abroad--Italy: Economics of the Renaissance in Modern Italy
AREC461A.description: The historical and current economics of agriculture and natural resources in Florence, Tuscany and Italy. Focus on (1) The role of culture, creativity and place in economic development; (2) Italian culture in general; (3) the economic and political history of Florence; and (4) the production, markets and economic importance of culture and natural resource-based industries in central Italy.

AREC461B.title: Study Abroad--Italy: Food and Resource Economics
AREC461B.description: In-depth investigation of the food and natural resource-based economy of Italy through an applied economics lens. Economics and policy are used to provide insight into the integration of Italian culture and its principal food and natural resource industries. A theoretical basis for different resource management systems are presented including various methods of cost–benefit analysis, utility theory, property rights structures, government institutions, and cultural and ethical considerations.

AREC478.title: Agricultural Policy
AREC478.description: Formulation and administration of public policies affecting agricultural industries and rural areas in the United States.

AREC505.title: Agricultural Production Economics
AREC505.description: Empirical applications of production economic theory for use of imputs and allocation of resources in agricultural, natural resource sectors.

AREC507.title: Applied Welfare and Policy Analysis
AREC507.description: How policies are crafted to effectively address social issues, especially for agriculture and the environment, and how they impact society.

AREC508.title: Financial Management in Agriculture
AREC508.description: Systematic approach to understanding and applying financial management in farm businesses.

AREC510.title: Agricultural Product Marketing
AREC510.description: Marketing techniques, industrial organization/competition for agricultural products in US domestic, international trade, and developing country markets.

AREC511.title: Opportunities in the Agricultural Value Chain
AREC511.description: Explores the economics and business structure of operations within the food and agribusiness system, using readings, field trips and guest speakers.

AREC512.title: Innovation in Agribusinesses
AREC512.description: Core concepts of entrepreneurship within both private and social enterprises. General applications of innovation and entrepreneurship with particular emphasis on the industries that make up the agricultural and food system.

AREC513.title: Idea Evaluation in Agricultural Value Chains
AREC513.description: Processes of identifying and evaluating a new idea, applying strategic and design-thinking principles and tools to explore pathways by which it could grow into a viable agribusiness.

AREC514.title: Entrepreneurial Accounting and Finance
AREC514.description: Foundational background in accounting and financial concepts and mastery of financial tools needed to start a new agribusiness.

AREC515.title: Assessing Agricultural and Food Markets
AREC515.description: Foundational background regarding marketing concepts needed to evaluate the potential market for an agricultural or food product or service, using an economics framework.

AREC516.title: Business Economics for the Entrepreneur
AREC516.description: Microeconomic framework that a potential entrepreneur can use to analyze business opportunities. Topics include components of cost and revenue and their relevance for new business ventures, determinants and measurement of consumer demand, and alternate forms of business organization and interaction.

AREC517.title: Entrepreneurial Identity and Team Formation
AREC517.description: Students explore their emergent identity as "entrepreneur", including their necessary interdependence on other members of a team when engaged in creative endeavors such as innovation or new business development in the agricultural space.

AREC518.title: Raising Capital in the Agricultural Sector
AREC518.description: Methods to value a startup business and approaches to identifying sources of capital needed to launch and sustain the startup. Emphasis on unique challenges in and sources of raising capital in the agricultural sector.

AREC519A.title: New Venture Communication: Interpersonal Interactions
AREC519A.description: Communicating in the workplace, both orally and in written form. Development of a succinct business proposal.

AREC519B.title: New Venture Communication: Making the Pitch
AREC519B.description: Emphasis on oral communication when trying to sell a business idea to potential investors. Development of tailored presentations to target audience within moments of opportunity.

AREC520.title: Intellectual Property in Food and Agriculture
AREC520.description: Explores the critical role that intellectual property plays in commercial activities within the knowledge economy. Emphasis on strategic management of technology through patents and other control mechanisms, thereby allowing startups to survive and thrive in the knowledge economy with special attention to property developed in the agricultural and food systems.

AREC521.title: New Food Product Development
AREC521.description: An overview of the food product development process. Topics include strategies, marketing perspectives, quality controls and supply chains in the food system.

AREC528.title: Applied Agribusiness Decision Tools
AREC528.description: Applications of quantitative tools for managerial decision-making in the context of an agribusiness.

AREC530.title: Agricultural Price Analysis
AREC530.description: Agricultural commodity prices related to neoclassical economics; current literature emphasizing management problems.

AREC542.title: Applied Advanced Water Resource Economics
AREC542.description: Theory and application of economics in water resource planning.

AREC547.title: Public Lands Planning and Management
AREC547.description: Principles and techniques used by federal land management agencies including Forest Service, Park Service, Fish and Wildlife Service, and BLM.

AREC572.title: Social Benefit Cost Analysis
AREC572.description: Theory, application of concepts relating to social benefit cost analysis of public projects, policies intended to promote social welfare, and economic growth.

AREC586A.title: New Venture Launch Practicum: Explore and Validate Value Proposition
AREC586A.description: Team-based development of a new venture or innovation focusing on co-creation of value. Four main areas of competency--(1) entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork; (2) technology and product development; (3) communication and substantiation of value; and (4) business strategy and execution--are developed and demonstrated in the process of preparing to launch a new venture or innovation in the agricultural, food, or related industries.

AREC586B.title: New Venture Launch Practicum: Communicate, Design, and Iterate
AREC586B.description: Team-based development of a new venture or innovation focusing on co-creation of value. Four main areas of competency--(1) entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork; (2) technology and product development; (3) communication and substantiation of value; and (4) business strategy and execution--are developed and demonstrated in the process of preparing to launch a new venture or innovation in the agricultural, food, or related industries.

AREC586C.title: New Venture Launch Practicum: Final Evaluation, Presentation, and Launch
AREC586C.description: Team-based development of a new venture or innovation focusing on co-creation of value. Four main areas of competency--(1) entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork; (2) technology and product development; (3) communication and substantiation of value; and (4) business strategy and execution--are developed and demonstrated in the process of preparing to launch a new venture or innovation in the agricultural, food, or related industries.

AREC605.title: Agricultural Production and Cost Analysis
AREC605.description: Empirical application and analysis of production and cost issues in the agricultural and natural resource sectors.

AREC610.title: Agricultural Marketing and Demand Analysis
AREC610.description: Empirical application and analysis of agricultural marketing and demand issues in the agricultural and natural resource sectors.

AREC615.title: Optimization Methods for Applied Economics
AREC615.description: Theory and practice of optimization techniques used in economic applications with emphasis on linear and nonlinear programming.

AREC647.title: Land Use Economics and Spatial Modeling
AREC647.description: Use of spatial data in economic analysis of land use focusing on development patterns, land conservation, spatial externalities and agricultural land.

AREC660.title: Development of Rural Resource-Based Economies
AREC660.description: Economic literature-based exploration of human welfare measures and implications of approaches to agriculture and resource-based economic development.

AREC678.title: Agricultural and Resource Policy
AREC678.description: Evaluate and analyze economic theory, applications and public incentives related to government policies for agriculture and natural resources.

AREC705.title: Advanced Production and Technological Change
AREC705.description: Modern theoretical and empirical approaches are applied to understand producer decision-making under uncertainty, technology adoption and effects of innovation, measurements of technical efficiency and productivity, and advanced models of agricultural markets.

AREC710.title: Advanced Agricultural Marketing Issues
AREC710.description: Theoretical and modeling issues of consumer demand, market structure, product differentiation and market behavior.

AREC736A.title: Advanced Econometric Methods: Discrete Choice Models

AREC736B.title: Advanced Econometric Methods: Panel Data Models

AREC736C.title: Advanced Econometric Methods: Time Series Models

AREC770.title: Advanced Methods in Applied Economics
AREC770.description: Advanced research methods in applied economics: lab and field experiments, non-market valuation and discrete choice experiments.

AMST100.title: Self/Community in American Culture, 1600-1877 (GT-HI1)
AMST100.description: Critical analysis of the meaning and development of American culture, 1600-1877, through themes of self and community in art, politics, society, and religion.

AMST101.title: Self/Community in American Culture Since 1877 (GT-HI1)
AMST101.description: Critical analysis of the meaning and development of American culture since 1877, through themes of self and community in art, politics, society, and religion.

AMST492.title: Seminar in American Studies
AMST492.description: Seminar for seniors in Liberal Arts involving critical reading, writing, research, and discussion.  Topics vary.

AMST495.title: Independent Study in American Studies
AMST495.description: Individually-guided studies in interdisciplinary work in American culture.

ANEQ101.title: Food Animal Science
ANEQ101.description: Development, organization, trends and management of the livestock industry;  emphasis on applying science to the production of food and fiber.

ANEQ102.title: Introduction to Equine Science
ANEQ102.description: Equine physiology, production systems and management systems as it pertains to the equine industry and management.

ANEQ103.title: Introduction to Animal Science
ANEQ103.description: Introduction to the livestock industries with emphasis on food and fiber animals. Overviews of the industry structures, and historical and future trends. Product quality evaluation and factors influencing animal performance such as management, nutrition, genetics, and reproduction are presented.

ANEQ104.title: Values, Culture, and Food Animal Agriculture

ANEQ115.title: Applied Equine Behavior
ANEQ115.description: Understanding ethology, the science of animal behavior, will be a key component to evaluating horse behavior. Topics are instinctive, learned, social and reproductive behaviors as well as sensory perception and behavioral neuroanatomy important to equine health and welfare.

ANEQ200.title: Applied Horsemanship and Equitation
ANEQ200.description: Foundation and advancement of horsemanship, on the ground and on horseback.

ANEQ201A.title: Preparation of Horses for Competition: Western
ANEQ201A.description: Development of skills to prepare and present horses in competitions aimed at enhancing their value.

ANEQ201B.title: Preparation of Horses for Competition: English
ANEQ201B.description: Development of skills to prepare and present horses in competitions aimed at enhancing their value.

ANEQ203.title: Equine Management
ANEQ203.description: Equine management and care techniques with hands-on experience.

ANEQ204.title: Equine Facilities Management
ANEQ204.description: Understanding of all aspects required to manage an equine facility coupled with hands-on experience.

ANEQ205.title: Equine Assessment, Evaluation and Retraining
ANEQ205.description: Skills in assessing, evaluating, and training horses in transitional phases of their lives, including, but not limited to horses with a history of non-use, previous trauma, compliance issues, and other problematic concerns.

ANEQ220.title: Feeds and Feeding
ANEQ220.description: Advantages and limitations of feedstuffs; nutrients and their functions; and feed practices for all physiological stages of livestock.

ANEQ230.title: Farm Animal Anatomy and Physiology
ANEQ230.description: Basic concepts of farm animal anatomy and physiology; emphasis on growth, digestion, and reproduction.

ANEQ249.title: Introduction to the Trail Riding Industry
ANEQ249.description: Emphasis on horse care, regulations, first aid, health, training, and hosting a trail ride.

ANEQ250.title: Live Animal and Carcass Evaluation
ANEQ250.description: Growth, development, and value-determining characteristics of market animals.

ANEQ286.title: Livestock Practicum
ANEQ286.description: Livestock breeds and terminology; classification of feedstuffs; livestock handling and care; basic animal management techniques, hands-on experience.

ANEQ292.title: Equine Industry Seminar
ANEQ292.description: Overview of the equine industry and industry careers.

ANEQ293.title: Animal Science Career Exploration Seminar
ANEQ293.description: Better understanding of individual abilities, strengths and passions is imperative to be successful in a career search as well as to succeeding in life. Designed to help students explore who they are individually, how they might fit into a career or graduate programs in animal agriculture; how to prepare marketing materials to be competitive in selection processes.

ANEQ300A.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Livestock Handling

ANEQ300B.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Livestock Entomology

ANEQ300E.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Family Ranching

ANEQ300L.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Quality Assurance

ANEQ300N.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Seedstock Merchandising
ANEQ300N.description: Overview of beef seedstock industry, including hands-on selection, management, and marketing of cattle.

ANEQ300R.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Calving and Calf Care

ANEQ300T.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Event, Fair, and Show Management

ANEQ300U.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Seedstock Sale Management
ANEQ300U.description: Develop, plan, and implement an effective seedstock cattle sale based on genetic information, customer service principles, and client relationships.

ANEQ300W.title: Topics in Animal Sciences: Equine Manure Management
ANEQ300W.description: Practices which maximize the benefits of manure to soils and crops while minimizing hazards to air and water quality; complying with regulations.

ANEQ303.title: Equine Digital Photography
ANEQ303.description: Basics of photographic principles and DSLR cameras with a focus on equine subjects.

ANEQ305.title: Functional Large Animal Physiology
ANEQ305.description: Concepts of large animal physiology; emphasis on growth, digestion, and reproduction.

ANEQ310.title: Animal Reproduction
ANEQ310.description: Anatomy and physiology of the reproductive system; causes of reproductive failure in farm animals; methods of improving reproductive performance.

ANEQ312.title: Animal Ultrasonography
ANEQ312.description: Fundamentals and application of using ultrasound in farm animals; basic reproductive technologies; utilizing ultrasound as a management tool.

ANEQ313.title: Prevention and Control of Livestock Diseases

ANEQ315.title: Equine Behavior
ANEQ315.description: Equine behaviors related to training and learning.

ANEQ320.title: Principles of Animal Nutrition
ANEQ320.description: Understanding of nutrients and nutrient function required to support animal life through all physiological states.

ANEQ322.title: Pet Nutrition
ANEQ322.description: Nutrients, nutrient requirements, feeding practices, food sources and management for companion animals (dogs, cats, birds, fish, reptiles, etc.).

ANEQ323.title: Zoo Nutrition
ANEQ323.description: Unique nutritional requirements of mammalian, avian, and reptile captive wild animals; management protocols needed.

ANEQ325.title: Equine Exercise Physiology
ANEQ325.description: Overview of the main aspects of equine exercise physiology.

ANEQ328.title: Foundations in Animal Genetics
ANEQ328.description: Foundational information to understand animal genetics: genomes, molecular genetics, transmission-Mendelian inheritance, pedigree, population genetics, and introduction to quantitative genetics.

ANEQ330.title: Principles of Animal Breeding
ANEQ330.description: Genetic principles underlying animal improvement; elementary population genetics; heritability; selection response; mating systems; DNA markers.

ANEQ334.title: Principles of Equine Genetics
ANEQ334.description: Application of genetic principles for understanding important quantitative and qualitative traits in horses. Topics include variation, mechanisms of gene action, selection and genetic improvement.

ANEQ340.title: Horse Training and Sale Preparation I
ANEQ340.description: Practical training skills using a yearling or two year old: in-hand, restraint, ground driving, lungeing, first rides, stable management.

ANEQ341.title: Horse Training and Sale Preparation II
ANEQ341.description: Skills in training for specific riding maneuvers, conditioning, and fitting for sale.

ANEQ344.title: Principles of Equine Reproduction
ANEQ344.description: Principles of reproduction and reproductive management of the mare and stallion.

ANEQ345.title: Principles of Nutrition: Equine Applications
ANEQ345.description: Principles of nutrition; application in feeding horses in different physiological states to promote health and wellness.

ANEQ346.title: Equine Disease Management
ANEQ346.description: Normal and abnormal body structures and functions of major systems of the horse.  Recognition of main diseases, causes, prevention and treatments.

ANEQ349.title: Packing and Outfitting
ANEQ349.description: Business aspects of outfitting/packing the horse; hitches, knots, horse care; planning pack trips, setting up camp.

ANEQ351.title: Techniques in Therapeutic Riding
ANEQ351.description: Equine assisted activities; therapeutic horseback riding, hippotherapy, driving/vaulting, mental health treatments, programs for youth at risk.

ANEQ352.title: Introduction to Horse Evaluation
ANEQ352.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of horses; development of logical decision processes for establishing comparative value.

ANEQ353.title: Advanced Horse Evaluation
ANEQ353.description: Advanced criteria/techniques for horse evaluation; logical decision process development to establish comparative value; intercollegiate competition.

ANEQ354.title: Introduction to Livestock Evaluation
ANEQ354.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of livestock; development of logical decision processes for establishing comparative value.

ANEQ355.title: Advanced Livestock Evaluation
ANEQ355.description: Advanced criteria and techniques for evaluation of livestock; establishing comparative value; participating in intercollegiate competition.

ANEQ356.title: Introduction to Dairy Evaluation
ANEQ356.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of dairy cattle; development of logical decision processes for establishing comparative value.

ANEQ357.title: Advanced Dairy Evaluation
ANEQ357.description: Advanced criteria and techniques for evaluation of dairy cattle; establishing comparative value; participating in intercollegiate competition.

ANEQ358.title: Equine Event and Sales Management
ANEQ358.description: Skills necessary to produce, organize, and promote equine related events.

ANEQ359.title: Equine Sales Production
ANEQ359.description: Emphasizes skills necessary to host and evaluate an equine sale.

ANEQ360.title: Principles of Meat Science
ANEQ360.description: Structure, composition, and biology of muscle and associated tissues; wholesomeness, nutritive value, and palatability of beef, pork, and lamb.

ANEQ361.title: Introduction to Meat Product Evaluation
ANEQ361.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of meat products; development of logical decision processes for establishing comparative value.

ANEQ362.title: Advanced Meat Product Evaluation
ANEQ362.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of meat products; establishing comparative value; participating in intercollegiate competition.

ANEQ363.title: Introduction to Wool and Fiber Evaluation
ANEQ363.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of wool; development of logical decision processes for establishing comparative value.

ANEQ364.title: Advanced Wool and Fiber Evaluation
ANEQ364.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluation of wool; establishing comparative value; participating in intercollegiate competition.

ANEQ365.title: Principles of Teaching Therapeutic Riding
ANEQ365.description: Practical experiences and knowledge of the techniques to be a professional certified therapeutic riding instructor.

ANEQ366.title: Animal Welfare Evaluation
ANEQ366.description: Criteria and techniques for evaluating animal welfare generally and for specific species based on the selected focus (specific species differ by year but include farm, companion, lab, working, and exotic animal species). Development of logical decision processes for establishing comparative value between cases.

ANEQ386A.title: Equine Practicum: Equine Training and Management

ANEQ410.title: Applied Food Animal Behavior
ANEQ410.description: Principles of animal behavior applied to food animal species; the importance of understanding, observing, and assessing animal behavior in relation to food animal production; farm animal species specific behavior patterns.

ANEQ420.title: Applied Nutrition--Computer Diet Formulation
ANEQ420.description: Comparative diet formulation strategies for cattle (beef and dairy), equine, swine, and poultry. Utilizing advanced computer software to formulate diets, predict performance, and manage ingredient inventory.

ANEQ440.title: Equine Industry and Issues
ANEQ440.description: For students planning a career in the horse industry; management of facilities, production systems, personnel, marketing, and biological systems.

ANEQ441.title: Integrated Equine Science
ANEQ441.description: Describe, understand and integrate the newest scientific principles in equine sciences with equine management.

ANEQ442.title: Riding Instructor Training
ANEQ442.description: Teaching techniques; theory; handling of large mounted groups, beginner through advanced levels.

ANEQ443.title: Applied Equine Nutrition
ANEQ443.description: Applying principles of nutrition to feeding horses in different physiological states in an effort to promote their health and well-being.

ANEQ444.title: Equine Business Management
ANEQ444.description: Real life" equine industry experience and the ins and outs of managing an equine facility/business.

ANEQ445.title: Foaling Management
ANEQ445.description: Management of the foaling mare and newborn foal; monitoring techniques, preventative and emergency care procedures.

ANEQ448.title: Livestock Manure Management and Environment
ANEQ448.description: Manure management; maximizing benefits to soils and crops; minimizing air and water quality hazards; complying with regulations.

ANEQ450.title: Processed Meats
ANEQ450.description: Physical, chemical and functional characteristics of meat raw materials. Science and technology of value-added processing including curing, sausage manufacture, low moisture products, and restructuring. Quality assurance and related current industry topics.

ANEQ460.title: Meat Safety
ANEQ460.description: Meat safety;  food borne pathogens; hazard analysis critical control points (HACCP) and total quality management (TQM) practices.

ANEQ470.title: Meat Processing Systems
ANEQ470.description: Advanced understanding of the manufacturing, packaging, distribution, storage, and cooking of meat products.

ANEQ472.title: Sheep Systems
ANEQ472.description: Sheep production under farm and ranch conditions; products, breeds, breeding, nutrition, reproduction, and management systems.

ANEQ473.title: Dairy Systems
ANEQ473.description: Integration of nutrition, genetics, physiology, and economics for management decisions of dairy farm operations and production and marketing of milk.

ANEQ474.title: Swine Systems
ANEQ474.description: Production of purebred and commercial swine; breeds, breeding, feeding, marketing, and management.

ANEQ475.title: Travel Abroad-Animal Agriculture
ANEQ475.description: Onsite evaluation of international animal agriculture systems with emphasis on production, marketing, and management.

ANEQ476.title: Feedlot Systems
ANEQ476.description: Feedlot facilities;  nutrition;  procurement;  merchandising;  handling;  processing cattle;  health care;  custom feeding; managerial duties.

ANEQ478.title: Beef Systems
ANEQ478.description: Beef production as related to consumer through seedstock segments. Major emphasis on cow-calf management.

ANEQ486.title: Therapeutic Riding Instructor Practicum
ANEQ486.description: Mentor-guided teaching hours to students preparing for the PATH International Instructor examination.

ANEQ500.title: Recent Developments
ANEQ500.description: Recent developments in animal science, avian science, and food technology.

ANEQ505.title: Microbiome of Animal Systems
ANEQ505.description: Provides background knowledge, and practical skills required for analyzing microbiome data sets. Technical issues such as primer choice, sequence variant vs OTU picking, rarefaction vs CSS, and study effects are discussed.

ANEQ510.title: Bovine Reproduction Management
ANEQ510.description: Role of reproduction in economic efficiency of cattle production systems. Causes of delayed breeding and nonpregnancy, abortion and perinatal mortality.

ANEQ522.title: Animal Metabolism
ANEQ522.description: Nutrient digestion, absorption, transport and metabolism in monogastric and ruminant domestic species as affected by physiological changes.

ANEQ525.title: Advanced Meat Science
ANEQ525.description: Advanced study of fundamental and biochemical basis of meat quality.

ANEQ531.title: Applied Bovine Respiratory Disease Management
ANEQ531.description: Economic significance, management and measurement of bovine respiratory disease; introduction to genetic influence on susceptibility.

ANEQ532.title: Genetics of Bovine Respiratory Disease
ANEQ532.description: Quantitative and molecular perspectives on the genetics of susceptibility to bovine respiratory disease (BRD); genetic improvement in BRD susceptibility.

ANEQ533.title: Marker and Gene Assisted Selection
ANEQ533.description: Approaches to including DNA marker and gene information into livestock selection decisions to improve accuracy and rate of genetic improvement.

ANEQ534.title: Markers to Gene Function - Functional Change
ANEQ534.description: Results of marker association analyses are expanded to how sequence polymorphisms translate into functional changes in the animal genome and variation in animal performance. Topics include an introduction to the tools used to generate multi-omics data and how these data are used in genetic evaluation and animal improvement programs.

ANEQ535.title: Genetic Prediction in Livestock
ANEQ535.description: Emphasizes approaches to genetic prediction in livestock focusing on the use of mixed models and best linear unbiased prediction.

ANEQ536.title: Livestock Variance Component Estimation
ANEQ536.description: Emphasizes approaches to estimation of (co)variance components and genetic parameters required to solve mixed models in livestock genetics.

ANEQ545.title: Molecular Methods in Animal Genetics
ANEQ545.description: Hands-on learning exercises to help develop technical skills and conceptual understanding for critical evaluation of animal genetics at the molecular level. Practical experience in classical and modern genetics laboratory techniques as well as an appreciation for when these techniques should be applied and how to interpret the results.

ANEQ548.title: Issues in Manure Management
ANEQ548.description: Manure management practices maximizing benefits to soils and crops while minimizing hazards to air and water quality and complying with regulations.

ANEQ550A.title: Basic Research Surgery: Farm Animal
ANEQ550A.description: Basic principles and techniques of animal surgery to meet ACUC requirements for experimental procedures.

ANEQ550B.title: Basic Research Surgery: Rodent
ANEQ550B.description: Basic principles and techniques of animal surgery to meet ACUC requirements for experimental procedures.

ANEQ551.title: Field Necropsy
ANEQ551.description: Field necropsy techniques for collection of animal tissues for submission to a diagnostic laboratory.

ANEQ565.title: Interpreting Animal Science Research
ANEQ565.description: Designing, conducting, analyzing, and reporting of animal science research.

ANEQ567.title: HACCP Meat Safety
ANEQ567.description: Control of health problems in meat products through hazard analysis critical control point (HACCP) and total quality management (TQM) practices.

ANEQ575.title: Computational Biology in Animal Breeding
ANEQ575.description: Numerical analysis and use of computers to solve problems in animal improvement.

ANEQ610.title: Hormonal Regulation of Growth
ANEQ610.description: Cellular and molecular regulation of animal growth by hormones and growth factors.

ANEQ621.title: Vitamin and Mineral Metabolism
ANEQ621.description: Vitamin and mineral metabolism in domestic animals.

ANEQ626.title: Animal Nutrition, Emissions, and Management
ANEQ626.description: Nutrients and nutrient function required to support animal life through all physiological states and assessment of the impacts on gaseous emissions from these animals.

ANEQ631.title: Selection Index Theory
ANEQ631.description: Quantitative methods for genetic evaluation: selection index theory and introduction to best linear unbiased prediction.

ANEQ660.title: Topics in Meat Safety
ANEQ660.description: Topics of current concern in meat safety.

ANEQ676.title: Molecular Approaches to Food Safety
ANEQ676.description: Molecular subtyping, tracking, and control; molecular ecology and evolution of food-borne pathogens; molecular pathogenesis of food-borne diseases.

ANEQ720.title: Nutritional Energetics
ANEQ720.description: Dietary energy use to meet animal requirements for maintenance, growth, pregnancy, and lactation; environmental, nutritional, and physiological effects.

ANEQ725.title: Rumen Metabolism
ANEQ725.description: Microbial degradation, transformation, and synthesis of ingested nutrients;  feed particle passage kinetics in the rumen.

ANEQ730.title: Advances in Cattle Breeding
ANEQ730.description: Literature and research methods in beef cattle breeding.

ANEQ731.title: Advanced Genetic Prediction
ANEQ731.description: Models and methods for prediction of genetic merit in livestock populations.

ANEQ792H.title: Seminar: Livestock Behavior and Welfare
ANEQ792H.description: Issues in the field of livestock behavior and welfare.

ANTH100.title: Introductory Cultural Anthropology (GT-SS3)
ANTH100.description: Human societies and their cultural setting; variation in beliefs, social customs, and technologies; human differences in anthropological terms.

ANTH101.title: Practicing Anthropology
ANTH101.description: Familiarizes majors with the sub-fields of anthropology and provides an overview via practical exercises of foundational skills necessary for success in the anthropology major, CSU, and beyond. Topics include critical thinking and writing, conducting research, scholarly communication, and professional career development, with attention to how these apply to anthropology in particular.

ANTH120.title: Human Origins and Variation (GT-SC2)
ANTH120.description: Mechanisms of evolution; genetics. Living primate biology, behavior, and history. Human evolutionary history. Human variation and adaptation.

ANTH121.title: Human Origins and Variation Laboratory (GT-SC1)
ANTH121.description: Labs demonstrating genetic and evolutionary processes, comparative skeletal anatomy, human evolution through fossil casts, and modern human variation.

ANTH140.title: Introduction to Archaeology (GT-HI1)
ANTH140.description: Origins of human society from the Stone Age to urban civilization using architecture, art, tools, and other material remains.

ANTH200.title: Cultures and the Global System (GT-SS3)
ANTH200.description: Analyze diversity of smaller-scale societies, and cultural responses and adaptations to emerging global trends.

ANTH225.title: Anthropology of the Arts
ANTH225.description: Explores the arts (both visual and performing) from the perspective of cultural anthropology. What is art and how is the category differently constructed cross-culturally? Why and how do people make, consume, and identify with expressive culture? How can the visual and performing arts help us to develop a deeper understanding of how human beings make meaning? Read a variety of ethnographic texts that illuminate these and related questions.

ANTH235.title: Indigenous Peoples of North America
ANTH235.description: Explores Native groups of North America from an anthropological perspective, and utilizes a culture area framework as a basis for investigation. Culture area framework is largely based on historical material–how these people have lived in the recent past. Evaluating how these groups live in the present. Contemporary issues, globalization, and local responses to local concerns.

ANTH240.title: Museum and Cultural Heritage Studies
ANTH240.description: Introduction to basic theory and organization of museums and cultural heritage sites including their history, their role in society as places of preservation and education, exhibitions and interpretation, and the relationship between museums and cultural heritage sites and the communities they serve. Emphasis on defining the role of anthropology in today’s museums and cultural heritage sites and multidisciplinary approaches to curation.

ANTH260.title: Introduction to Field Archaeology
ANTH260.description: Field methods including map preparation and interpretation, site location and recording, site excavation, and stratigraphy.

ANTH274.title: Human Diversity (GT-SC2)
ANTH274.description: Explore human diversity, both physical and genetic, within an evolutionary framework. The scientific method is applied to the sociocultural contexts that give rise to prejudices in order to critically evaluate misconceptions regarding race, gender, and human behaviors deemed 'natural’. Approaching human diversity from an evolutionary perspective dismantles biases that justify prejudice and result in unequal access to power and resources as well as negative health impacts.

ANTH310.title: Peoples and Cultures of Africa
ANTH310.description: Sub-Saharan lifestyles including marriage and family, traditional government, religion and magic, ecology and economy, art, music, and literature.

ANTH312.title: Modern Indian Culture and Society
ANTH312.description: Anthropological contributions to the understanding of contemporary India.

ANTH313.title: Modernization and Development
ANTH313.description: Processes by which cultures change and modernize, 1989 to the present.

ANTH314.title: Southeast Asian Cultures and Societies
ANTH314.description: Colonial and post-colonial cultures, globalization processes, and changing ethnic and gender identities in Southeast Asian societies.

ANTH315.title: Global Mobilities–The African Diaspora
ANTH315.description: Globalization and transnationalism with a focus on the circulation of people, ideas, and cultural products and practices between Africa and the rest of the world. By situating Africans as both producers and consumers of transnational ideas and products, we will develop an understanding of Africa beyond popular representations of violence and crisis.

ANTH317.title: Anthropology of Human Rights
ANTH317.description: Human rights from the perspective of cultural anthropology through its theoretical and practical dimensions. Contemporary human rights debates within the context of cultural plurality in a globalized world. Engages the intersection between global dynamics and community experiences by addressing the human rights dimensions of refugees and migration, indigenous communities, women and children, health, religious practices, among others.

ANTH322.title: The Anthropology of Religion
ANTH322.description: Major anthropological theories and descriptions of religious beliefs and practices. Religion in a cross-cultural and evolutionary perspective.

ANTH329.title: Cultural Change
ANTH329.description: Cultural change and effects of directed global forces; colonial origins of underdevelopment on small-scale societies.

ANTH330.title: Human Ecology
ANTH330.description: Roles of technology, economics, social organization, and ideology in human adaptations to and survival in natural and cultural environments.

ANTH333.title: Anthropology of Sex and Reproduction
ANTH333.description: Contemporary scholarship on issues in the anthropology of reproduction, including the relationship between production and reproduction and between the corporeal body and the body politic, the disciplinary power of the state, public controversies such as abortion and maternal-fetal conflict, and the symbolism and metaphors of procreation and parenthood. We will use "reproduction" as an analytic strategy to shed light on the cultural politics of gender, power, and sexuality.

ANTH334.title: Narrative Traditions and Social Experience
ANTH334.description: Relationship between narrative traditions and social contexts of their creation.

ANTH335.title: Language and Culture
ANTH335.description: Human language and primate communication, nonverbal channels, sociolinguistics, and language change.

ANTH336.title: Art and Culture
ANTH336.description: Art expression is a defining factor in cultural identity and representation in a modern world where geographical and political borders are diminishing.

ANTH338.title: Gender and Anthropology
ANTH338.description: Theory, themes, and debates in anthropological gender studies, ethnographic survey of women and men cross-culturally.

ANTH340.title: Medical Anthropology
ANTH340.description: Cultural adaptation to disease; non-Western theories of health and disease; categories, causes, cures; learned roles of patients and healers.

ANTH343.title: Applied Medical Anthropology
ANTH343.description: How and why we get sick and what sickness means from biological, social and cultural perspectives.

ANTH350.title: Archaeology of North America
ANTH350.description: Native American life, tools, architecture, religion, food-getting from cultures of 12,000 years ago or earlier until European contact.

ANTH351.title: Archaeology of Europe and Africa
ANTH351.description: Human culture, tools, art, religion, social life, subsistence, and paleoecology from 4 million B.C. to 1200 B.C. in the Old World.

ANTH352.title: Geoarchaeology
ANTH352.description: Analytical techniques, concepts, and field methodologies from the earth sciences to better understand the archaeological record.

ANTH353.title: Archaeology of Rock Art
ANTH353.description: Study of prehistoric and recent rock art worldwide from an anthropological and cross-cultural perspective. Provide a strong understanding of what rock art is, how it is recorded, analyzed, and interpreted by archaeologists, and why ancient symbolism and sites are considered important in contemporary society.

ANTH358.title: Archaeologies of Graffiti
ANTH358.description: An in-depth examination of graffiti as a human social behavior and form of material culture in the past and present. Examines the form, function, and context of graffiti across cultures and through time, with regard to the circumstances of its creation. Addresses what lies behind the human urge to leave a mark.

ANTH359.title: Colorado Prehistory
ANTH359.description: Human behavioral responses to environmental diversity, cultural adaptation, Pleistocene and recent climates, anthropogenic environmental change.

ANTH360.title: Archaeological Investigation
ANTH360.description: Investigation of the archaeological record, how the record was formed, and how archaeological data are analyzed and interpreted.

ANTH365.title: Quantifying Anthropology
ANTH365.description: Managing, quantifying and illustrating anthropological data-sets with appropriate software.

ANTH370.title: Primates
ANTH370.description: Behavioral patterns, ecological relationships, and communication of nonhuman primates.

ANTH371.title: Growing Up Primate
ANTH371.description: Primates generally have extended periods of growth compared to other mammals; however, there is considerable variation across the Primate Order. Evolution of primate growth and reproductive strategies, critically evaluates current models of life history variation, examines the ways that primate taxa negotiate trade offs (e.g. current versus future reproduction), and explains the role of human sociality in the evolution of our unique life history parameters.

ANTH372.title: Human Osteology
ANTH372.description: Human bones and teeth in a review of functional human evolution.

ANTH373.title: Human Evolution
ANTH373.description: Current topics and debates in human evolution concentrating on biocultural changes in the human lineage.

ANTH374.title: Human Biological Variation
ANTH374.description: Biological diversity of human populations; history of development of race concept.

ANTH375.title: Evolution of Primate Behavior
ANTH375.description: Primate behavior from an evolutionary perspective, drawing on a variety of studies of humans, primates, and mammals.

ANTH376.title: Evolution of Human Adaptation
ANTH376.description: Unique characteristics of humans: bipedalism, encephalization, dentition, birth process, an attenuated period of development.

ANTH377.title: Anthropology Perspectives-Evolution, Society
ANTH377.description: Evolutionary science in educating the public is investigated and anthropological knowledge of human evolutionary biology is examined.

ANTH378.title: Bipedal Apes
ANTH378.description: Human bipedal walking within a comparative framework of primate locomotion and anatomy. Specific focus is on kinematics and kinetics of soft- and hard-tissues including analysis of extant primate locomotion, morphology, and development. Discussions focus on debates in primate functional anatomy and locomotion including hypotheses surrounding the origins and evolution bipedal walking and running and possible maladaptations of being a human biped.

ANTH379.title: Evolutionary Medicine and Human Health
ANTH379.description: Evolutionary medicine refers to the application of evolutionary theory to the study of human health, disease, and modern medicine. This theoretical perspective provides a deeper lens with which to investigate health, moves us beyond mechanistic explanations of disease, and constructs an anthropological framework for interpreting the evolution of human physiological diversity.

ANTH401.title: Psychological Anthropology Laboratory
ANTH401.description: Practical research techniques drawn from psychological and cognitive anthropology for investigating the relationship between shared group culture and individual thought and practice. Mixed qualitative and quantitative methods, including using field observations, interviews, and surveys to illuminate "cultural domains" of thought. Emphasis on collaborative group research and hands-on training involving actual field research and data collection and analysis via appropriate software packages.

ANTH405.title: Public Anthropology and Global Challenges
ANTH405.description: Value of taking scholarship to the communities. Public scholarship is pointed at many publics and intended to engage actively in the process of solving urgent problems in contrast to traditional scholarship. Focus on the public discourse that addresses disasters, climate change, and global health issues. Critical look at how academic knowledge in these realms serves the public interest.

ANTH411.title: Indians of South America
ANTH411.description: Ethnographic and cultural characteristics of South American indigenous groups and the current critical issues they face.

ANTH412.title: Indians of North America
ANTH412.description: Native American peoples, their cultural variation across the continent, and cultural encounters with colonial expansion.

ANTH413.title: Indigenous Peoples Today
ANTH413.description: Contemporary cultural and social issues of indigenous peoples around the globe, including North and South American Indians and Australian Aborigines.

ANTH415.title: Indigenous Ecologies and the Modern World
ANTH415.description: Impact of the modern world in indigenous peoples' relationship to their environments and natural resources.

ANTH416.title: Gender, Culture, and Health
ANTH416.description: Examine the role of anthropology in current global health issues paying particular attention to culture and gender.

ANTH417.title: Indigenous Environmental Stewardship
ANTH417.description: Sustainability and environmental stewardship are not necessarily modern day concepts. Indigenous peoples of North America have established traditions and beliefs about harmony and kinship with nature. Focus upon stories and belief systems and their influence upon culture, economics, politics, American history, environmental justice and law.

ANTH420.title: Digital Digging--Geophysics in Archaeology
ANTH420.description: Introduction to the geophysical methods archaeologists use to prospect for new sites, and develop new questions for known sites. Examines how common geophysical methods work to detect subsurface signatures for human activity. Provides hands-on experience in data collection, processing, and analysis for multiple instruments. Presents diverse theoretical perspectives from the social sciences that can be applied to interpret subsurface spatial signatures at archaeological sites.

ANTH423.title: Cultural Psychiatry
ANTH423.description: Social determinants of mental health. Cross-cultural health and healing. Cultural contexts of U.S./Western and Indigenous/non-Western psychiatries.

ANTH430A.title: Study Abroad--South Africa: Communities and Conservation

ANTH438.title: Approaches to Community-Based Development
ANTH438.description: Explores the structure and practice of community development globally, engaging in critical analysis of different approaches and their impact.

ANTH439.title: Community Mobilization
ANTH439.description: Structural, social, and psychological barriers that inhibit cooperation and collective action.

ANTH440.title: Theory in Cultural Anthropology
ANTH440.description: Theoretical paradigms used to explain culture including evolutionary, functional, ecological, political economy, postmodernism, and hegemony.

ANTH441.title: Method in Cultural Anthropology
ANTH441.description: Methodological orientations and research techniques. Ethnographic and cross-cultural approaches including quantitative and formal models.

ANTH442.title: Ethnographic Field School
ANTH442.description: Directed fieldwork with American Indian communities; methodology, protocols, and social relations of ethnographic field research.

ANTH443.title: Ethnographic Field Methods
ANTH443.description: Directed experiential preparation for applied ethnographic field methods and research questions.

ANTH444.title: Cultures of Virtual Worlds–Research Methods
ANTH444.description: Methodologies and directed research related to virtual worlds and internet, gaming, play, and fan communities.

ANTH445.title: Psychological Anthropology
ANTH445.description: Cross-cultural exploration of the human mind by studying the ideas, desires, and practices of individuals in various sociocultural settings.

ANTH446.title: New Orleans and the Caribbean
ANTH446.description: New Orleans and the Caribbean connections through colonization, slavery, modernity, legacies of race, gender and class, the expressive arts.

ANTH447.title: Gender Equity in Development
ANTH447.description: Various forms of women's power, and potentials for disempowerment within the context of international development.

ANTH448.title: Development and Empowerment
ANTH448.description: Development as an economic process of wealth accumulation, as well as a socio-political process of empowerment.

ANTH449.title: Community Development from the Ground Up
ANTH449.description: Participatory methods in the monitoring and evaluation of development projects, where multiple stakeholders are involved in the process.

ANTH450.title: Hunter-Gatherer Ecology
ANTH450.description: Development of anthropological method and theory; study of contemporary and prehistoric foraging peoples.

ANTH451.title: Andean Archaeology and Ethnohistory
ANTH451.description: Prehistory and colonial experiences of native Andean peoples.

ANTH452.title: Archaeology of Mesoamerica
ANTH452.description: Ancient cultures and civilizations in Middle America.

ANTH453.title: Impacts on Ancient Environments
ANTH453.description: Major issues and case studies in the archaeology of ancient human societies and their environmental impacts.

ANTH454.title: Anthropological Perspectives on Food
ANTH454.description: A long term perspective on the political economy of human food ways from ancient hunter-gatherers to the present. Topics will include foraging practices, domestication, feasting and emergent social complexity, the role of food in ancient states, and globalization, as well as the modern food economy. Lectures and readings will be based on research in archaeology, cultural anthropology, and biological anthropology.

ANTH455.title: Great Plains Archaeology
ANTH455.description: Prehistoric people on Great Plains from earliest hunter-gatherers to historic contact; cultural responses to changing conditions.

ANTH456.title: Archaeology and the Public
ANTH456.description: Applied archaeology in public settings, including publication, museum display, education, the illicit artifact trade, and other ethical issues.

ANTH457.title: Lithic Technology
ANTH457.description: Method and theory behind production, use, and discard of stone tools by prehistoric peoples. Hands-on application in laboratory setting.

ANTH458.title: Archaeology and Cultural Resource Management
ANTH458.description: Cultural Resource Management as a career, the network of regulations that form the backbone of the industry, and the process for conducting a CRM investigation as an archaeologist. Topics include cultural resource legislation, project planning, execution, management, client communications, site analysis and evaluation, effects determinations, and agency and tribal consultations. Topical issues including case studies and industry trends will be explored.

ANTH459.title: Mediterranean Archaeology
ANTH459.description: Contextualization of historical and socio-political trends, influences, and impetuses converge to a holistic understanding of what it meant to be a Greek or Roman from c. 1300 BCE – 330 CE. Basic sets of evidence available to scholars of this world (archaeology, epigraphy, philology, glyptic, etc.), and how Mediterranean archaeologists have historically approached this evidence.

ANTH460.title: Field Class in Archaeology
ANTH460.description: Directed fieldwork in local archaeology, site survey, and excavation; recovery, preservation, cataloging, analysis of artifactual and skeletal materials.

ANTH461.title: Anthropological Report Preparation
ANTH461.description: Producing written and oral presentations for anthropological research, employment, or graduate work. Grant writing and manuscript preparation.

ANTH462.title: Anthropology Curation and Exhibition Methods
ANTH462.description: Current methods and ethics in museum curation, conservation, collections management policies and procedures, exhibition development, and other tasks associated with managing, preserving and displaying anthropological collections (both artifacts and their associated documentation). Practical, hands-on experience in artifact care, management, preservation, and exhibition development.

ANTH465.title: Zooarchaeology
ANTH465.description: Analysis of animal bones from archaeological sites to develop interpretations of past human behavior.

ANTH469.title: Archaeology Seminar in Mesopotamian Prehistory
ANTH469.description: Origins of human society from the stone age to urban civilizations using architecture, art, tools, and other material remains.

ANTH470.title: Paleontology Field School
ANTH470.description: Field methods in fossil excavation, preservation, and curation; the evolution of the primate order.

ANTH472.title: Human Biology
ANTH472.description: Human biological responses to environmental conditions and constraints including diet, nutrition, disease, climate, culture change, and urbanization.

ANTH473.title: The Neandertals
ANTH473.description: Socio-historical foundations of questions regarding Neandertal paleobiology and culture and the Neandertal role in the evolution of Homo sapiens.

ANTH474.title: Human Skeleton Analysis
ANTH474.description: Focus on methods and techniques used to reconstruct identity and behavior from the human skeleton applicable to all areas of skeletal biology, including bioarchaeology, paleoanthropology, and forensic anthropology.

ANTH475.title: Methods of Analysis in Paleoanthropology
ANTH475.description: Practical discussion of techniques used to reconstruct dietary and locomotor behavior and evolutionary relationships in human fossil remains.

ANTH482A.title: Study Abroad: Communities and Conservation in South Africa

ANTH486.title: Practicum
ANTH486.description: Application of anthropological methods under actual project conditions.

ANTH487.title: Internship
ANTH487.description: Academic-based work experience with selected organizations or agencies.  Supervised application of anthropological principles.

ANTH493.title: Capstone Seminar
ANTH493.description: Linkages between anthropological subfields and how professional anthropologists approach issues.

ANTH501.title: Psychiatric Anthropology Laboratory
ANTH501.description: Use tools from psychiatric anthropology to construct culturally-sensitive scales for assessing mental health and subjective well-being. Mixed qualitative and quantitative methods, including using field observations, interviews, and surveys to build and assess well-being measures. Emphasis on collaborative group research and hands-on training involving field research and data collection and analysis via appropriate software packages.

ANTH505.title: Resilience, Well-Being, and Social Justice
