ANTH505.description: Concepts of resilience, well-being, and social justice in the context of a rapidly changing planet. These concepts are rarely integrated yet each is understood to help diagnose, measure, and solve global-scale problems. Engagement with many views from many fields, including the anthropological lens of a community-level scale, cross-cultural comparison, and holistic analyses.

ANTH515.title: Culture and Environment
ANTH515.description: Theoretical accounts of societies' variable relationships to their environments, indigenous peoples' interactions with nature in context of modernity.

ANTH520.title: Women, Health, and Culture
ANTH520.description: Women's experiences and interpretations of their health; cultural, political, and economic forces affecting women's health.

ANTH521.title: Gender, Sexuality, and Culture
ANTH521.description: Gender and sexuality cross-culturally; theory, cultural constructions, colonialism, class, race, ethnicity, health, violence.

ANTH528.title: Economic Anthropology
ANTH528.description: Theoretical approaches to the cultural context of economic activity.

ANTH529.title: Anthropology and Sustainable Development
ANTH529.description: Global development goals, poverty and hunger, environmental sustainability, education, and equity.

ANTH530.title: Human-Environment Interactions
ANTH530.description: Paradigms and concepts in ecological anthropology with an emphasis on adaptation and resilience.

ANTH532.title: The Culture of Disaster
ANTH532.description: Study of how the human impacts of disaster and the process of recovery are shaped by cultural as well as structural realities.

ANTH535.title: Globalization and Culture Change
ANTH535.description: Evolving paradigms and patterns of globalization and international development; cultural responses -- resistance, dependency, fragmented identities.

ANTH538.title: Food, Hunger, and Culture
ANTH538.description: Explores cultural and social understandings of food cross-culturally, including the symbolic meanings that people attribute to food and its consumption. Critically investigates the intersecting political, economic, social, and cultural influences on hunger, malnutrition, and other health concerns associated with food and nutrition globally. Assesses applied anthropological approaches to reducing hunger and other nutrition related health problems.

ANTH539.title: Anthropology of Modernity
ANTH539.description: Critical examination of the institutions, values, and processes which constitute the modern world. Impact of modern forces on "traditional" peoples.

ANTH540.title: Medical Anthropology
ANTH540.description: Cultural and biocultural approaches to health, illness, and the body; theory and application in medical anthropology.

ANTH541.title: Seminar in Archaeological Method
ANTH541.description: Methods of archaeological recovery and interpretation, and process of archaeological analysis and reporting.

ANTH542.title: Seminar in Archaeological Theory
ANTH542.description: Theories of recovery, reconstruction, and interpretation of the archaeological record.

ANTH543.title: Foundations of Ethnographic Research
ANTH543.description: Mixed qualitative and quantitative field methods to address practical real-world issues. Emphasis on linking theory and method, project formulation, hands-on experience with data collection and analysis, and practical applications such as preparing thesis/dissertation proposals and writing grants. Discussion of a range of anthropological approaches to field research, including applied, public, collaborative, participatory, and community-based ethnographic research.

ANTH544.title: From Death to Discovery
ANTH544.description: Theoretical perspectives on the decay and fossilization of organisms between their death and discovery.

ANTH545.title: Global Mental Health--Theory and Method
ANTH545.description: Cross-cultural study of mental health and healing; cultural, clinical, and biological perspectives; integration of theory and method.

ANTH546.title: Culture, Mind, and Cognitive Science
ANTH546.description: Anthropological contributions to cognitive science. Culture, mind, and social context. Theory building and practical applications.

ANTH547.title: Mind, Medicine, and Culture
ANTH547.description: Cultural-psychological influences on health and healing; mind-body medicine; complementary and alternative medicine; indigenous and spiritual healing.

ANTH548.title: Theoretical Topics in Cultural Anthropology
ANTH548.description: Major theoretical currents in cultural anthropology from the 19th-century to the present. Classical theory alongside contemporary texts that revise or revisit early works. Focus on some major theories and themes that are important in cultural anthropology since the 1960s.

ANTH551.title: Historical Archaeology
ANTH551.description: Theory, methods, and issues in historical archaeology.

ANTH552.title: Geoarchaeology
ANTH552.description: Application of analytical techniques, concepts, and field methods drawn from the earth sciences to help solve archaeological problems. Issues explored include human and environmental processes involved in archaeological site formation, the sedimentary context of archaeological remains, soils and sediments relevant to archaeology, the relationship between past settlement and landscape evolution, paleoclimatic reconstruction, and human effects on the environment.

ANTH553.title: Archaeology of Complex Societies
ANTH553.description: Issues in development and organization of complex societies with emphasis on the Americas.

ANTH555.title: Paleoindian Archaeology
ANTH555.description: Archaeology of the Americas during late Pleistocene/early Holocene; background and development of contemporary models.

ANTH566.title: Field Methods Training in Online Environments
ANTH566.description: Collaborative analysis of ethnographic field data collected in online virtual worlds; mixed methods applicable to other built and natural places.

ANTH570.title: Contemporary Issues-Biological Anthropology
ANTH570.description: Theory and applications in biological anthropology focusing on syntheses and interpretations of human biology, variation, adaptability, and evolution.

ANTH571.title: Anthropology and Global Health
ANTH571.description: Global health concerns and problems including poverty, urbanization, malnutrition, diet, war and refugees, climate, and environment.

ANTH572.title: Human Origins
ANTH572.description: Major trends in human evolution through use of detailed case studies and regionally focused primary research.

ANTH573.title: Paleoclimate and Human Evolution
ANTH573.description: Methods used to reconstruct past environments and understand the effects of past climate on the major trends of human evolution.

ANTH617.title: Place, Space and Adaptation
ANTH617.description: Critical evaluation of the nexus between space, society and environment. An interdisciplinary approach to studying the ways biological, material, historical, political-economic and cultural processes combine to shape human-environment relationships in place-based contexts.

ANTH660.title: Field Archaeology
ANTH660.description: Field applications of nondestructive survey methods, advanced cartographic and excavation methods, project supervision skills.

ANTH674.title: Research Design and Analysis in Anthropology
ANTH674.description: Learn how to formulate anthropological research questions, design a research project, organize and analyze data, and visualize and interpret results.

ANTH686.title: Practicum-Field Archaeology
ANTH686.description: Direction of anthropological fieldwork under professional supervision.

ANTH692.title: Seminar
ANTH692.description: Current trends of research in archaeology; cultural and physical anthropology.

ANTH696.title: Group Study-Anthropological Theory
ANTH696.description: Intensive analysis of selected topics and theories in anthropology, both historical and contemporary.

ANTH792.title: Special Topics in Anthropology
ANTH792.description: A seminar course offering special topics each time the course is taught. Recent readings from the literature will be used to foster discussion.

AM101.title: Fashion Industries
AM101.description: Development, organization, and trends of domestic and foreign fashion industries.

AM110.title: Apparel and Merchandising Digital Technology
AM110.description: Introduction to computer technologies used in apparel and merchandising industries.

AM130.title: Awareness and Appreciation of Design
AM130.description: Awareness and appreciation of design as it exists in the context of everyday life and is expressive of cultural character and human creativity. Awareness and appreciation of design comes as a natural consequence of learning how to recognize and interpret the elements from which it is created.

AM143.title: Introduction to Apparel Design
AM143.description: Apparel and garment-pattern development, construction, quality, skill development in technical drawing and rendering.

AM240.title: Computer-Aided Apparel Design
AM240.description: Apparel design using the computer to generate drawings for fabric, graphic logo, and apparel.

AM241.title: Patternmaking I - Flat Pattern
AM241.description: Application of patternmaking techniques including sloper drafting and flat pattern manipulation methods for apparel products. Design and construction of original garments using flat pattern manipulation methods to analyze garment fit.

AM243.title: Adobe Photoshop for Textile Design
AM243.description: Textile design using Adobe Photoshop to generate drawings for surface and structural textile design.

AM244.title: Fashion Illustration
AM244.description: Illustration skills using traditional media/computer aided design applications and analysis of visual communication.

AM250.title: Clothing, Adornment and Human Behavior (GT-SS3)
AM250.description: Psychological, sociological and cultural factors influencing clothing and adornment.

AM270.title: Merchandising Processes
AM270.description: Forecasting, planning, developing, and presenting merchandise lines to meet target market demands.

AM275.title: Product Development I
AM275.description: Fundamental techniques and skills applied to the development of apparel and textile products.

AM321.title: Advanced Textiles
AM321.description: Textile product serviceability; effect of fiber structure on properties and performance; new developments.

AM330.title: Global Sourcing of Textiles and Apparel
AM330.description: Structure of textiles and apparel industry; global sourcing, production, distribution and consumption of textile and apparel products. Implications for sustainability in the textiles and apparel industry.

AM335.title: Textiles and Apparel Supply Chains
AM335.description: Managing the flow of materials, information, and finances as they move in a process from supplier to retailers and consumers in a global environment.

AM340.title: Patternmaking II - Draping
AM340.description: Apparel designing through basic draping techniques.

AM341.title: Patternmaking III - Computer-Aided Design
AM341.description: Computer-aided design (CAD) technology used in apparel sketching, pattern drafting, grading, and marker making.

AM342.title: Computer-Aided Textile Design
AM342.description: Ethnic textile design traditions and current approaches to textile production in industry and in individual design studios; computer-aided technology and multicultural research used to create repeat, knit, and woven textile designs.

AM344.title: Adobe Illustrator for Apparel Design
AM344.description: Apparel design using Adobe Illustrator to generate drawings for garment technical sketching, fashion illustration, and graphic logos.

AM346.title: Apparel Line Concept Development and Planning
AM346.description: Use of computer-aided design software to transfer apparel design concepts to garment pattern completion. Develop ideation sketches, fashion illustrations, technical flat drawings, and garment patterns for an original design line.

AM363.title: Historic Costume
AM363.description: Influence of social, political, and economic conditions on costume of predynastic Egypt to present time.

AM364.title: History of Fashion Designers/Manufacturers
AM364.description: Fashion designers and manufacturers who established the field and their contemporaries.

AM366.title: Merchandising Promotion
AM366.description: Activities used to influence sale of merchandise and services; to promote trends and ideas.

AM371.title: Merchandise Planning and Control
AM371.description: Retail mathematics for negotiating merchandise acquisition, distribution, and pricing for profitability.

AM373.title: Apparel Design and Retail Entrepreneurship
AM373.description: Entrepreneurship opportunities relative to apparel design, product development, and merchandising; development of understanding to initiate an apparel products and/or services business.

AM375.title: Product Development II
AM375.description: Product design and development for apparel and other soft goods through industry-driven projects.

AM421.title: Textiles Product Quality Assessment
AM421.description: Role of quality assurance in product development, production, performance, and user satisfaction with sewn products and the textile and other components of those products.

AM430.title: International Retailing
AM430.description: Application of retail principles to analyze the internationalization process of retailing.

AM446.title: Apparel Design and Production
AM446.description: Computer-aided design (CAD) technology used in apparel sketching, pattern drafting, grading and marker making; final portfolio preparation and review.

AM450.title: Social-Psychological Aspects of Clothing
AM450.description: Psychological and social factors influencing clothing and its effect on others.

AM460.title: Historic Textiles
AM460.description: Historic development of textiles from a global perspective, focusing on textiles produced by diverse cultures.

AM466.title: Retail Environment Design and Planning
AM466.description: Application of design/merchandising principles to retail selling environments, including traditional store design/layout, direct mail, and websites.

AM475.title: Product Development III
AM475.description: Technology-based product innovation for positive social and environmental impacts.

AM479.title: Merchandising Policies and Strategies
AM479.description: Examination of merchandising environment as influenced by internal and external factors contributing to production/acquisition, distribution, and retailing decisions in textiles and apparel industries.

AM495B.title: Independent Study: Apparel Design and Production

AM525.title: Application of Textile Technology to Design
AM525.description: Advanced study of textile technology in apparel, merchandising and interior design; recent advances in the field.

AM546.title: Theoretical Apparel Design
AM546.description: Applications of theoretical frameworks and computer-aided design techniques for the development of wearable and fiber art.

AM550.title: Appearance, Self, and Society
AM550.description: Analysis of social science theories and concepts as they apply to appearance and dress research.

AM572.title: Merchandising Theories and Strategies
AM572.description: Theoretical perspective on the design and development of merchandising strategies for U.S. and global production, distribution, and consumption.

STAR501.title: Data Wrangling/Visualization for Researchers
STAR501.description: Data manipulation in R, importing and exporting data, variable transformation, converting dataset formats, generating summary statistics, principles of effective graphs, data visualization methods, exploratory data analysis using graphics, multi-panel plotting, high-density plotting, 3D plotting.

STAR502.title: Multivariate Analysis for Researchers
STAR502.description: Multivariate ANOVA, principal components, factor analysis, cluster analysis, discriminant analysis.

STAR513.title: Regression Models for Researchers
STAR513.description: Model estimation and goodness of fit for linear models; confidence intervals for prediction and estimation; lack of fit, model diagnostics, transformations, model selection, influential observations, collinearity, interaction, polynomial regression, regression with dummy variables,weighted least squares, imputation.

STAR514.title: Experimental Design/Analysis for Researchers
STAR514.description: Analysis of variance, covariance, randomized block, latin square, factorial, balanced and unbalanced designs. Applications to agriculture, biosciences. Implementation in R and JMP.

STAR531.title: Generalized Regression Models for Researchers
STAR531.description: Categorical data analysis, estimation and testing for contingency tables, introduction to generalized linear models, logit and probit models for binary regression, extensions to nominal and ordinal multicategory responses, count data, Poisson and negative binomial regression, log-linear models.

STAR532.title: Mixed Models for Researchers
STAR532.description: Topics in linear models that have both fixed and random predictors: split-plot and related designs, mixed-effects factorials, repeated measures, random coefficients, and spatial models for designed experiments. Introduction to generalized linear and nonlinear mixed models.

STAR534.title: Machine Learning for Researchers
STAR534.description: K-means clustering, perceptron algorithm, evaluating model performance, neural networks, learning theory and dimension reduction.

STAR695.title: Independent Study in Applied Statistics
STAR695.description: Application of statistics to a student's specific research, guided by a statistician. Intended for students who are not in the Statistics department.

STAA551.title: Regression Models and Applications
STAA551.description: Model estimation and goodness of fit for linear models; confidence intervals for prediction and estimation; lack of fit, model diagnostics, transformations, model selection, influential observations, collinearity, interaction, weighted least squares, imputation.

STAA552.title: Generalized Regression Models
STAA552.description: Categorical data analysis, estimation and testing for contingency tables, introduction to generalized linear models, logit and probit models for binary regression, extensions to nominal and ordinal multicategory responses, count data, Poisson and negative binomial regression, log-linear models.

STAA553.title: Experimental Design
STAA553.description: Analysis of variance, covariance, randomized block, latin square, factorial, balanced and unbalanced designs. Applications to agriculture, biosciences. Implementation in SAS and R.

STAA554.title: Mixed Models
STAA554.description: Topics in linear models that have both fixed and random predictors: split-plot and related designs, mixed-effects factorials, repeated measures, random coefficients, and spatial models for designed experiments. Introduction to generalized linear and nonlinear mixed models. Statistical topics will be integrated with implementation in SAS and R.

STAA556.title: Statistical Consulting
STAA556.description: Effective consulting to meet with clients, analyze real data, and prepare reports.

STAA561.title: Probability with Applications
STAA561.description: Random variables, continuous and discrete distributions, expectations, joint and conditional distributions, moments and moment generating functions, transformations, order statistics.

STAA562.title: Mathematical Statistics with Applications
STAA562.description: Theory and applications of estimations, testing, and confidence intervals. Computer simulations, sampling from the normal distribution.

STAA565.title: Quantitative Reasoning
STAA565.description: Confounding, types of bias such as selection bias and regression effect bias, Simpson's paradox, experiments versus observational studies.

STAA566.title: Data Visualization Methods
STAA566.description: Principles of effective graphs, data visualization methods, grammar of graphics, multi-panel conditioning, exploratory data analysis using graphics, 3D plotting, ROC curves, data wrangling.

STAA567.title: Computational and Simulation Methods
STAA567.description: Statistical computation and simulation methods used to estimate probability distribution of non-standard test statistics, find estimators, test hypotheses, and compute confidence intervals. Optimization, bootstrapping, pivoting techniques.

STAA568.title: Topics Industrial/Organizational Statistics
STAA568.description: Six Sigma techniques, DMAIC, CT trees, VOC tools, data collection, process capability, capability metrics, graphical data exploration, and process control.

STAA571.title: Survey Statistics
STAA571.description: Survey design, simple random, stratified, and cluster samples. Estimation and variance estimation.

STAA572.title: Nonparametric Methods
STAA572.description: Rank-based methods, nonparametric inferential techniques, scatterplot smoothing, nonparametric function estimation, environmental applications.

STAA573.title: Analysis of Time Series
STAA573.description: Exploratory analysis of time series, including periodicity and trends, moving average and auto-regressive models, estimation and forecasting. Financial and environmental applications.

STAA574.title: Methods in Multivariate Analysis
STAA574.description: Multivariate ANOVA, principal components, factor analysis, cluster analysis, discrimination analysis.

STAA575.title: Applied Bayesian Statistics
STAA575.description: Bayesian analysis of statistical models, prior and posterior distributions, computing methods, interpretation.

STAA576.title: Methods in Spatial Statistics
STAA576.description: Covariance estimation, covariance/variogram models, spatial regression models, spatial prediction, spatial point patterns.

STAA577.title: Statistical Learning and Data Mining
STAA577.description: Applications-oriented overview into how to use statistical methods to do data mining, inference, and prediction.

STAA578.title: Machine Learning
STAA578.description: K-means clustering, perceptron algorithm, evaluating model performance, neural networks, learning theory and dimension reduction.

ART100.title: Introduction to the Visual Arts (GT-AH1)
ART100.description: Exploration of the development of visual arts.

ART105.title: Issues and Practices in Art
ART105.description: Current issues, practices, and resources in the visual arts; integration of unified vocabulary in various art disciplines.

ART110.title: Global Art History I
ART110.description: Art and architecture of the ancient world.

ART111.title: Global Art History II
ART111.description: Art and architecture in the era of global connection.

ART120.title: Foundations--Time and Structure
ART120.description: Establishes a foundational understanding of digital literacy as part of a creative practice through the development of experimental media artworks in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

ART135.title: Foundations - Form and Observation
ART135.description: Foundational understanding of visual literacy as part of a creative practice through the development of two-dimensional artworks exploring form through observational methods in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

ART136.title: Introduction to Figure Drawing
ART136.description: Human form as basis for self-expression through various drawing media.

ART160.title: Foundations - Color and Composition
ART160.description: Establishes a foundational understanding of color and composition as part of a creative practice through the development of artworks using two-dimensional methods in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

ART170.title: Foundations - Materials and Space
ART170.description: Establishes a foundational understanding of materials and space as part of a creative practice through the development of three-dimensional artworks in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

ART200.title: Media Arts in Context
ART200.description: History and contemporary practice of media-based arts. Addresses printmaking, graphic design, photography, film, video, computer-generated imagery, digital fabrication, and other cognate disciplines.

ART212.title: Global Art History III
ART212.description: Global modern and contemporary art and architecture.

ART230.title: Photo Image Making I
ART230.description: Photographic imagery as an art medium; exploration of silver-based (film) materials.

ART235.title: Intermediate Drawing I

ART240.title: Pottery I
ART240.description: Basic techniques of studio ceramics and wheel throwing; exploration of expressive potential in pottery.

ART245.title: Metalsmithing and Jewelry I
ART245.description: Basic metal techniques; forming and construction; surface treatment and finishing processes; behavior and mechanical properties of metals.

ART250.title: Fibers I
ART250.description: Fibers and fabric as expressive media; weaving and basic fiber structures; fabric painting and surface techniques.

ART253.title: Digital Fabrication
ART253.description: Practical and technical skills within a historical and theoretical context for using computers, in combination with traditional and analog fabrication processes, to shape physical materials and make creative works. Introduces 3D Computer Aided Design (CAD), Computer Aided Machining (CAM), and Computer Numeric Controlled (CNC) Machining including 3D printing, Laser Cutting, and CNC Routing/Milling.

ART255.title: Introduction to Graphic Design
ART255.description: Problems emphasizing typography, layout, symbols, illustration, and package design.

ART256.title: Introduction to Electronic Art
ART256.description: Introduction to digital media and internet-based design.

ART260.title: Painting I

ART265.title: Printmaking I-Intaglio and Relief
ART265.description: Problems in composition utilizing basic techniques and principles of printmaking processes.

ART266.title: History and Practice of Non-Toxic Printmaking
ART266.description: Brief history of traditional printmaking practices to provide exposure to contemporary non-toxic printmaking practices through a hands-on studio.

ART270.title: Sculpture I
ART270.description: Introduction to sculptural techniques and concepts.

ART309.title: Pre-Columbian Art of the Andes

ART311.description: Focuses on the arts of West and Central Africa from prehistory through contemporary visual expressions, and engages with current art historical theoretical approaches and practices in order to gain a nuanced understanding of the arts in these respective regions and their relationship to global art production.

ART312.title: Pre-Columbian Art of Mesoamerica
ART312.description: Artistic and architectural traditions of major ancient civilizations in Mesoamerica, including the Olmecs, Maya, Teotihuacanoes, Mixtecs, and Aztecs, from 1200 bce until the sixteenth-century conquest by Spain.

ART313.title: Art of East and Southern Africa
ART313.description: Arts of southern and East Africa from prehistory through contemporary visual expressions, and engages with current art historical theoretical approaches and practices to gain a nuanced understanding of the arts in these respective regions and their relationship to global art production.

ART314.description: Women as artists in history of art and women's media in art.

ART315.title: United States Art 1945-1980

ART316.title: Art of the Pacific

ART317.title: Native North American Art
ART317.description: Introduction to historic and contemporary art forms of Native North America, emphasizing the cultural and political contexts.

ART321A.description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

ART321B.description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

ART321C.description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

ART321D.title: Travel Abroad: Studio Workshop in Italy-Sculpture
ART321D.description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

ART351.title: Fibers III
ART351.description: Investigation of fibers and fabric as expressive media; research in historic textiles.

ART356.title: Illustration

ART357.description: Technical, conceptual, and historic aspects of creating interactive electronic media.

ART360.description: Experimentation with the painting process in relationship to method, material and tools.

ART361.title: Figure Painting

ART371.title: Sculpture III

ART410.description: Aegean and Greek architecture, painting, and sculpture.

ART415.description: Architecture, sculpture, painting, and other arts in Europe, 1780 - 1900.

Students are afforded the space to draw on their breadth of information and artistic mediums to create a capstone project that demonstrates an ability to communicate effectively across verbal, visual, and written forms. Develop skills as makers and thinkers, fostering critical awareness of how society reflects and produces visual meaning.

ART431.title: Advanced Photo Image Making II

ART450.title: Fibers IV

ART451.title: Fibers V
ART451.description: Advanced studio problems in expressive use of fibers and fabric.

ART455.title: Advanced Typography and Design Systems
ART455.description: Two- and three-dimensional solutions for advertising, corporate identity, packaging, and publication design.

ART457.title: Advanced Interactive Media

ART458.title: Advanced Experimental Video

ART460.title: Advanced Painting I

ART461.title: Advanced Painting II
ART461.description: Continuation in direction of individual creative expression.

ART465.title: Printmaking IV-Studio Workshop
ART465.description: Advanced printmaking workshop; intaglio, relief, planographic, and stencil; continued emphasis on individual creative growth.

ART466.title: Printmaking V-Studio Workshop
ART466.description: Advanced printmaking concepts in studio and research problems.

ART470.title: Sculpture IV
ART470.description: Development of individual expression using sculptural techniques.

ART482A.description: Special topics in Italian art history; most classes will be taught on-site at museums, churches, and galleries in Italy. Focus on the art and architecture of the famed Michelangelo Buonarroti.

ART487.title: Internship
ART487.description: Supervised work experience in an approved location.

ART510A.title: Advanced Study in Art History: American Art

ART510B.title: Advanced Study in Art History: East and South African Art
ART510B.description: Arts of southern and East Africa from prehistory through contemporary visual expressions. Engages with current art historical theoretical approaches and practices to gain a nuanced understanding of the arts in these respective regions and their relationship to global art production.

ART510C.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Pre-Columbian Art

ART510E.title: Advanced Study in Art History: United States Art Since 1945

ART510F.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Greek Art

ART510I.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Baroque and Rococo Art

ART510K.title: Advanced Study in Art History: 20th Century European Art

ART510L.description: Focuses on the arts of West and Central Africa from prehistory through contemporary visual expressions. Engages with current art historical theoretical approaches and practices in order to gain a nuanced understanding of the arts in these respective regions and their relationship to global art production.

ART510M.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Roman Art

ART510O.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Women in Art

ART510P.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Pacific Art

ART510Q.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Contemporary Art and Art Critics

ART510R.title: Advanced Study in Art History: Native North American Art
ART510R.description: Graduate study in the history of Native North American art.

ART514.title: Contemporary American Art Critics and Artists
ART514.description: Issues in contemporary American art are explored through the work of critics and artists who visit through the Critic and Artist Residency Series.

ART515.title: Seminar-Contemporary Art Theory
ART515.description: Relationship between critical theory and the visual arts; how artists and critics apply theory in their work.

ART521.title: Art and Environment - Advanced Study
ART521.description: Interdisciplinary studio/seminar course investigating art's relationship to the environment through readings, field trips, presentations and studio practice.

AA100.title: Introduction to Astronomy (GT-SC2)
AA100.description: Description of the various objects found in the heavens as well as the principles and techniques employed in investigations of these objects.

AA101.title: Astronomy Laboratory (GT-SC1)
AA101.description: Conduct observations, experiments, and simulations to develop an intuitive understanding of astronomical phenomena.

ATS150.title: Science of Global Climate Change
ATS150.description: Physical basis of climate change. Energy budget of the earth, the greenhouse effect, carbon cycle, paleoclimate, projections of 21st-century climate.

ATS350.title: Introduction to Weather and Climate
ATS350.description: Behavior of atmosphere and its influence upon human's activities.

ATS351.title: Introduction to Weather and Climate Lab
ATS351.description: Actual weather data, visualization of meteorological phenomena, in-depth discussion of current environmental issues.

ATS555.title: Air Pollution
ATS555.description: Nature, ambient concentrations, sources, sinks, and physiological activities of pollutants; meteorology; legislation; social and economic factors.

ATS560.title: Air Pollution Measurement
ATS560.description: Examination and application of techniques for air pollution measurement. Includes sampling and analysis of gases, aerosols, and precipitation.

ATS601.title: Atmospheric Dynamics I
ATS601.description: Equations of motion; earth's rotation; balanced motion; vorticity and Rossby waves; shallow water models; potential vorticity.

ATS602.title: Atmospheric Dynamics II
ATS602.description: Sound waves, gravity waves, Rossby waves; numerical weather predication; baroclinic instability; general circulation; tropical dynamics.

ATS604.title: Atmospheric Modeling
ATS604.description: Design of numerical models of the atmosphere; applications to current problems. Emphasis on practical understanding of relevant numerical methods.

ATS605.title: Atmospheric Circulations
ATS605.description: Observations and theory of the general circulation of the atmosphere, with emphasis on understanding physical mechanisms.

ATS606.title: Introduction to Climate
ATS606.description: Global energy balance, surface energy balance, the hydrological cycle, atmosphere general circulation, ocean general circulation, climate variability, climate sensitivity and feedbacks.

ATS607.title: Computational Methods for Atmospheric Science
ATS607.description: Computer programming tools unique to and common in the atmospheric sciences.

ATS610.title: Physical Oceanography
ATS610.description: Foundations of ocean circulation theory and the general circulation of the oceans using observational data and rotating tank experiments.

ATS620.title: Thermodynamics and Cloud Physics
ATS620.description: Equilibrium thermodynamics, cloud microphysics, precipitation formation, and cloud electrification.

ATS621.title: Atmospheric Chemistry
ATS621.description: Overview of chemical kinetics and equilibria; sources and sinks of pollutants; photochemistry and smog formation; aqueous-phase chemistry; acid rain.

ATS622.title: Atmospheric Radiation
ATS622.description: Role of radiation in the energy balance of the climate system; Absorption and scattering of solar radiation; Emission and absorption of terrestrial radiation; Interactions of radiation with clouds and aerosols; Role of radiative active trace gases.

ATS623.title: Atmospheric Boundary Layer
ATS623.description: Equations for shallow atmospheric motions; thermal instability of a fluid layer; atmospheric turbulence; flow stability; 1-D mixed layer models.

ATS631.title: Introduction to Atmospheric Aerosols
ATS631.description: Physical, chemical and microphysical characteristics of atmospheric particulate matter; measurement principles and techniques.

ATS632.title: Interpreting Satellite Observations
ATS632.description: Broad theoretical and practical overview of satellite observations of atmospheric composition. Introduction to the theoretical foundations of satellite composition retrievals of both gases and aerosols, and the associated strengths and weaknesses of commonly used atmospheric products.

ATS640.title: Synoptic Meteorology
ATS640.description: Synoptic-scale weather systems; thermodynamic diagrams; vertical motion; fronts; cyclones and anticyclones.

ATS641.title: Mesoscale Meteorology
ATS641.description: Mesoscale weather systems; instabilities; orographic flows; dynamics of convective storms; organized convection.

ATS650.title: Measurement Systems and Theory
ATS650.description: Surface and upper air measurement systems; theory and system response, sensor design; automated data collection, analysis and display systems.

ATS651.title: Data Assimilation in Numerical Models
ATS651.description: Methods for combining theoretical understanding encoded in complex weather and climate models with real-world observations. Applications include weather prediction and other problems in the geosciences.

ATS652.title: Atmospheric Remote Sensing
ATS652.description: Concepts of electromagnetic and acoustic wave propagation; active and passive remote sensing techniques including radar, lidar, thermal emission systems.

ATS655.title: Objective Analysis in Atmospheric Sciences
ATS655.description: Objective analysis of geophysical data: general statistics; matrix methods; time series analysis. Emphasis on applications to real-world data.

ATS693.title: Responsible Research in Atmospheric Science
ATS693.description: Scientific misconduct; ethical publishing; record keeping; data management; professional skills applicable to atmospheric science.

ATS699N.title: Thesis: Dynamics and Physics of Clouds

ATS703.title: Numerical Weather Prediction
ATS703.description: Quasi-geostrophic approximation; barotropic, baroclinic, primitive equation, and general circulation models; numerical methods.

ATS704.title: Large-Scale Atmospheric Dynamics
ATS704.description: Quasi-static, quasi-geostrophic equations; planetary waves; geostrophic adjustment; barotropic, baroclinic instability; frontogenesis; tropical cyclones.

ATS707.title: Atmospheric Waves and Vortices
ATS707.description: Atmospheric wave motions and embedded vortices spanning mountain waves to large-scale Rossby waves and critical layers.

ATS708.title: Middle Atmospheric Dynamics
ATS708.description: Dynamics of the stratosphere and mesosphere with emphasis on the lower and middle stratosphere.

ATS710.title: Geophysical Vortices
ATS710.description: Observational, experimental, and theoretical aspects of geophysical vortices, such as hurricanes, polar lows, tornadoes, and dust devils.

ATS711.title: Microclimate
ATS711.description: Momentum, heat, water, and trace gas fluxes near the earth's surface, including fluxes between the atmosphere and the land/ocean/ice surfaces.

ATS712.title: Dynamics of Clouds
ATS712.description: General theory of cloud dynamics; parameterization of microphysics and radiation; models of fog, stratocumuli, cumulonimbi, and orographic clouds.

ATS715.title: Atmospheric Oxidation Processes
ATS715.description: Atmospheric hydrocarbon and nitrogen oxide reactions; aqueous phase scavenging and reactions; chemical pathways in the atmosphere.

ATS716.title: Air Quality Characterization
ATS716.description: Planning, executing, and reporting on a measurement campaign to characterize local air quality.

ATS721.title: Theoretical Topics in Radiative Transfer
ATS721.description: Physics of atmospheric radiation; theoretical techniques used to show radiation transfer equation.

ATS722.title: Atmospheric Radiation and Energetics
ATS722.description: Radiative transfer in the atmosphere; implications on remote sensing and energetics.

ATS724.title: Cloud Microphysics
ATS724.description: Theories and observations of nucleation; cloud droplet spectria broadening;

ATS730.title: Mesoscale Modeling
ATS730.description: Development of basic equations used in mesoscale models and methodology of solution

ATS735.title: Mesoscale Dynamics
ATS735.description: Analysis of physical and dynamical processes that initiate, maintain, and modulate atmospheric mesoscale phenomena.

ATS737.title: Satellite Observation of Atmosphere and Earth
ATS737.description: Satellite measurements; basic orbits and observing systems; applications of remote probing and imaging to investigations of atmospheric processes.

ATS740.title: Atmospheric Electricity
ATS740.description: Foundations of atmospheric electricity, including global electric circuit and the role of thunderstorms in maintaining this circuit, thunderstorm electrification processes based on non-inductive charging theory, lightning detection based on RF and optical sensing, and lightning phenomena including Transient Luminous Events.

ATS741.title: Radar Meteorology
ATS741.description: Radar systems; radar equation and applications; multiple Doppler observation and processing; radar studies of mesoscale systems.

ATS742.title: Tropical Meteorology
ATS742.description: Overview of the tropical atmosphere, monsoons, intraseasonal variability, hurricanes, theory of tropical convection and the large-scale circulation.

ATS743.title: Interactions of the Ocean and Atmosphere
ATS743.description: Ocean-atmosphere interactions in observations, theory, and models. Time mean atmosphere-ocean circulations through climate variability and change.

ATS745.title: Atmospheric General Circulation Modeling
ATS745.description: Current problems in modeling of the general circulation of the atmosphere.

ATS750.title: Climate Dynamics: Atmospheric Variability
ATS750.description: Analysis and interpretation of large-scale patterns of climate variability and observed climate change.

ATS752.title: Inverse Methods in Atmospheric Science
ATS752.description: Introduction to inverse modeling, with particular application to remote sensing retrievals, flux inversions and data assimilation.

ATS753.title: Global Hydrologic Cycle
ATS753.description: Hydrologic cycle, moisture transport and air-ground exchange; water budgets of meteorological phenomena; climatology of atmospheric water.

ATS760.title: Global Carbon Cycle
ATS760.description: Exchanges of CO2 between the atmosphere, the land surface, and oceans. Biogeochemical processes. Micrometeorological and inverse flux estimation.

ATS761.title: Land-Atmosphere Interactions
ATS761.description: Exchange of energy, water, momentum, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere.

ATS762.title: Biosphere-Chemistry-Climate Interactions
ATS762.description: Explore the sensitivity of the climate system to atmospheric chemical composition with emphasis on connections to biospheric processes and feedbacks.

ATS765.title: Climate Dynamics-Ocean Variability
ATS765.description: Climate variability on time scales of years to millennia with focus on the role of the ocean circulation. Approach through dynamical systems theory.

ATS770.title: Ocean Modeling
ATS770.description: Conceptual and numerical ocean models and their application to current problems in climate science and biogeochemical cycles.

ATS772.title: Aerosol Physics, Chemistry, Clouds & Climate
ATS772.description: The physics  and chemistry of atmospheric aerosols including composition,  size, and interaction with radiation and clouds, including the development of research-grade models of aerosols, clouds, and radiation.

ATS799N.title: Dissertation: Dynamics and Physics of Clouds

BSPM102.title: Insects, Science, and Society (GT-SC2)
BSPM102.description: How insects develop, behave, and affect human activity. What every student should know about the most diverse life form on Earth.

BSPM201.title: Weed Management and Control
BSPM201.description: Basic overview of weeds and weed control.

BSPM308.title: Ecology and Management of Weeds
BSPM308.description: Classification, characteristics; weed biology and ecology; control by cultural, mechanical, chemical, and biological means; successional management.

BSPM355A.title: Horticulture Pathology: General Pathology
BSPM355A.description: A 5-week course consisting of General Plant Pathology; identification of the organisms that can cause plant diseases.

BSPM355B.title: Hort Pathology: Turf and Ornamental Disease
BSPM355B.description: Turf and ornamental plant diseases, their management and control.

BSPM355C.title: Horticulture Pathology: Vegetable and Greenhouse Disease
BSPM355C.description: Diseases in the Greenhouse and Vegetable crops, management and control.

BSPM356A.title: Horticultural Entomology Introduction
BSPM356A.description: Basic biology, identification and management of insects and mites affecting horticultural crops.

BSPM356B.title: Horticultural Entomology: Food Crops
BSPM356B.description: Insect and mite pests of fruits, vegetables and other garden grown food crops.

BSPM356C.title: Horticultural Entomology: Landscape Plants
BSPM356C.description: Insect and mite pests of ornamentals (woody plants, flowers) and turfgrass and their management.

BSPM365.title: Integrated Tree Health Management
BSPM365.description: Insects and diseases in forest and urban ecosystems. Effects, diagnosis, prevention, and interactions.

BSPM423.title: Evolution and Classification of Insects
BSPM423.description: Major groups of insects, living and fossil; major evolutionary trends in structure and behavior.

BSPM445.title: Aquatic Insects
BSPM445.description: Biology and recognition of major orders and families of aquatic insects; a collection is required.

BSPM450.title: Molecular Plant-Microbe Interaction
BSPM450.description: Principles of plant-microbe/insect interactions, physiological and molecular aspects of plant defense, genomics approaches to study plant defense.

BSPM451.title: Integrated Pest Management
BSPM451.description: Concepts of integrated pest management and the strategies and tactics employed in the application of these concepts.

BSPM500.title: Foundations of Bioagricultural Sciences
BSPM500.description: Introduction to graduate school covering managing time, advisor and research, plus a survey of topics encompassed by the department of BSPM.

BSPM502A.title: Topics in Plant Pathology: Plant Viruses

BSPM502B.title: Topics in Plant Pathology: Plant Bacteriology

BSPM502F.title: Topics in Plant Pathology: Plant Disease Epidemiology

BSPM507.title: Insect Behavior
BSPM507.description: Behavior of insects and related arthropods with special attention to social behavior.

BSPM508.title: Environmental Fate of Pesticides
BSPM508.description: Processes that affect fate of pesticides and their metabolites in the environment with emphasis on soil and water.

BSPM510.title: Insect-Plant Disease Relationships
BSPM510.description: Relationships between insects and various plant pathogens as they affect survival and transmissions of pathogens.

BSPM515.title: Plant Biochemistry in Agriculture
BSPM515.description: Experiential learning environment leading to mastery of biochemical methods of enzyme purification and assays, metabolic network analysis, and important plant biochemical pathways. Structure and function of enzymes in metabolic pathways and the contributions of these pathways to plant growth and development.

BSPM521.title: Forest Health Issues
BSPM521.description: Current topics related to forest and shade tree health from ecosystems to tree defense physiology.

BSPM523.title: Advanced Evolution/Classification of Insects
BSPM523.description: Major groups of insects, living and fossil; major evolutionary trends in structure and behavior.

BSPM528.title: Invasive Plants/Weeds–Ecosystems to Molecules
BSPM528.description: Contributions of disciplines of weed science and invasion ecology to understanding the biology, ecology and management of "problem plants."

BSPM540.title: Understanding Genomes
BSPM540.description: Harnessing genome information and related -omics level technologies for use in answering biological questions.

BSPM550.title: Molecular Plant-Microbe Interactions
BSPM550.description: Principles of plant-microbe interactions, physiological and molecular aspects of plant defense, genomic approaches to study plant defense.

BSPM551.title: Advanced Integrated Pest Management
BSPM551.description: Concepts of integrated pest management and the strategies and tactics employed in the practical application of these concepts.

A significant portion of the course is spent in the field, primarily at the Semi-arid Grasslands Research Center northeast of Fort Collins.

Study animal behavior, animal physiology, and conservation methods at the Roatan Institute for Marine Science (RIMS). Classroom lectures and discussions provide the framework to develop an understanding of the subject matter. Develop the skills necessary to conduct preliminary research.

BZ441.title: Plant Physiology Laboratory
BZ441.description: Laboratory applications of plant physiology principles.

Ecuador is an ideal location to learn about tropical biodiversity, because it houses an enormous diversity of tropical ecosystems in a relatively small geographic area, all of which are very accessible. Students will visit these ecosystems—including cloud forest, páramo, and lowland Amazonian rainforest.

BZ450.title: Plant Ecology
BZ450.description: Relation of plants to their environment.

Field sampling and exploration of marine ecosystems from levels of primary production to the top level predators. Students will learn a wide variety of hands on sampling techniques and data analyses with the goal of comparing the marine ecology of the Baja peninsula.

BZ482B.description: This field program offers an 8–day research experience to Roatan, Honduras, where students will study animal behavior, animal physiology and conservation methods at the Roatan Institute for Marine Science (RIMS). Classroom lectures and discussions provide the framework to develop an understanding of the subject matter. Fieldwork allows students to develop the skills necessary to conduct preliminary research.

BZ496.title: Group Study—Biology
BZ496.description: Faculty-directed group investigation of areas of special interest in biology.

BZ498.title: Laboratory or Field Research

BZ555.title: Reproductive Biology of Higher Plants

BZ561.title: Landscape Ecology

BZ568.title: Sustaining River Ecosystems in Changing World

BZ570.title: Molecular Aspects of Plant Development

Engage with local businesses as well as community members to learn how Ecuadorian culture impacts business within Ecuador and internationally. Develop self and cultural awareness through experiential activities, dialogue, and reflection.

Engage with local businesses as well as community members to learn how Ecuadorian culture impacts business within Ecuador and internationally. Develop self and cultural awareness through experiential activities, dialogue, and reflection.

Engage with local businesses as well as community members to learn how Tanzanian culture impacts business within Tanzania and internationally. Develop self and cultural awareness through experiential activities, dialogue, and reflection.

Students present solutions to business problems based on credible research and analysis.

CIVE261.title: Engineering Mechanics-Dynamics
CIVE261.description: Kinematics and kinetics of particles and rigid bodies; concepts of work-energy and impulse-momentum; computer applications; vector notation.

CIVE300.title: Fluid Mechanics
CIVE300.description: Fluid properties; statics, kinematics, and dynamics of fluid motion including viscous and gravitational effects.

CIVE301.title: Fluid Mechanics Laboratory
CIVE301.description: Fluid properties; statics, kinematics, and dynamics of fluid motion including viscous and gravitational effects.

CIVE302.title: Evaluation of Civil Engineering Materials
CIVE302.description: Behavior and properties of construction materials, instrumentation, use of statistical tools, material standards, material selection, quality control.

CIVE303.title: Infrastructure and Transportation Systems
CIVE303.description: Principles of infrastructure systems, transportation systems, applications of spatial data and GIS, project management and engineering economy.

CIVE305.title: Intermediate AutoCAD
CIVE305.description: Creating layouts and templates, objects, graphic patterns and symbols, inserting and managing external references, and creating isometric drawings.

CIVE322.title: Basic Hydrology
CIVE322.description: Hydrologic cycle, soil moisture, groundwater, runoff processes, applications in water resources and environmental engineering.

CIVE330.title: Ecological Engineering
CIVE330.description: Principles of ecological engineering and design of sustainable ecosystems.

CIVE339.title: Environmental Engineering Concepts
CIVE339.description: Fundamental topics of environmental engineering, including water chemistry, chemical and biological reactions for water and wastewater treatment, reactor design for water and wastewater treatment processes, sanitary and storm sewer design, hazardous waste management, noise pollution, and sanitary landfill design.

CIVE355.title: Introduction to Geotechnical Engineering
CIVE355.description: Soil behavior, stress-strain and strength properties, application to earth pressure, slope and foundation problems.

CIVE356.title: Geotechnical Engineering Laboratory
CIVE356.description: Laboratory to demonstrate standard methods of soils testing, methods of data collection, analysis of results.

CIVE360.title: Mechanics of Solids
CIVE360.description: Stresses and deformations in structural members and machine elements, combined stresses, stress transformation.

CIVE367.title: Structural Analysis
CIVE367.description: Determination of actions in and deformations of determinate and indeterminate structures.

CIVE401.title: Hydraulic Engineering
CIVE401.description: Basic principles of fluid mechanics applied to practical problems in hydraulic engineering.

CIVE402.title: Senior Design Principles
CIVE402.description: Design of civil engineering systems, nontechnical and economic design considerations, project organization, design project development and presentation.

CIVE403.title: Senior Project Design
CIVE403.description: Design of civil engineering systems, nontechnical and economic design considerations, project organization, design project development and presentation.

CIVE413.title: Environmental River Mechanics
CIVE413.description: Fluvial geomorphology, river hydraulics, sediment transport, and river response with special emphasis on environmental aspects.

CIVE423.title: Groundwater Engineering
CIVE423.description: Development of groundwater resources; origin, movement, distribution of water below ground surface.

CIVE425.title: Soil and Water Engineering
CIVE425.description: Control of the soil-water-plant medium for optimum plant growth and environmental protection.

CIVE437.title: Wastewater Treatment Facility Design
CIVE437.description: Design concepts and principles for wastewater treatment systems and unit processes, principles of treatment plant operation.

CIVE438.title: Fundamentals of Environmental Engr
CIVE438.description: Core topics of environmental engineering including water quality and chemistry, wastewater removal and treatment, air pollution, noise pollution, and sanitary landfill design. Sustainability, green engineering and ethics are also discussed.

CIVE439.title: Applications of Environmental Engr Concepts
CIVE439.description: Design concepts related to environmental engineering problems with a focus on design projects.

CIVE440.title: Nonpoint Source Pollution
CIVE440.description: Principles, processes, impacts and control of nonpoint source pollution of surface and groundwater.

CIVE441.title: Water Quality Analysis and Treatment
CIVE441.description: Physical, chemical and biological methods for the characterization of waters and wastewaters.

CIVE442.title: Air Quality Engineering
CIVE442.description: Air pollution problems and solutions, at scales ranging from local to global. Quantitative analysis of chemical and physical processes governing air pollutants in natural and built environments.

CIVE455.title: Applications in Geotechnical Engineering
CIVE455.description: Geotechnical engineering applications of earth retaining structures, foundations, dams and embankments, geosynthetics, waste containment systems.

CIVE458.title: Environmental Geotechnics
CIVE458.description: Application of principles from soil physics, soil chemistry, soil mechanics, hydrogeology, and geotechnical engineering to solve problems in Environmental Geotechnics related to engineered containment of contaminants and remediation of contaminated sites for the protection of human health and the environment.

CIVE466.title: Design and Behavior of Steel Structures
CIVE466.description: Loads acting on a structure; behavior and design of steel members, connections, and systems.

CIVE467.title: Design of Reinforced Concrete Structures
CIVE467.description: Design and behavior of reinforced concrete structural members.

CIVE502.title: Fluid Mechanics
CIVE502.description: Fundamental physical concepts of fluid mechanics, including ideal and viscous fluid flows and boundary-layers.

CIVE504.title: Wind Engineering
CIVE504.description: Influence of wind on humanity. Applications to structures, air pollution, wind energy, agricultural aerodynamics, snow movement, human comfort.

CIVE505.title: Structural Inspection, Management and Repair
CIVE505.description: Modes of deterioration for existing structures; techniques for structural inspection, modeling deterioration and evaluating structures; asset management strategies; failure case studies; repair techniques.

CIVE506.title: Wind Effects on Structures
CIVE506.description: Analysis of wind effects on buildings and structures; deterministic and probabilistic methods; aerodynamic loading and response; codes and standards.

CIVE507.title: Transportation Engineering
CIVE507.description: Principles of highway engineering, transportation engineering and bridge engineering with a focus on design.

CIVE508.title: Bridge Engineering
CIVE508.description: Introduces the fundamentals of bridge engineering, including bridge basics, bridge loads, bridge analysis and bridge design.

CIVE510.title: Applied Hydraulic System Design
CIVE510.description: Operational management systems, data collection, real-time control, management modeling, rehabilitation and retrofit, maintenance.

CIVE511.title: Coastal Engineering
CIVE511.description: Coastal processes (waves, tides, storm surge, currents, coastal morphology, deltas) and their effects on infrastructure design and eco-protection.

CIVE512.title: Irrigation Systems Design
CIVE512.description: Irrigation systems principles and design procedures for operation of sprinkler, trickle, and surface irrigation systems.

CIVE513.title: Morphodynamic Modeling
CIVE513.description: Principles and techniques for simultaneous modeling of flow, sediment transport, and channel evolution to address problems in river morphodynamics.

CIVE514.title: Hydraulic Structures/Systems
CIVE514.description: Analysis and design of hydraulic structures which make up components of water resource systems.

CIVE518.title: Sprinkler and Trickle Irrigation Systems
CIVE518.description: Basic principles, design, and evaluation of pressurized irrigation systems.

CIVE519.title: Irrigation Water Management
CIVE519.description: Soil, plant, water, and atmospheric engineering principles for the determination of crop water needs to sustain agricultural production and the environment.

CIVE520.title: Physical Hydrology
CIVE520.description: Hydrologic, atmospheric processes in the water cycle; linear systems, hydrologic response; geomorphologic description of hydrologic processes, response.

CIVE521.title: Hydrometry
CIVE521.description: Principles, methods, instruments, and equipment for measuring water quantity and water quality variables in nature.

CIVE522.title: Engineering Hydrology
CIVE522.description: Hydrologic design under uncertainty; conventional and remote sensing; design flows and storms; river routing; reservoir design; watershed models.

CIVE525.title: Water Engineering International Development
CIVE525.description: Planning and design of small-scale and low-cost water supply and wastewater systems for rural communities in developing countries.

CIVE529.title: Environmental Organic Chemistry
CIVE529.description: Fate and transport of organic compounds in natural and engineered environments.

CIVE530.title: Environ Engr at the Water-Energy-Health Nexus
CIVE530.description: Key principles and applications of state-of-the-art technologies at the water-energy-health nexus. Emerging technologies that produce clean water and energy from unconventional water resources such as wastewater and saline water, as well as new approaches (e.g., using environmental nanotechnology) that prevent water-borne diseases beyond conventional disinfection.

CIVE531.title: Groundwater Hydrology
CIVE531.description: Groundwater occurrence, distribution, movement, exploration and recharge, well hydraulics and design, interaction of ground and surface water.

CIVE532.title: Wells and Pumps
CIVE532.description: Well field hydraulics, well drilling methods, well design, aquifer test methods, pumping systems, well maintenance, storage/distribution systems.

CIVE534.title: Applied and Environmental Molecular Biology
CIVE534.description: Environmental microbiology and molecular biology tools used to investigate both natural systems and engineered processes.

CIVE537.title: Residuals Management
CIVE537.description: Planning and design for processing and disposal of residuals including solid wastes, sludges, and hazardous wastes.

CIVE538.title: Aqueous Chemistry
CIVE538.description: Principles of solution chemistry applied to aquatic systems.

CIVE539.title: Water and Wastewater Analysis
CIVE539.description: Chemical and biological methods of assessing water quality; significance of chemicals in aquatic systems.

CIVE541.title: Environmental Unit Operation-Treatment-Design
CIVE541.description: Reactor theory, filtration, adsorption, ion exchange, gas transfer, oxidation, membranes, biological reactors, disinfection.

CIVE542.title: Water Quality Modeling
CIVE542.description: Chemical, physical, and biological processes defining surface water quality, construction and application of computer models for lakes and streams.

CIVE543.title: Instrumental Environmental Analysis
CIVE543.description: Environmental sampling and preservation techniques followed by the instrumental analysis of the samples.

CIVE544.title: Water Resources Planning and Management
CIVE544.description: Management and planning of natural and constructed water systems. Integrated management and case studies of water use and environmental resources.

CIVE546.title: Water Resource Systems Analysis
CIVE546.description: Applications of systems analysis and optimization techniques in water resources planning and management.

CIVE549.title: Drainage and Wetland Engineering
CIVE549.description: Drainage and wetlands design for agricultural and natural resource applications. Water table modification for nonpoint sources pollution control.

CIVE550.title: Foundation and Retaining Wall Engineering
CIVE550.description: Mechanics and methodology of foundation engineering, selection and design of foundation systems, retaining wall design, and application of principles to related special problems.

CIVE555.title: Mining Geotechnics
CIVE555.description: Challenges associated with mine tailings and mine waste management, including relevant geotechnical and geoenvironmental engineering factors. Case studies are used to illustrate important concepts.

CIVE556.title: Slope Stability, Seepage, and Earth Dams
CIVE556.description: Slope stability, seepage analysis and control, and earth dam and embankment design in Geotechnical Engineering practice. Students will gain an understanding of the theory, design, and analysis necessary to evaluate slope stability, seepage, and earth dam problems.

CIVE558.title: Containment Systems for Waste Disposal
CIVE558.description: Basic principles governing the design of containment systems used in waste disposal applications.

CIVE559.title: Special Topics in Geotechnical Engineering
CIVE559.description: Advanced topics in geotechnical engineering including expansive soils, unsaturated soil mechanics, soil-structure interaction and mining geotechnics.

CIVE560.title: Advanced Mechanics of Materials
CIVE560.description: Analysis of stress and strain failure theory; selected topics in solid mechanics, plate analysis; introduction to elastic stability.

CIVE561.title: Advanced Steel Behavior and Design
CIVE561.description: Behavior of steel components and systems. Design of composite members, plate girders, and bolted and welded connections.

CIVE562.title: Fundamentals of Vibrations
CIVE562.description: Free and forced vibrations of single, two, and multiple degree of freedom systems. Closed-form and numerical solutions.

CIVE564.title: Principles of Structural Load Modeling
CIVE564.description: Modern structural load modeling and analysis techniques for buildings and other structures exposed to natural and man-made hazards.

CIVE565.title: Finite Element Method
CIVE565.description: Theory and application in elasticity, porous flow, heat conduction, and other engineering problems.

CIVE566.title: Intermediate Structural Analysis
CIVE566.description: Work and energy concepts, curved members and arches, matrix analysis of linear systems, numerical techniques.

CIVE567.title: Advanced Concrete Design
CIVE567.description: Behavior of reinforced and prestressed concrete members; development of design methods; behavior and design of slabs, shearwalls, and buildings.

CIVE568.title: Design of Masonry and Wood Structures
CIVE568.description: Behavior and design of structures and structural components constructed of masonry or engineered wood.

CIVE571.title: Pipeline Engineering and Hydraulics
CIVE571.description: Water supply, wastewater, stormwater, oil and gas, and industrial applications. Emphasis on pressurized water pipelines.

CIVE572.title: Analysis of Urban Water Systems
CIVE572.description: Behavior and interaction of urban water distribution and collection systems; how system state and driving variables affect system performance.

CIVE573.title: Urban Stormwater Management
CIVE573.description: Effects of urbanization on watershed hydrology and receiving waters; control practices to mitigate effects using mathematical models.

CIVE574.title: Civil Engineering Project Management
CIVE574.description: Principles of civil engineering project management including proposals, contracts, scheduling, quality assurance, budgeting, and risk management.

CIVE575.title: Sustainable Water and Waste Management
CIVE575.description: The science, engineering, and policy behind sustainable water and waste practices.  Sustainable urban water and wastewater management.

CIVE576.title: Engineering Applications of GIS and GPS
CIVE576.description: Integration of GPS and GIS in the planning and decision making process, application to case study.

CIVE577.title: GIS in Civil and Environmental Engineering
CIVE577.description: GIS technology for spatial design/analysis; applications in facilities management, urban infrastructure, water resources, environmental engineering.

CIVE578.title: Infrastructure and Utility Management
CIVE578.description: Infrastructure and utility planning, management, and security. Systems approach to life cycle management. Problems, analysis, decision support systems.

CIVE592A.title: Seminar: Fluid Mechanics and Wind Engineering

CIVE596C.title: Group Study: Hydrology and Water Resources

CIVE596H.title: Group Study: Water Resource Planning and Management

CIVE596J.title: Group Study: Bioresource and Agricultural Engineering

CIVE604.title: Fluid Turbulence and Modeling
CIVE604.description: Engineering concepts for transport of pollutants, toxic and flammable species, sand, and snow. Fluid modeling, numerical and analytical approaches.

CIVE607.title: Computational Fluid Dynamics
CIVE607.description: Numerical methods used in computational solutions of hydraulics, environmental and wind engineering problems.

CIVE610.title: Special Topics in Hydraulics
CIVE610.description: Advanced topics in hydraulics, hydromechanics, environmental hydraulics, and computational hydraulics.

CIVE612.title: Open Channel Flow
CIVE612.description: Steady, uniform, and non-uniform flow; backwater curves; flow through bridge piers, transitions, and culverts; spatially varied and unsteady flow.

CIVE613.title: River Restoration Design
CIVE613.description: Analysis and design for assisting the recovery of hydrologic, geomorphic, and ecological processes and ecosystem services in degraded river systems.

CIVE622.title: Risk Analysis of Water/Environmental Systems
CIVE622.description: Risk and uncertainty analysis applied to hydrology, hydraulics, groundwater, water resources, and environmental engineering systems.

CIVE625.title: Quantitative Eco-Hydrology
CIVE625.description: Quantitative examination of the hydrologic and ecologic mechanisms underlying climate-soil-vegetation and soil moisture dynamics.

CIVE626.title: Integrated Analysis of Coupled Water Issues
CIVE626.description: Integrative systems and policy analysis applied to coupled human-water systems from interdisciplinary technical and institutional perspectives.

CIVE631.title: Computational Methods in Subsurface Systems
CIVE631.description: Numerical flow models; finite difference and finite element methods; parameter identification, stochastic modeling and advanced analytical solutions.

CIVE638.title: Groundwater Quality and Contaminant Transport
CIVE638.description: Analysis of hydrochemical data. Advection with and without mixing. Retardation of reactive solutes. Design of groundwater quality investigations.

CIVE645.title: Computer-Aided Water Management and Control
CIVE645.description: Real-time management and control of water resource systems; applications of computer control concepts to improve system performance.

CIVE655.title: Advanced Soil Mechanics
CIVE655.description: Advanced topics in shear strength and consolidation of soils; stress paths; anisotropy; submergence; partial and radial drainage; numerical methods.

CIVE657.title: Oral Communication in Geo-Engineering
CIVE657.description: Principles of technical oral communication in geotechnical engineering, creating presentations, delivering presentations, listening and responding to questions.

CIVE658.title: Remediation Systems - Subsurface Contamination
CIVE658.description: Applications in geoenvironmental engineering practice involving design of in situ containment and remediation systems.

CIVE661.title: Stochastic Methods in Structural Dynamics
CIVE661.description: Time-dependent excitations are modeled using stochastic processes, enabling prediction of random dynamic response under time-dependent excitations.

CIVE662.title: Foundations of Solid Mechanics
CIVE662.description: Analysis of stress and strain in solids emphasizing linear elasticity and plasticity; introduction to creep, viscoelasticity, and finite deformations.

CIVE663.title: Structural Stability
CIVE663.description: Structural stability analysis of buildings and other structures; mathematical and mechanics tools for investigating stability of equilibrium.

CIVE664.title: Mechanics of Fatigue and Fracture
CIVE664.description: Fracture mechanics including linear elastic, elastic-plastic, and dynamic fracture; on ductile and cleavage fracture in metals.

CIVE667.title: Advanced Structural Analysis
CIVE667.description: Analysis program development, application of finite element analysis, computer-assisted analysis, introduction to nonlinear analysis.

CIVE668.title: Structural Reliability--Theory, Application
CIVE668.description: Theory of structural reliability as it relates to analysis, design, construction, and maintenance of structural and mechanical systems.

CIVE695A.title: Independent Study: Fluid Mechanics and Wind Engineering

CIVE695C.title: Independent Study: Hydrology and Water Resources

CIVE695H.title: Independent Study: Water Resource Planning and Management

CIVE695J.title: Independent Study: Bioresource and Agricultural Engineering

CIVE695K.title: Independent Study: Water and International Development

CIVE695L.title: Independent Study: Construction Engineering and Management
CIVE695L.description: A) Fluid mechanics and wind engineering. B) Hydraulics. C) Hydrology and water resources. D) Mechanics. E) Geotechnical engineering, F) Structures, G) Environmental Engineering. H) Water resource planning and management, I) Groundwater. J) Bioresource and agricultural engineering. K) Water and International Development, L) Construction Engineering & Management.

CIVE696A.title: Group Study: Fluid Mechanics and Wind Engineering

CIVE696C.title: Group Study: Hydrology and Water Resources

CIVE696H.title: Group Study: Water Resource Planning and Management

CIVE696J.title: Group Study: Bioresource and Agricultural Engineering

CIVE699A.title: Thesis: Fluid Mechanics and Wind Engineering

CIVE699H.title: Thesis: Water Resource Planning and Management

CIVE703.title: Special Topics in Fluid Mechanics
CIVE703.description: Advanced topics in fluid mechanics; associated experimental and numerical techniques.

CIVE716.title: Erosion and Sedimentation
CIVE716.description: Sediment properties; resistance to flow; incipient motion and bedforms; sediment transport, reservoir sedimentation.

CIVE717.title: River Mechanics
CIVE717.description: Characteristics of rivers, mechanics of sediment and water discharge emphasizing alluvial systems, channel stabilization, control, response.

CIVE721.title: Stochastic Water and Environmental Systems
CIVE721.description: Stochastic analysis of water and environmental systems. Simulation, forecasting, spatial analysis, modeling changes, stochastic differential equations.

CIVE724.title: River Basin Morphology
CIVE724.description: Analysis of river basin properties including their connections to statistical theories and erosion processes and their hydrologic implications.

CIVE742.title: Advanced Topics in Environmental Engineering
CIVE742.description: Selected topics from current environmental engineering  research including molecular methods, water/wastewater treatment, hazardous water remediation.

CIVE751.title: Soil Dynamics
CIVE751.description: Soil behavior under dynamic loading; stress wave propagation; foundation response to vibratory and transient loading; elements of earthquake effects.

CIVE766.title: Theory of Plates and Shells
CIVE766.description: Classical plate, shell and membrane theory for isotropic and layered anisotropic media. Analytic and computational solution techniques.

CIVE767.title: Structural Dynamics and Earthquake Engineering
CIVE767.description: Analysis, behavior, and design of structural systems subjected to dynamic loads, including earthquakes, wind, and ocean waves.

CIVE799A.title: Dissertation: Fluid Mechanics and Wind Engineering

CIVE799H.title: Dissertation: Water Resource Planning and Management

VS120.title: Introduction to Veterinary Science
VS120.description: Variety of topics associated with careers in veterinary sciences and animal health-related professions, including ethical issues, veterinary and non-veterinary career options, and the human-animal bond. Introduction to the importance of communication, team work, and problem-solving skills in professional careers.

VS230.title: Cultural/Societal Impacts of Animal Disease
VS230.description: Introduction to historic and contemporary examples of cultural and societal impacts of animal disease, including economic, social, political, and human health-related ramifications. Consider the roles and options of a broad range of professions as they relate to animal health in the mitigation of negative impacts of animal disease.

VS301.title: Research Seminar on Human-Animal Interactions
VS301.description: Research seminar designed to help students explore various topics and current research related to human-animal interactions. The seminar will include lectures by various faculty, online threaded discussions, and a small capstone project.

VS310.title: Communication Skills for Animal Professions
VS310.description: Professional training and specifically tailored communication skills designed to meet the needs of animal professionals.

VS313.title: Prevention and Control of Livestock Diseases

VS331.title: Histology
VS331.description: Analysis of animal cells, tissues, and organs emphasizing light microscopy.

VS333.title: Domestic Animal Anatomy
VS333.description: Comparative functional anatomy of the dog, horse, and cow.

VS401.title: Human Animal Interactions
VS401.description: Roles animals play in society, and the impact of human and animal relationships.

VS410.title: Pets Forever – Supporting the Life-Long Bond
VS410.description: Opportunity to engage with older adults and individuals with disabilities and their companion animals. Enrichment of students’ experience through the opportunity to gain community service experience.

VS562.title: Applied Data Analysis
VS562.description: Data management, application and interpretation of statistical analysis, and reporting of results for students in health science fields.

VS602.title: Critical Evaluation of Scientific Literature
VS602.description: Method of evaluating scientific literature. Students present critiques of papers they have chosen.

VS605.title: Comparative Anesthesiology
VS605.description: Techniques in anesthesia for large and small animals.

VS606.title: Comparative Anesthesiology Laboratory
VS606.description: Techniques in anesthesia for large and small animals.

VS612.title: Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery
VS612.description: Advances in surgical patient care, surgical instrumentation, and reconstruction.

VS613.title: Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery Laboratory
VS613.description: Advances in surgical patient care, surgical instrumentation, and reconstruction.

VS626.title: Infertility and Genital Disease
VS626.description: Infectious and noninfectious causes of reproductive failure in food animals.

VS628.title: Physiology and Pathophysiology
VS628.description: Overview of the normal physiology and pathophysiology of disease states of mammalian organ systems.

VS630.title: Orthopedic Surgery
VS630.description: Techniques, devices, and prosthetic materials in rehabilitating musculoskeletal problems.

VS631.title: Orthopedic Surgery Laboratory
VS631.description: Procedures applied to skeletal preparations and living animals.

VS642.title: Ophthalmology
VS642.description: Instrumentation, ocular therapeutics, and clinical ophthalmology.

VS644.title: Principles of Theriogenology
VS644.description: Provide basic and practical understanding of reproduction in domestic species. Including the anatomy and physiology of males and females, gamete development, fertilization, embryonic development, parturition and early neonatal care; focusing on domestic animals. In addition to basic normal physiology, characteristic disease states and potential treatments will be discussed, as well as methods for improving reproductive capabilities, such as artificial insemination and embryo transfer.

VS648.title: Food Animal Production and Food Safety
