Provides an opportunity to design innovative projects to solve development issues that support self-reliance, sustainability, and poverty alleviation. Introduction to international development program management culminating in the development of a request for funding, with implementation and performance management plans.

IE482A.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Africa
IE482A.description: Current global issues, topics, traditions studied in one or more countries of the region.

IE482B.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Asia
IE482B.description: Study abroad session focusing on business and economic conditions in Japan.

IE482C.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Australia/Oceania
IE482C.description: Current global issues, topics, traditions studied in one or more countries of the region.

IE482D.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Canada/North America
IE482D.description: Current global issues, topics, traditions studied in one or more countries of the region.

IE482E.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Europe
IE482E.description: Current global issues, topics, traditions studied in one or more countries of the region.

IE482F.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Contemporary Cuba
IE482F.description: Interdisciplinary Travel Course on Contemporary Cuba; history, politics, economics, and culture of Cuba.

IE482G.title: Travel Study: Global Studies-Middle East
IE482G.description: Current global issues, topics, traditions studies in one or more countries of the region.

IE678.title: Managing International Development Programs
IE678.description: Build practical skills for international development practitioners in project design and management. Provides an opportunity to design innovative projects to solve development issues that support self-reliance, sustainability, and poverty alleviation. Introduction to international development program management culminating in the development of a request for funding, with implementation and performance management plans.

INST200.title: Interdisciplinary Approaches to Globalization
INST200.description: Uses an interdisciplinary lens to explore and elucidate the issues, themes, and problems associated with globalization. Helping students navigate the complexities of our globalized and globalizing world, introducing students to diverse cultures and societies around the world and highlight global patterns and connections, and familiarizing students with the value of interdisciplinary research.

INST301.title: International Studies Research Methods
INST301.description: Familiarizes students with the research content and methods of International Studies. Illustrates applications of interdisciplinary research through various topics such as global commodities.

INST382A.title: Study Abroad--Jamaica: African History and Culture
INST382A.description: Exploration of the lives of African Caribbean people in Jamaica; the forces that have shaped the socio-economic and cultural history of the region; the impact of tourism on the Caribbean economy; and the importance of national culture in the articulation of Caribbean identity.

INST382B.title: Study Abroad--Mediterranean: Mediterranean Environment and History
INST382B.description: Explore the social, political, and environmental consequences of past and present human interactions with nature in the Mediterranean world. Utilizing case studies in Spain and Morocco become familiar with the Mediterranean environment, and introduce key environmental issues in this critical region.

INST382C.title: Study Abroad--Mexico: Global Citizenship and Community Engagement
INST382C.description: Explores the concept of global citizenship through the study of globalization in Todos Santos, Mexico, as well as service and experiential learning in the local community in the areas of education, health, and environment / sustainability.

IU140.title: Foundations of Sport Management
IU140.description: Introduces various sectors of the field of sport management to develop an understanding of the breadth of opportunities throughout the industry.

IU150.title: Diverse Students in Higher Education
IU150.description: Issues surrounding educational opportunity and social mobility through direct mentoring with high school students.

IU170.title: A Call to Lead I: Theories and Skills
IU170.description: Fundamentals of leadership theories and skills.

IU171.title: A Call to Lead II: Social Change Model
IU171.description: Social change model of leadership development.

IU172.title: New Student Seminar
IU172.description: Ease the transition to college by learning how identities and experiences inform values, skills and interests, and how they apply to educational and professional aspirations. Explore how to be successful academically, and develop meaningful relationships as a member of CSU’s inclusive campus community.

IU193.title: Freshman Seminar
IU193.description: Academic study in small-class setting. Topics vary by instructor.

IU198.title: Freshman Laboratory Research
IU198.description: Hands-on research on an academic research project.

IU270.title: Leadership Styles I: Personal Application
IU270.description: Leadership styles and contexts for personal application.

IU271.title: Leadership Styles II: Prominent Leaders
IU271.description: Leadership styles and contexts of prominent leaders for personal application.

IU273.title: Leadership Techniques for Greeks
IU273.description: Critical elements of analytical and intellectual examination and reflection of certain core issues in the practice of leadership.

IU274.title: Learning Assistants in Higher Education
IU274.description: Introduces Learning Assistants (LAs) to learning theory and conceptual development. Focuses on the acquirement of teaching skills that enhance collaborative and active learning. Skill exploration and practice includes questioning techniques, motivation and cooperative learning, and small group facilitation.

IU300.title: Becoming A Scientist
IU300.description: Developing science identity, leadership, and purpose within an ever-changing academic environment; current topics in science & diversity; finding a research mentor; skills for conducting research.

IU470.title: Effective Leadership I: Success as a Leader
IU470.description: Personal leadership skill development and its relationship to success as a leader.

IU471.title: Effective Leadership II: Vision and Change
IU471.description: Individual personal leadership styles; relationship between personal skill development and successful leadership.

IU486.title: Practicum for Interdisciplinary Leadership
IU486.description: Field experience applying leadership theories/principles through professional projects.

IU487.title: Internship for Interdisciplinary Leadership
IU487.description: Internship applying leadership theories/principles in a professional setting.

IU498.title: Research for Interdisciplinary Leadership
IU498.description: Research exploring leadership and one's academic discipline.

JTC100.title: Media in Society (GT-SS3)
JTC100.description: Role of media in American democracy; impact of media on individuals and society.

JTC192.title: Freshman Seminar
JTC192.description: Basic journalism skills; newsgathering and newswriting.

JTC200.title: Professional Writing
JTC200.description: Basic elements of writing for professional and specialized audiences.

JTC203.title: Television Studio Production
JTC203.description: Hands-on application of the skills needed to produce programs in a television studio.

JTC204.title: Radio Operations
JTC204.description: Hands-on application of the skills needed to operate a radio station. Focus on web-based broadcasting and podcasting; become certified 90.5 KCSU DJs, podcasters, and reporters.

JTC211.title: Visual Communication
JTC211.description: Theory and techniques for visually presenting information in various media industries.

JTC270.title: Analyzing Data in Journalism and Media
JTC270.description: Application of quantitative concepts and methodologies of data analysis to investigation of media and communication problems.

JTC300.title: Professional and Technical Communication (GT-CO3)
JTC300.description: Professional writing and presentation skills applied to students' major fields.

JTC301.title: Corporate and Professional Communication (GT-CO3)
JTC301.description: Principles and practice of effective corporate communication with emphasis on written professional reports.

LEAP500.title: Leadership in the Arts
LEAP500.description: Theoretical and applied knowledge about concepts of leadership, leadership styles as applied to arts-related organizations.

LEAP600.title: Arts Policy and Advocacy
LEAP600.description: Discussion of the role of artist as citizen and how we affect public policy.

LEAP650.title: Arts Events Management
LEAP650.description: Technical aspects of events, season and festival management for arts-related organizations.

LEAP660.title: Arts Collaboration and the Community
LEAP660.description: Research, development and production of outreach projects; team projects for community engagement.

LEAP670.title: Law and the Arts
LEAP670.description: Examines the legal foundations of artistic creation including copyright, freedom of expression, public domain laws, and contract negotiation.

LEAP687.title: Internship
LEAP687.description: Field internship at local, regional or national arts organization (45 hours per credit).

LB173.title: Encountering the Global (GT-AH2)
LB173.description: Introduction to arts and humanities within a global cultural context via interdisciplinary approaches and cultural materials, or texts broadly conceived from the fields of literature, history, music, film, the visual arts, popular culture, etc., for a greater appreciation and experience of global cultures.

LB192.title: Blake Leadership Scholars--First-Year Seminar
LB192.description: Individualized introduction to resources and programs for Blake Leadership Scholar success at CSU, including leadership opportunities, service learning, and high impact co-curricular engagement.

LB193.title: Concepts/Critical Thinking in Liberal Arts
LB193.description: Concepts and success strategies essential to the Liberal Arts.  Students create a comprehensive academic plan.

LB205.title: Contemporary Legal Studies
LB205.description: Introduction to sources and contemporary principles of law in the United States and to the study and practice of law.

LB300.title: Specialized Professional Writing
LB300.description: Emphasizes specialized writing skills used in professional letters, resumes, manuals, critiques, complaints, and interest-specific research projects.

LB360.title: Mock Trial
LB360.description: Aspects of trial court procedure and litigation process, including opening statements, physical and demonstrative evidence introduction, direct and cross-examination of witnesses, objections, responses to objections, and closing arguments. Role play of civil and criminal courtroom action.

LB370.title: Liberal Arts and Meaningful Work
LB370.description: Assist Liberal Arts students transition from college to career. Students will apply skills and theory from their Liberal Arts degrees to the search for meaningful work, research the job market, and begin building professional networks.

LB386F.title: Practicum–Sports Production
LB386F.description: Practicum in producing for various sporting events.

LB386G.title: Practicum–Event Production
LB386G.description: Practicum in producing for various on- and off-campus CSU-related events.

LB392.title: Junior Seminar
LB392.description: Employing interdisciplinary approaches and methods, this course explores contemporary issues and problems that cross or transcend any one liberal arts disciplinary perspective.

LB393.title: Seminar in Arts, Humanities, Social Sciences
LB393.description: Special topics team-taught course in the arts and/or humanities and/or social sciences that crosses disciplinary boundaries.

LB455.title: Narrative Fiction Film as a Liberal Art

LB456.title: Documentary Film as a Liberal Art

LB482A.title: Study Abroad: Energy Transitions in Europe

LB482B.title: Study Abroad--Italy: Comparative Legal Studies
LB482B.description: Study the legal system in Italy versus the United States. Consider the following: the Italian court system and legislature, labor law (trade unions), business law (launching/operating a business), criminal law (specifically organized crime), civil law (Italian civil law vs Vatican law).

LB490.title: Interdisciplinary Portfolio Workshop
LB490.description: Identifying, reflecting, and focusing interdisciplinary Liberal Arts experience via the completion of a senior portfolio of work demonstrating breadth of understanding and mastery of the key skill sets and interdisciplinary approaches to problem-solving.

LB492.title: Liberal Arts Capstone Seminar
LB492.description: Integration and reflection for liberal arts majors with an emphasis on core competencies and academic, professional and/or career transitions.

LI301.title: Research in the Information Age
LI301.description: Developing strategies for library research; locating appropriate resources; and selecting, evaluating, and recording relevant information.

LI382A.title: Study Abroad--Mexico: Empowerment and Cultural Literacy
LI382A.description: Global opportunity that encourages Latinx Heritage Seekers to embrace and strengthen their identity as bicultural individuals, by learning how to navigate an international setting that offers increased self-awareness related to history and culture. Expand and explore identity through cultural literacy in a diversity of formats (e.g., lectures, cultural institutions, performance, libraries, readings, discussions, and interaction with peers). The course is open to all.

LIFE102.title: Attributes of Living Systems (GT-SC1)
LIFE102.description: Levels of organization, stability, and change in living systems.

LIFE103.title: Biology of Organisms-Animals and Plants (GT-SC1)
LIFE103.description: Diversity of animals and plants; their structural and functional characteristics.

LIFE162.title: Bridging the Biol/Chem Gulf for Pre-Health Majors

LIFE201A.title: Introductory Genetics: Applied/Population/Conservation/Ecological (GT-SC2)
LIFE201A.description: Introduction to genetics, with emphasis on applied genetics, population genetics, and conservation/ecological genetics.

LIFE201B.title: Introductory Genetics: Molecular/Immunological/Developmental (GT-SC2)
LIFE201B.description: Introduction to genetics, with emphasis on applied genetics, population genetics, and conservation/ecological genetics.

LIFE202A.title: Introductory Genetics Recitation: Applied/Population/Conservation/Ecological
LIFE202A.description: Case-studies and problem solving in applied genetics, population genetics, and conservation/ecological genetics.

LIFE202B.title: Introductory Genetics Recitation: Molecular
LIFE202B.description: Case studies and problem-solving in molecular genetics.

LIFE203.title: Introductory Genetics Laboratory
LIFE203.description: Basic molecular genetics and molecular aspects of development laboratory.

LIFE205.title: Microbial Biology
LIFE205.description: General principles of microbiology focused on human-microbial interactions.

LIFE210.title: Introductory Eukaryotic Cell Biology
LIFE210.description: Structure and function of macromolecules focusing on proteins and lipid bilayers. Cellular composition, organelles and trafficking between them. Basic metabolism, cell signaling and proliferation control.

LIFE211.title: Introductory Cell Biology Honors Recitation
LIFE211.description: Molecular aspects of cellular and subcellular biology and introductory biochemistry recitation.

LIFE212.title: Introductory Cell Biology Laboratory
LIFE212.description: Molecular aspects of cellular and subcellular biology and introductory biochemistry laboratory.

LIFE320.title: Ecology
LIFE320.description: Interrelationships among organisms and their environments using conceptual models and quantitative approaches.

MGT301.title: Supply Chain Management
MGT301.description: Concept of value-driven supply chains; design and management of effective supply chains; emphasis on current practice and recent trends.

MGT305.title: Fundamentals of Management
MGT305.description: Managerial process of planning, directing, and controlling inputs of an organization. Analysis, decision making, and survey of research literature.

MGT310.title: Human Resource Management
MGT310.description: Principles and practices of employee management including hiring, development, compensation, and employee relations.

MGT320.title: Contemporary Management Principles/Practices
MGT320.description: Principles of management in combination with practices of the new economy to achieve managerial goals.

MGT330.title: Creativity, Innovation, and Value Creation
MGT330.description: How creativity and innovation can be developed for application in value creation.

MGT340.title: Fundamentals of Entrepreneurship
MGT340.description: Concepts of entrepreneurship and role of entrepreneurs in the economy.

MGT350.title: Employment Relations: The Legal Environment
MGT350.description: Legal principle and policy issues arising from the employment relationship.

MGT360.title: Social and Sustainable Venturing
MGT360.description: Entrepreneurship and economic opportunities in the transition to a socially and ecologically sustainable global economy.

MGT374.title: Total Rewards and Performance Management
MGT374.description: Principles and best practices for the strategic design and implementation of compensation and performance management systems.

MGT375.title: Advanced Supply Management
MGT375.description: Advanced design of purchasing and supply management within global supply chains.

MGT376.title: Advanced Service and Manufacturing Operations
MGT376.description: Advanced concepts for the management of operations in service and manufacturing companies.

MGT377.title: Advanced Logistics
MGT377.description: Advanced design and management of logistics and distribution operations within global supply chains.

MGT382.title: Management in an International Context
MGT382.description: Fundamentals of management taught in an international context.  Emphasis on global management topics.

MGT410.title: Leadership and Organizational Behavior
MGT410.description: Behavior of people and groups as members of organizations.

MGT411.title: Leading High Performance Teams
MGT411.description: Design, management, and leadership of teams in organizational settings.

MGT420.title: New Venture Creation
MGT420.description: Entrepreneurs and the entrepreneurial process. Growth of an independent business.

MGT425.title: Organizational Communication Strategies
MGT425.description: Strategic communications in organizations; contribution that organizational members make whether acting as individual or group communicators.

MGT430.title: Leadership and Social Responsibility
MGT430.description: Social responsiveness of managers as they face expectations in the firm's internal and external environment.

MGT435.title: Global Ethical Leadership & Stakeholder Mgmt
MGT435.description: Develop knowledge and competence in global ethical leadership and stakeholder relationships in a global economy.

MGT440.title: New Venture Management
MGT440.description: Theories and skills necessary for managing startup and existing small firms.

MGT450.title: Biomedical Entrepreneurship I
MGT450.description: Commercialization process for biomedical inventions; market and competitor analysis, regulations, patents; preliminary feasibility study.

MGT468.title: Negotiating Globally
MGT468.description: Characteristics and process of negotiation in a global context.

MGT469A.title: Study Abroad--Peru: Global SCM Experience
MGT469A.description: Examination of supply chain practices and culture of Peru. Develop an understanding of the management of global aspects of a supply chain as well as the differences between managing a supply chain in a well developed country and a developing country with less infrastructure and expertise in the field.

MGT470.title: Managerial Decisions-Issues and Analysis
MGT470.description: Investigation and application of managerial decision-making processes and methods to solve problems in business functions.

MGT471.title: Micro Issues in Supply Chain Management
MGT471.description: Managing the supply function (locally or globally) and the productive flow of materials in goods and services-producing supply chains.

MGT472.title: Macro Issues in Supply Chain Management
MGT472.description: Application of analytical and computer-based tools in the analysis and improvement of supply chains with variable demand and supply.

MGT473.title: Employment Relations: Labor and Management
MGT473.description: Managerial decision making and action in labor-management relations as affected by labor legislation and administrative practices.

MGT474.title: Human Resource Planning and Development
MGT474.description: Human resource planning, recruitment, selection, training, and development.

MGT475.title: International Business Management
MGT475.description: Multinational corporations:  their scope, activities, managerial problems and decisions.

MGT476.title: Negotiation and Conflict Management
MGT476.description: Principles and practices of negotiation and conflict management including bargaining as a social and managerial activity.

MGT478.title: Global Supply Chain Management
MGT478.description: Principles and best practices for the strategic design and implementation of global supply chains.

MGT479.title: Strategic Human Resource Management
MGT479.description: An integration of the various functions of human resource (HR) management. Provides a strategic and data-driven perspective on HR and the development of data analysis and change management skills to improve HR processes. Topics include: strategic HR management, HR as a competitive advantage, balanced scorecard, analytical foundations of HR measurement, descriptive and predictive analytics, change strategies, and responses to organizational change.

MGT482A.title: Study Abroad: International New Venture Creation
MGT482A.description: New venture creation taught in an international setting focusing on multi-country contexts. Emphasis on entrepreneurship and intrapreneurship in today's global environments.

MGT482C.title: Study Abroad--Todos Santos: Ventures in Social Entrepreneurship

MGT482D.title: Study Abroad--Portugal: Leading High Performance Teams
MGT482D.description: Design, management, and leadership of teams in organizational settings with a focus on how teams are different across different contexts. Explore how national culture impacts organizational team dynamics, processes, and performance and compare and contrast teams in Portugal to those in the U.S.

MGT486.title: Practicum in Supply Chain Management
MGT486.description: Research and recommend solutions to "real world" supply chain management problems.

MGT492A.title: Seminar: Supply Chain Management
MGT492A.description: In depth study of a current topic/related topics important to supply chain managers and supply chain management education.

MGT600.title: Manufacturing Process and Systems Design
MGT600.description: Strategic understanding of alternate manufacturing processes and systems design support needed to manage those processes.

MGT610.title: Strategic Human Resource Management
MGT610.description: Strategic issues associated with recruiting, staffing, evaluating, compensating, and developing employees; leadership issues associated therein.

MGT612.title: Managing in a Global Context
MGT612.description: Global management and HR development issues/practices. Cross-cultural issues in organization behavior, recruitment, selection, training, compensation.

MGT625.title: Managerial Communication Practices
MGT625.description: Internal, external, and managerial communication.  Managerial speaking and writing skills enhancement.

MGT640.title: Supply Chain Management Strategies
MGT640.description: How to create an effective supply chain management system to establish an efficient network for supplying final consumption.

MGT663.title: Strategic Opportunities in Impact Enterprise
MGT663.description: Gain foundational knowledge of central sustainability challenges, concepts and tools of strategic management and entrepreneurship, and discover the economic opportunities present in the resolution of social and environmental issues. Develop an understanding of the role of corporations and entrepreneurs in resolving market imperfections, addressing sustainability challenges, and transitioning to a more sustainable economy. Introduce sustainability practices used by corporations and new ventures.

MGT665.title: Supply Chain Development and Management
MGT665.description: This course teaches the development and management of the global supply chain that plans, sources, makes and delivers an organization's products.

MGT667.title: Global Social Sustainable Entrepreneurship
MGT667.description: Global challenges--poverty, environmental degradation, public health, agriculture. Role of entrepreneurial management in private and public sector.

MGT668.title: New Venture Development for Social Enterprise
MGT668.description: Early stages of a new venture, including creation of business plan. Additional study of social entrepreneurship and sustainable business strategies.

MGT671.title: Labor Management Relations
MGT671.description: Collective bargaining process, administration of contract, and impact of public policy on industrial relations.

MGT675.title: Service Operations/Supply Chain Management
MGT675.description: Supply chain management (SCM) and operations function. Primary focus on service sector.

MGT679.title: Principles of Strategic Management
MGT679.description: Processes through which firms choose and implement strategies. Formulation and implementation of strategic management process in variety of industries.

MKT300.title: Marketing
MKT300.description: Market and buyer analysis, product and service development, pricing, promotion, advertising, selling, and distribution.

MKT305.title: Fundamentals of Marketing
MKT305.description: Overview of marketing activities involved in provision of products and services to customers, including target markets and managerial aspects.

MKT307.title: Fundamentals of Sports Marketing
MKT307.description: General marketing and the application within sporting related contexts. Focuses on the nature and scope of marketing a sports franchise as well as marketing traditional products or services with the assistance of sports figures.

MKT315.title: Marketing Communication Design
MKT315.description: Creating multiple kinds of marketing communications using graphic design software.

MKT320.title: Integrated Marketing Communications
MKT320.description: Principles and practices of managing promotional activities including advertising, sales promotion, and other major media.

MKT330.title: Business Customer Relationships
MKT330.description: Managing relationships with distribution channel intermediaries and business customers.

MKT361.title: Buyer Behavior
MKT361.description: Marketing analysis of buying behavior of individuals, households, businesses, and not-for-profit organizations.

MKT362.title: Professional Selling
MKT362.description: Persuasive personal communications in selling consumer and industrial products and services.

MKT363.title: Sales Management
MKT363.description: Recruiting, selecting, training, compensating, motivating, supervising, and evaluating a sales force.

MKT364.title: Product Design
MKT364.description: Designing innovative products, services, brands, and experiences is critical for creating value within all kinds of organizations in the marketplace and society. Creative problem solving to define design challenges, create concepts with low-fidelity prototyping, evaluate assumptions using co-creation, and communicate ideas with stakeholders. Internalize and practice the frameworks, processes, and tools for leading a product innovation process in any kind of organization.

MKT365.title: International Marketing
MKT365.description: Analysis of international markets and development of strategic and tactical options for marketing across national boundaries.

MKT366.title: Services Marketing
MKT366.description: Customer service issues and unique challenges involved in marketing and management of services operations.

MKT367.title: Sports Marketing
MKT367.description: The nature and scope of applying marketing strategy and tactics in the sports marketing environment.

MKT370.title: Digital Marketing
MKT370.description: Introduction to digital marketing: the landscape and tactics needed to execute marketing strategy in an online, connected, world.

MKT375.title: Social Media Marketing
MKT375.description: Provides the knowledge and skills to effectively use social media to market a business. Obtain in-depth knowledge and understanding of the various facets of social media marketing strategy, platforms and tactics, and how social media integrates into the overall marketing and communication plan.

MKT410.title: Marketing Research
MKT410.description: Role and methodology of research in business emphasizing selection of study's direction, collecting data, and choosing techniques for analyzing these data.

MKT440.title: Pricing and Financial Analysis in Marketing
MKT440.description: Financial analysis involved in addressing marketing problems; advanced study of pricing strategy and tactics.

MKT450.title: Marketing Analytics
MKT450.description: Analytic techniques used by marketers to transform data into decision-making information.

MKT479.title: Marketing Strategy and Management
MKT479.description: Marketing decisions involving integration of elements of the marketing mix.

MKT482A.title: Study Abroad: Cross-Cultural Marketing in China
MKT482A.description: International setting focusing on multi-country contexts. Emphasis on consumer and business customer behavior in today's global environment.

MKT486.title: Marketing Practicum
MKT486.description: To give students the experience of working on a real marketing problem with a team at a sponsoring firm.

MKT568.title: Sport Marketing
MKT568.description: Examines sport marketing information systems, pricing strategies, media relations, promotional methods, and endorsements as they relate to marketing theories. Practical applications and principles.

MKT600.title: Marketing Management and Strategy
MKT600.description: Processes of customer value creation and value capture; marketing strategy analysis.

MKT601.title: Marketing for Social Sustainable Enterprises
MKT601.description: Customer and stakeholder value creation and capture. Marketing strategy with emphasis on social sustainable organizations.

MKT610.title: Qualitative Marketing Research Methods
MKT610.description: Overview of qualitative research methods including focus groups, in-depth interviews, observations, and projective techniques.

MKT611.title: Quantitative Marketing Research Methods
MKT611.description: Overview of the field of business research, with a focus on quantitative research methods.

MKT621.title: Search Engine Marketing and Optimization
MKT621.description: Focuses on search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM). Students will improve the visibility of webpage(s) in the “organic results” through a variety of SEO tactics. Use paid activities (using the Google AdWords platform) to drive traffic from the search engine results page. Emphasizes application of class frameworks and concepts.

MKT650.title: Data Analytics
MKT650.description: Examine the pivotal role of marketing research in the data analytics process. Emphasis on research design, experimental design, sampling theory and various data collection methods. Evaluate the reliability and validity of marketing research data and data analysis tools (SPSS/SAS/R) and report on research findings.

MKT651.title: Applied Data Analytics
MKT651.description: Introduces the scope of the secondary data environment and teaches the analytic techniques used by marketers to transform data into decision making information. Focuses on primary data collection techniques, advanced analytic techniques and their application to marketing decision making.

MKT661.title: Consumer Behavior
MKT661.description: Marketing analysis of buying behavior of individual consumers.

MKT662.title: Strategic Selling for Business Customers
MKT662.description: Examination of sales strategies, sales tactics and best practices in professional selling with a primary context in business selling.

MKT664.title: Design Thinking for Sustainable Enterprise
MKT664.description: Guides students in generating sustainable products, services, and business models. Topics build on a foundational understanding of markets and strategies that address triple bottom line imperatives. Emphasizes applying design thinking tools, cross-disciplinary insights, qualitative research, low-fidelity prototyping, and experimentation.

MKT667.title: Services Marketing Management
MKT667.description: Fundamental concepts and strategies that differentiate the marketing of services from the marketing of tangible goods, including customer satisfaction.

MKT670.title: Digital Marketing
MKT670.description: Overview of digital marketing tactics. Focuses on the practical application of tactics in support of basic business strategies as they apply to the online world of marketing, including websites, analytics, content marketing, email marketing, and emerging technologies, among other digital based topics. Particular focus will be given to measurement in a digital world through analytics and metrics.

MKT692.title: Seminar
MKT692.description: Critical review and discussion of relevant marketing topics.

MSE501.title: Materials Technology Transfer
MSE501.description: The pathways toward commercialization of materials from research. Case studies, technology readiness levels, proposal writing, entrepreneurship, and intellectual property practices.

MSE502A.title: Materials Science & Engineering Methods: Materials Structure and Scattering
MSE502A.description: Introduction to the atomic level arrangements of materials, defects related to these structures, and X-ray Diffraction, X-ray scattering, and electron diffraction methods.

MSE502B.title: Materials Science & Engineering Methods: Computational Materials Methods
MSE502B.description: Introduction to mathematical and computational methods that are used to model materials: Simulation/Modeling, Monte-Carlo, Monte-Carlo Potts, Density Functional Theory, and other approaches.

MSE502C.title: Materials Science & Engineering Methods: Materials Microscopy
MSE502C.description: Introduction to modern microscopy techniques for materials research using optical microscopy. Interferometry and confocal techniques, scanning electron, microscopy transmission electron microscopy, and scanning probe microscopy.

MSE502D.title: Materials Science & Engineering Methods: Materials Spectroscopy
MSE502D.description: The investigation and measurement of spectra produced when matter interacts with or emits electromagnetic radiation, including an introduction to X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, electron energy loss spectroscopy, Raman and infrared, and energy dispersive spectroscopy for materials research.

MSE502E.title: Materials Science & Engineering Methods: Bulk Properties and Performance
MSE502E.description: Physical properties of materials and how they relate to the functionalization of materials, including their use in electronic, magnetic, optical, and other functional devices.

MSE502F.title: Materials Science & Engineering Methods: Experimental Methods for Materials Research
MSE502F.description: Modern experimental design methods and techniques for materials research. Topics include vacuum systems, cryogenic experimentation, temperature characterization, data acquisition and digitization, device and circuitry design in the context of materials research.

MSE503.title: Mechanical Behaviors of Materials
MSE503.description: The mechanical behavior of metals, polymeric, ceramic, and composite materials in mechanical designs from a structure to processing to properties perspective. Practical and specific performance analyses of structural materials are examined.

MSE504.title: Thermodynamics of Materials
MSE504.description: The determination of whether and the means by which a given reaction can occur. Macroscopic and microscopic solid-state thermodynamics with experimental methodologies for characterizing them, with a focus on thermodynamic and statistical mechanical aspects of material structure-property relationships.

MSE505.title: Kinetics of Materials
MSE505.description: The determination of whether and the means by which a given reaction can occur. Macroscopic and microscopic solid-state kinetics with experimental methodologies for characterizing them, with a focus on the kinetic aspects of material structure-property relationships.

MSE651.title: Special Topics in Materials Science
MSE651.description: New or emerging topics in materials science and engineering.

MSE695.title: Independent Study
MSE695.description: Independent study of special topics in materials science and engineering.

MSE699.title: Thesis
MSE699.description: Thesis in materials science and engineering.

MSE784.title: Supervised College Teaching
MSE784.description: Supervised college teaching in materials science and engineering.

MSE793.title: Professional Development Seminar
MSE793.description: Professional skills for careers in materials science and opportunities for students to see materials innovation and discovery up-close.

MSE795.title: Independent Study
MSE795.description: Advanced independent study of special topics in materials science and engineering.

MSE799.title: Dissertation
MSE799.description: Dissertation in materials science and engineering.

MATH101.title: Math in the Social Sciences (GT-MA1)
MATH101.description: Voting theory, power indices, fair division, apportionment, circuits and trees, list processing, descriptive statistics, probability.

MATH105.title: Patterns of Phenomena
MATH105.description: Applications of mathematical ideas and mode of thought in the arts and humanities, focusing on classification, recognition.

MATH117.title: College Algebra in Context I (GT-MA1)
MATH117.description: Functions as mathematical models. Linear, quadratic, and polynomial functions considered symbolically, graphically, numerically, and contextually.

MATH118.title: College Algebra in Context II (GT-MA1)
MATH118.description: Reciprocals of linear functions, rational functions, and power functions considered symbolically, graphically, numerically, and contextually.

MATH124.title: Logarithmic and Exponential Functions (GT-MA1)
MATH124.description: Definition and graphs of exponential and logarithmic functions, properties of logarithmic functions, exponential and logarithmic equations, applications.

MATH125.title: Numerical Trigonometry (GT-MA1)
MATH125.description: Definition and graphs of trigonometric functions, laws of sines and cosines, solutions of right and oblique triangles, applications.

MATH126.title: Analytic Trigonometry (GT-MA1)
MATH126.description: Inverse trigonometric functions, trigonometric identities, solving trigonometric equations.

MATH141.title: Calculus in Management Sciences (GT-MA1)
MATH141.description: Analytic geometry, limits, equilibrium of supply and demand, differentiation, integration, applications of the derivative, integral.

MATH151.title: Mathematical Algorithms in Matlab I
MATH151.description: Statements, expressions and variable assignments, scripts, control statements and logical statements. Newton's method, Simpson's rule, recursion.

MATH152.title: Mathematical Algorithms in Maple
MATH152.description: Iteration and recursion, control and logical statements, expressions, functions, data types, binary numbers, symbolic manipulation of terms.

MATH155.title: Calculus for Biological Scientists I (GT-MA1)
MATH155.description: Limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration of elementary functions with applications in the biosciences.

MATH157.title: One Year Calculus IA (GT-MA1)
MATH157.description: Algebra and trigonometry, study skills for calculus. Limits, continuity, differentiation of elementary functions with applications.

MATH159.title: One Year Calculus IB (GT-MA1)
MATH159.description: Study skills for calculus. Differentiation and integration of elementary functions with applications. Conic section.

MATH160.title: Calculus for Physical Scientists I (GT-MA1)
MATH160.description: Limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration of elementary functions with applications; conic sections.

MATH161.title: Calculus for Physical Scientists II (GT-MA1)
MATH161.description: Transcendental functions, integration techniques, polar coordinates, sequences and series, with mathematical software.

MATH192.title: First Year Seminar in Mathematical Sciences
MATH192.description: Introduction to the richness and variety of problems addressed by mathematical language and techniques; resources and available careers.

MATH229.title: Matrices and Linear Equations
MATH229.description: Linear systems, matrix arithmetic, homogeneous coordinates, complex numbers, eigenvalues, eigenvectors, applications to discrete dynamical systems.

MATH230.title: Discrete Mathematics for Educators
MATH230.description: Voting theory, fair division, graph theory, linear programming, probability, teaching in small groups, proof techniques, mathematical technology.

MATH235.title: Introduction to Mathematical Reasoning
MATH235.description: Mathematical statements and proof techniques, induction, set theory, inequalities, number systems, functions.

MATH255.title: Calculus for Biological Scientists II
MATH255.description: Derivatives and integrals of functions of several variables, differential and difference equations, matrices, applications in the biosciences.

MATH261.title: Calculus for Physical Scientists III
MATH261.description: Vector functions, partial differentiation, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, multiple integrals, line integrals, Green's theorem.

MATH271.title: Applied Mathematics for Chemists I
MATH271.description: Series and limits, Taylor series, complex variables, first- and second- order ordinary differential equations, matrices, linear transformations, determinants, and eigenvalues.

MATH272.title: Applied Mathematics for Chemists II
MATH272.description: Vector fields, partial differentiation, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, multiple integrals, line integrals, the Wave and the Schrödinger equations, separation of variables method. Inner Product Spaces. Fourier Series.

MATH301.title: Introduction to Combinatorial Theory
MATH301.description: Matrices, orthogonal Latin squares, designs, difference sets, sets, binomial coefficients, inclusion and exclusion, recurrence, Ramsey's theorem, SDRs.

MATH317.title: Advanced Calculus of One Variable
MATH317.description: Convergence of sequences, series: limits, continuity, differentiation, integration of one-variable functions.

MATH331.title: Introduction to Mathematical Modeling
MATH331.description: Problem formulation. Modeling, theoretical and empirical. Variable selection. Derivation and simulation of solutions. Model testing including prediction.

MATH332.title: Partial Differential Equations
MATH332.description: Partial differential equations, separation of variables, Fourier series and transforms, Laplace, heat and wave equations.

MATH340.title: Intro to Ordinary Differential Equations
MATH340.description: First and second order equations, series, Laplace transforms, linear algebra, eigenvalues, first order systems of equations, numerical techniques.

MATH345.title: Differential Equations
MATH345.description: First and second order equations, LaPlace transforms, first order systems of equations, numerical methods, applied linear algebra, linearization.

MATH348.title: Theory of Population and Evolutionary Ecology

MATH360.title: Mathematics of Information Security
MATH360.description: Codes, ciphers, Chinese remainder theorem, primality testing, public key ciphers, RSA, finite fields, discrete algorithms, AES encryption.

MATH366.title: Introduction to Abstract Algebra
MATH366.description: Sets, integers, polynomials, real and complex numbers, groups, integral domains, and fields; development of skills for proving theorems.

MATH369.title: Linear Algebra I
MATH369.description: Linear systems, matrices, subspaces of Euclidean spaces, linear transformations on Euclidean spaces, eigenvalues, eigenvectors.

MATH384.title: Supervised College Teaching
MATH384.description: Skills for effective tutoring of precalculus mathematics; design and implementation of the Individualized Mathematics Program.

MATH405.title: Introduction to Number Theory
MATH405.description: Diophantine equations; distribution of primes; multiplicative functions; finite fields; quadratic reciprocity; quadratic number fields.

MATH417.title: Advanced Calculus I
MATH417.description: Topology of Euclidean spaces, limits, derivatives and integrals on Euclidean spaces. Implicit functions and the implicit function theorem.

MATH418.title: Advanced Calculus II
MATH418.description: Line and surface integrals, series, sequences and series of functions.

MATH419.title: Introduction to Complex Variables
MATH419.description: Analyticity, Cauchy integral theorem and formula, Taylor and Laurent series, residue calculus, conformal mapping and harmonic functions.

MATH425.title: History of Mathematics
MATH425.description: Historical development of geometry, arithmetic, algebra, and calculus from ancient times to 20th century.

MATH430.title: Fourier and Wavelet Analysis with Apps

MATH435.title: Projects in Applied Mathematics

MATH450.title: Introduction to Numerical Analysis I

MATH451.title: Introduction to Numerical Analysis II
MATH451.description: Numerical computation of eigenvalues, numerical solution of ordinary and partial differential equations.

MATH455.title: Mathematics in Biology and Medicine
MATH455.description: Models in population biology, cell division, host-parasoid systems, bacterial growth and predator-prey systems.

MATH460.title: Information and Coding Theory
MATH460.description: Entropy, mutual information, channel capacity, channel coding theorem, syndrome decoding, BCH codes, recent developments.

MATH466.title: Abstract Algebra I

MATH467.title: Abstract Algebra II
MATH467.description: Advanced topics in abstract algebra: Euclidean domains, abstract vector spaces, extension fields, Galois theory.

MATH469.title: Linear Algebra II

MATH470.description: Topics from real Euclidean, affine metric and non-Euclidean geometries emphasizing methods and connections with other areas of mathematics.

MATH472.title: Introduction to Topology

MATH474.title: Introduction to Differential Geometry
MATH474.description: Local and global geometry of curves and surfaces in Euclidean space, curvature, covariant differentiation, geodesics and the Gauss-Bonnet theorem.

MATH476.title: Topics in Mathematics
MATH476.description: Study experiences which deal with established content areas in mathematics.

MATH487.title: Internship
MATH487.description: A work-learn experience integrating classroom theory with practical experience.

MATH498.title: Undergraduate Research in Mathematics
MATH498.description: Research skills and techniques taught to suit student's level and interests. Includes both oral and written communication of results.

MATH501.title: Combinatorics I
MATH501.description: Puzzles, numbers and counting, subsets, recurrence relations, generating functions, inversion, counting with symmetry, networks, matchings.

MATH502.title: Combinatorics II
MATH502.description: Graph algorithms, external set theory; partitions, Hadamard matrices, q-binomials, finite geometries, strongly regular graphs, triple systems, designs.

MATH505.title: Teaching Problem Solving in Mathematics K-12
MATH505.description: Problem-solving strategies, cooperative learning, and manipulatives for K-12 classroom.

MATH507.title: Advanced Reasoning in Mathematics
MATH507.description: General proof techniques, proof in abstract algebra, proof in analysis, and proof in combinatorics.

MATH510.title: Linear Programming and Network Flows
MATH510.description: Optimization methods; linear programming, simplex algorithm, duality, sensitivity analysis, minimal cost network flows, transportation problem.

MATH517.title: Introduction to Real Analysis
MATH517.description: Euclidean and metric spaces, compactness, continuity, sequences, series, multivariable differentiation, inverse and implicit function theorems.

MATH519.title: Complex Variables I
MATH519.description: Analytic functions, complex integration theory, singularities, elementary functions, and mapping.

MATH520.title: Nonlinear Programming
MATH520.description: Theoretical, computational, practical aspects of nonlinear programming (NLP); unconstrained, constrained NLP; quadratic programming; large-scale NLP.

MATH525.title: Optimal Control
MATH525.description: Theory and application of optimal control and optimal estimation theory; continuous and discrete time systems; Pontryagin maximum principle.

MATH530.title: Mathematics for Scientists and Engineers
MATH530.description: Proof-oriented linear algebra, ordinary and partial differential equations.

MATH532.title: Mathematical Modeling of Large Data Sets
MATH532.description: Mathematical theory and algorithms for modeling large data sets.  Application to real world problems.  Emphasis on geometric ideas.

MATH535.title: Foundations of Applied Mathematics
MATH535.description: Calculus of variations, peturbation methods, models of continuum, dimensional analysis, stochastic models, integral equations, diffusion.

MATH540.title: Dynamical Systems
MATH540.description: Linear and nonlinear systems, orbits, phase space, flows of vector fields, stability, bifurcation theory, chaos, strange attractors and applications.

MATH545.title: Partial Differential Equations I
MATH545.description: Second order linear PDEs, elliptic and parabolic equations, equations of math physics, separation of variables, Fourier series.

MATH546.title: Partial Differential Equations II
MATH546.description: Distribution theory, Green's functions, Sobolev spaces, elliptic and parabolic equations.

MATH550.title: Numerical Methods in Science and Engineering

MATH560.title: Linear Algebra
MATH560.description: Finite dimensional vector spaces, inner products, dual spaces, transformations, projections, adjoints, norms, eigenvalues, eigenvectors.

MATH561.title: Numerical Analysis I
MATH561.description: Numerical linear algebra, solving nonlinear systems, least squares, and minimization.

MATH566.title: Introduction to Abstract Algebra I
MATH566.description: Analysis of algebraic structures including groups, rings, fields, and vector spaces.

MATH567.title: Introduction to Abstract Algebra II
MATH567.description: Field theory, Galois theory, and advanced linear algebra.

MATH569A.title: Linear Algebra for Data Science: Matrices and Vectors Spaces
MATH569A.description: A basic introduction to matrices and linear algebra with preparation to pursue further studies in the applications of matrices with an emphasis on the foundations of data science.

MATH570.title: Topology I
MATH570.description: Point-set topology including basic set theory, continuity, product and quotient spaces, metrization, compactness, and connectedness.

MATH571.title: Topology II
MATH571.description: Fundamental group, free groups and presentations, and manifolds.

MATH601.title: Advanced Combinatorics I
MATH601.description: Special numbers, mobius inversions, transversals, partial orders, different sets, codes, t-designs.

MATH602.title: Advanced Combinatorics II
MATH602.description: Hypergeometric functions, graph algorithms, hadamard matrices, strongly regular graphs, association schemes.

MATH617.title: Integration and Measure Theory
MATH617.description: Riemann-Cauchy integration theory, sigma-algebras, Lebesgue theory of measure and integration, Fubini's Theorem, Radon-Nikodym theorem, Lp spaces.

MATH618.title: Advanced Real Analysis
MATH618.description: Normed linear spaces, Banach and Hilbert spaces, elements of functional analysis.

MATH619.title: Complex Variables II
MATH619.description: Infinite products, entire functions, analytic continuation, Riemann surfaces, other topics.

MATH620.title: Variational Methods and Optimization I
MATH620.description: Unconstrained and constrained infinite dimensional optimization, calculus of variations, applications.

MATH621.title: Variational Methods and Optimization II
MATH621.description: Unconstrained and constrained infinite dimensional optimization, variational inequalities, Lagrange multipliers, control, applications.

MATH633.title: Industrial and Applied Mathematics
MATH633.description: Team solution of problems arising in industrial and applied mathematics.  Problem formulation, solution proposal, implementation and analysis.

MATH640.title: Ordinary Differential Equations I
MATH640.description: Existence and uniqueness, continuation, continuous dependence, linear systems, and stability.

MATH641.title: Ordinary Differential Equations II
MATH641.description: Topics selected from nonlinear boundary value problems, periodic phenomena, differential operators, and others.

MATH645.title: Advanced Partial Differential Equations I
MATH645.description: Abstract methods for linear partial differential equations.

MATH646.title: Advanced Partial Differential Equations II
MATH646.description: Problems in nonlinear partial differential equations.

MATH651.title: Numerical Analysis II
MATH651.description: Interpolation, approximation, quadrature, initial and boundary value problems.

MATH652.title: Advanced Numerical Methods for PDEs
MATH652.description: Theory of numerical methods for solution of PDEs: convergence and stability properties; error estimation; approximation theory.

MATH666.title: Advanced Algebra I
MATH666.description: Theory of rings and algebras with applications.

MATH667.title: Advanced Algebra II
MATH667.description: Advanced topics from algebra:  representation theory, Wedderburn theory, bilinear forms, multilinear and homological algebra.

MATH670.title: Introduction to Differential Manifolds
MATH670.description: Finite-dimensional differential manifolds, submanifolds, vector fields and flows, Lie groups and algebras.

MATH672.title: Projective Geometry I
MATH672.description: Algebraic sets in projective space, the Nullstellensatz, rational maps and functions, coordinate rings, Hilbert functions, dimension, degree.

MATH673.title: Projective Geometry II
MATH673.description: Topics selected from curves and surfaces, sheaf theory, algebraic geometry, singularity theory, vector bundles.

MATH676.title: Topics in Mathematics
MATH676.description: Advanced study experiences which deal with established content areas in mathematics.

MATH687.title: Internship
MATH687.description: A work-learn experience integrating classroom theory with practical experience.

MATH717.title: Functional Analysis I
MATH717.description: Topological vector spaces; Banach and Hilbert spaces.

MATH718.title: Functional Analysis II
MATH718.description: Spectral theory, operator theory, semigroups of transformations, and distribution theory.

MATH750.title: Numerical Methods and Models I
MATH750.description: Derivation of model equations, introduction to solution techniques and computing.

MATH751.title: Numerical Methods and Models II
MATH751.description: Convergence, stability, error estimates and computing.

MECH103.title: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
MECH103.description: Introduction to mechanical engineering, including relevant programming and computer technologies such as MATLAB and Excel.

MECH105.title: Mechanical Engineering Problem Solving
MECH105.description: Programming and engineering problem solving techniques, algorithms and processes based on first principles of physics and calculus.

MECH182A.title: Study Abroad--Germany: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
MECH182A.description: Introduction to mechanical engineering, and relevant programming and computer technologies, including MATLAB and Excel. Exploration of global engineering in Berlin, Germany. Explore concepts through guest lectures, discussion with German engineers, and visits to German engineering companies.

MECH200.title: Introduction to Manufacturing Processes
MECH200.description: Engineering drawings, materials, manufacturing, and safety. Hand tools, cutting, drilling, the lathe, mill and numerical control.

MECH200A.title: Introduction to Manufacturing Processes: Lecture
MECH200A.description: Introduction to engineering drawings, materials, manufacturing processes, and shop safety. Fundamentals and principles associated with hand tools, cutting, grinding, the lathe, mill, and numerical control.

MECH200B.title: Introduction to Manufacturing Processes : Laboratory
MECH200B.description: Applied introduction to engineering drawings, materials, manufacturing processes, and shop safety. Basic hand tools, cutting, grinding, the lathe, mill, introduction to numerical control. Experiential learning is emphasized through hands-on laboratory activities.

MECH201.title: Engineering Design I
MECH201.description: Engineering design methods used to portray three-dimensional objects and visually communicate design information with an emphasis on computer-aided design using parametric solid modeling and geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.

MECH202.title: Engineering Design II
MECH202.description: Engineering design process with emphasis on teamwork, ideation, decision-making, project planning applied to a group design project.

MECH231.title: Engineering Experimentation
MECH231.description: Measurement systems; experimental design; data acquisition and analysis techniques.

MECH237.title: Introduction to Thermal Sciences
MECH237.description: First and second laws of thermodynamics, properties of materials, energy conversion, statistical aspects, heat transfer.

MECH262.title: Engineering Mechanics
MECH262.description: Forces, static equilibrium, mass center, moments of inertia, kinematics and kinetics of particles and rigid bodies.

MECH301A.title: Engineering Design III: Finite Element Analysis
MECH301A.description: Application of computer-aided finite element analysis (FEA) tools for the simulation and prediction of robustness and performance of mechanical components and assemblies.

MECH301B.title: Engineering Design III: Computational Fluid Dynamics
MECH301B.description: Application of computer-aided computational fluid dynamics (CFD) tools for the simulation and prediction of robustness and performance of mechanical components and assemblies.

MECH303.title: Energy Engineering
MECH303.description: Energy generation (coal, oil, natural gas, solar, wind, geothermal, hydropower, tidal, biofuel, nuclear...), conversion, distribution, storage, efficiency.

MECH307.title: Mechatronics and Measurement Systems
MECH307.description: Mechatronic and measurement system analysis and design; applied electronics; data acquisition; microcontroller interfacing and programming.

MECH324.title: Dynamics of Machines
MECH324.description: Analysis and synthesis of moving machinery.

MECH325.title: Machine Design
MECH325.description: Design of mechanical components to avoid failure during operation. Stress analysis, failure theories, and specific mechanical components in design context.

MECH331.title: Introduction to Engineering Materials
MECH331.description: Characteristics of metallic, plastic, and ceramic material; basic principles which relate properties of materials to their atomic and microstructure.

MECH337.title: Thermodynamics
MECH337.description: First and second laws, property relationships, characteristic functions, thermodynamics solver, various thermodynamics applications.

MECH338.title: Thermal/Fluid Sciences Laboratory
MECH338.description: Experimental methods in heat transfer, fluid flow, and thermodynamics.

MECH342.title: Mechanics and Thermodynamics of Flow Processes
MECH342.description: Engineering details of viscous flow with losses, measurements, compressibility, turbomachinery, convective heat transfer.

MECH344.title: Heat and Mass Transfer
MECH344.description: Transport and rate processes, conduction, convection, and radiation.

MECH392.title: Graduate Education and Research Seminar
MECH392.description: Research in graduate school and industry as a career option for mechanical engineers.

MECH407.title: Laser Applications in Mechanical Engineering
MECH407.description: Review of electromagnetic waves; applications of lasers and optics in engineering, e.g., position sensing, flowfield measurement, cutting and welding.

MECH408.title: Applied Engineering Economy
MECH408.description: The basic principles and calculations of engineering economy with application to real problems, including energy and the environment.

MECH411.title: Manufacturing Engineering
MECH411.description: Casting, forming, machining, and welding processes used in manufacturing operations.

MECH417.title: Control Systems
MECH417.description: Feedback and forward loop control design and simulation; discrete time and frequency domain methods with implementation considerations.

MECH420.title: Aerospace Structures
MECH420.description: Analysis of aerospace structures; introduction to theory of elasticity, stress analysis of thin-walled structures in bending, torsion, and shear, and finite element methods and applications to aerospace structures.

MECH424.title: Advanced Dynamics
MECH424.description: Kinematics and dynamics of rigid bodies. Hamilton's principle and Lagrange's equations for lumped parameter extended bodies and distributed systems.

MECH425.title: Mechanical Engineering Vibrations
MECH425.description: Vibrations applied to rotating machinery and structures. SDOF and MDOF systems, mode shapes, vibration measurements and control. Hands-on lab.

MECH431.title: Metals and Alloys
MECH431.description: Engineering metals and alloys, modification of properties by alloying, plastic deformation, and heat treatment. Fundamentals of physical metallurgy.

MECH432.title: Engineering of Nanomaterials
MECH432.description: Structure, properties, and processing of extremely small (10 to the minus 9 m) synthetic and natural materials.

MECH437.title: Internal Combustion Engines
MECH437.description: Application of thermodynamics, heat transfer, and fluid mechanics to internal combustion engines.

MECH460.title: Aeronautics
MECH460.description: Thermodynamics and fluid mechanics principles applied to the mechanics, aerodynamics, performance, stability, and control of airplanes.

MECH463.title: Building Energy Systems
MECH463.description: Comfort, psychrometrics, loads, solar radiation, heating and cooling system design, transport, solar system design, economics.

MECH468.title: Space Propulsion and Power Engineering
MECH468.description: Orbital mechanics and space missions; chemical, nuclear, and electric rockets; nuclear heat sources; thermoelectric and photovoltaic devices.

MECH477.title: Algorithms in Scientific Computing
MECH477.description: Numerical methods for scientific computing relevant to problems arising in mechanical and aerospace engineering, with an emphasis on applications, mathematical principles and algorithms, code development, and tool building.

MECH486A.title: Engineering Design Practicum: I
MECH486A.description: Capstone engineering design project; transition experience to the mechanical engineering profession in industry and graduate education.

MECH486B.title: Engineering Design Practicum: II
MECH486B.description: Capstone engineering design project; transition experience to the mechanical engineering profession in industry and graduate education.

MECH498A.title: Engineering Research Practicum: I
MECH498A.description: Capstone engineering research project; transition experience to graduate research and education.

MECH498B.title: Engineering Research Practicum: II
MECH498B.description: Capstone engineering research project; transition experience to graduate research and education.

MECH502.title: Advanced/Additive Manufacturing Engineering
MECH502.description: Materials, controls, and mechanics applied to additive manufacturing; rapid prototyping; direct digital manufacturing.

MECH505.description: Technology review and application of engineering sciences and economics to the analysis and design of vapor power generation systems. Vapor power cycles, steam generation, and auxiliary systems associated with power plants. Overall design of power plants as well as component design. Fossil fuel and nuclear energy systems are considered.

MECH507.title: Laser Diagnostics for Thermosciences
MECH507.description: Basics of optics, spectroscopy, and lasers.  Physics and applications of laser diagnostic techniques used in thermosciences.

MECH509.title: Design and Analysis in Engineering Research
MECH509.description: Design, model building, analysis and reporting in engineering and manufacturing research and experimentation.

MECH513.title: Simulation Modeling and Experimentation
MECH513.description: Logic/analytic modeling in simulations. Event and transient entity-based simulation languages. Simulation design, experimentation and analysis.

MECH515.title: Advanced Topics in Mechanical Vibrations
MECH515.description: Structural modal analysis, rotordynamics, and torsional vibrations. Lectures are supported with practical application labs.

MECH517.title: Chemical Rocket Propulsion
MECH517.description: Principles of chemical rocket propulsion theory, including practical applications of rocket propulsion system design and analysis.

MECH520.title: Finite Element Analysis in Mechanical Engr
MECH520.description: Application of FEA as a tool to analyze mechanical engineering problems.

MECH524.title: Principles of Dynamics
MECH524.description: Kinematics and dynamics of rigid body motion; Lagrangian and Hamiltonian formulations of mechanics; applications to engineering problems.

MECH527.title: Hybrid Electric Vehicle Powertrains
MECH527.description: Hybrid powertrains and modeling including vehicle dynamics, internal combustion engine, electric motor, energy storage, and control.

MECH529.title: Advanced Mechanical Systems
MECH529.description: Modeling, analysis, and synthesis of practical mechanical devices in which dynamic response is dominant consideration.

MECH530.title: Advanced Composite Materials
MECH530.description: Materials aspects of advanced composite constituents and how their combination yields synergistic results.

MECH533.title: Composites Product Development
MECH533.description: Practical application of advanced fiber reinforced materials in mechanical design, including composite constituent materials selection, performance, analysis, and manufacturing.

MECH534.title: Energy & Env. Impacts of Transportation

Topics include vehicle design, dynamics and efficiency; combustion and emission formation; internal combustion engines, fuel cells, batteries, and powertrains; conventional and alternative fuels; travel demand and modes; and life cycle analysis and criteria pollutant emissions.

MECH538.title: Mechanical Engineering Thermodynamics
MECH538.description: First and second laws of thermodynamics applied to engineering devices and systems. Introduction to exergy, equilibrium, chemical reactions, thermodynamic relations, and special topics.

MECH539.title: Advanced Fluid Mechanics
MECH539.description: Kinematics, Navier-Stokes equations, vorticity, viscous flows, scaling analysis, boundary layers, secondary flows, entropy generation and transport, stability and transition, turbulence.

MECH543.title: Biofluid Mechanics
MECH543.description: Fluid dynamic concepts for understanding fluid motion in living organs/organisms; advanced research applications.

MECH544.title: Advanced Heat Transfer
MECH544.description: Fundamentals and engineering applications of heat transfer including conduction, convection, and radiation.

MECH551.title: Physical Gas Dynamics I
MECH551.description: Characteristics of real gases in reacting and nonequilibrium systems; equilibrium air; statistical mechanics, chemical thermodynamics.

MECH552.title: Applied Computational Fluid Dynamics
MECH552.description: Introductory theory of CFD, formulation of engineering problems for CFD analyses, mesh generation, solver settings, and postprocessing.

MECH557.title: Turbomachinery
MECH557.description: Application of fundamental principles of thermodynamics and fluid mechanics to turbomachinery.

MECH558.title: Combustion
MECH558.description: Combustion processes: explosions, detonations, flame propagation, ignition, generation of pollutants in moving and stationary energy conversion systems.

MECH564.title: Fundamentals of Robot Mechanics and Controls
MECH564.description: Kinematics of robots, controls for robots.

MECH567.title: Broad-Beam Ion Sources
MECH567.description: Physical processes in broad-beam electron-bombardment ion sources for space propulsion and ion machining applications.

MECH568.title: Computational Methods for Mechanical Eng.
MECH568.description: Fundamental principles which provide the foundation for the software and algorithms used in Mechanical Engineering.

MECH575.title: Solar and Alternative Energies
MECH575.description: Solar radiation, flat-plate collectors, energy storage, space heating and cooling, power generation, applications, simulation.

MECH577.description: Aerosols and their applications in science and engineering, air pollution control, atmospheric science, and public health. Topics cover the physical and chemical principles underlying the behavior of particles suspended in air, including particle size, aerodynamics, motion of particles in a force field, particle size statistics, and optical and electrical properties.

MECH628.title: Applied Fracture Mechanics
MECH628.description: Stress distribution near cracks; energy criteria for fracture; design criteria; fracture toughness testing.

MECH657.title: Advanced Computational Gas Dynamics
MECH657.description: Advanced computational algorithms for gas dynamics.

MECH658.title: Advanced Combustion Theory and Modeling
MECH658.description: Asymptotic structure of flames, limit phenomena and multi-phase combustion.

MECH661.title: Theory/Control of Internal Combustion Engines
MECH661.description: Theory and applications of internal combustion engines. Alternative fuels, engine control, and pollution prevention.

MECH695D.title: Independent Study: Heat and Mass Transfer

MECH695E.title: Independent Study: Industrial and Systems Engineering

MECH778.title: Advanced Computational Modeling of Fluids
MECH778.description: Advanced topics in computational fluid dynamics, finite element methods, and linear/nonlinear engineering optimization techniques.

MIP101.title: Introduction to Human Disease (GT-SC2)
MIP101.description: Survey of human systems and diseases.

MIP149.title: The Microbial World
MIP149.description: Importance of microbiology in daily life, with emphasis on positive and negative roles of microbes, infectious disease, and current microbiology issues.

MIP150.title: Introduction to Research Methods
MIP150.description: Undergraduate research experience highlighting fundamental skills of laboratory research while working towards the goal of novel microbial discovery.

MIP192.title: Microbiology First-Year Seminar
MIP192.description: Introduction to microbiology major and faculty; academic and career planning; information sources in biomedical sciences.
