MIP250.description: Cell biology topics with emphasis on eukaryotic microbes. Topics include the central dogma of molecular biology, cell structure and function, and cell membranes as they relate to the importance of the host cell as well as parasites. Spotlight microbes will be studied that depict many eukaryotic processes important in cell biology, human health, and scientific models.

MIP260.title: The World of Parasites
MIP260.description: Introduction to parasitology; evolution, ecology, epidemiology, physiology, and morphology of representative parasites of every group.

MIP275.title: Microcomputing Applications in Microbiology
MIP275.description: Network software on MS-DOS microcomputers will be used to acquire and analyze data and information that are commonly encountered in microbiology.

MIP298.title: Introductory Research
MIP298.description: Freshman/sophomore research experience in a working research environment.

MIP300.title: General Microbiology
MIP300.description: Structure, function, development, physiology, and molecular biology of microorganisms emphasizing bacteria.

MIP302.title: General Microbiology Laboratory
MIP302.description: Laboratory skills and techniques for isolating, characterizing, and identifying bacteria.

MIP303.title: General Microbiology--Honors Recitation
MIP303.description: Research and present topics related to the material presented in

MIP315.title: Pathology of Human and Animal Disease
MIP315.description: Biological systems critical to mammalian physiology and how each is affected by metabolic, genetic, environmental, and infectious agents.

MIP334.title: Food Microbiology
MIP334.description: Microorganisms in the spoilage of foods. Methods of control of microorganisms in food and the major food-borne diseases.

MIP335.title: Food Microbiology Laboratory
MIP335.description: Laboratory skills and techniques related to the presence of microorganisms in food, production, and preservation.

MIP342.title: Immunology
MIP342.description: Principles of immunology: components of the immune system, interactions of humoral and cellular elements, and clinical applications of basic concepts.

MIP343.title: Immunology Laboratory
MIP343.description: Techniques used in research and clinical immunology, including diagnostic problem solving and data analysis.

MIP351.title: Medical Bacteriology
MIP351.description: Bacteria which cause human and veterinary diseases; host-parasite relationships, disease mechanisms, prevention, and therapy.

MIP352.title: Medical Bacteriology Laboratory
MIP352.description: Laboratory skills and techniques necessary for identifying medically important bacteria.

MIP400H.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Prion Biology
MIP400H.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400I.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Mycobacterial Biology
MIP400I.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400J.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Big Data Sets in Microbiology
MIP400J.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400K.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Parasitology
MIP400K.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400L.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Microbiome Biology
MIP400L.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400M.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Vector Biology
MIP400M.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400N.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Environmental Sustainability & Health Science
MIP400N.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400O.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Pathology of Infectious Disease
MIP400O.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400P.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Veterinary Microbiology
MIP400P.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400Q.title: Capstone in Microbiology: One Health
MIP400Q.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400R.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Food Microbiology
MIP400R.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP400S.title: Capstone in Microbiology: Biofilm Biology
MIP400S.description: Discussion of literature on a topic of importance to the research community in the discipline.

MIP401.title: Laboratory Research Methods in Microbiology
MIP401.description: Hands-on experience in laboratory research methods for students working individually on a project which stems from a larger research project of a faculty member's laboratory. All students will work in the same facility equipped with appropriate equipment and supplies to conduct the student research project.

MIP420.title: Medical and Molecular Virology
MIP420.description: Principles of animal virology:  structure, classification, assay, diagnosis, control, replication, genetics, host-parasite relationships.

MIP425.title: Virology and Cell Culture Laboratory
MIP425.description: Isolation and characterization of viruses. Viral diagnostic and cell culture techniques.

MIP443.title: Microbial Physiology
MIP443.description: Structure, function of bacterial constituents; comparison with other organisms. Bacterial growth, energy production, biosynthesis.

MIP450.title: Microbial Genetics
MIP450.description: Principles of genetics at molecular level; mutation, recombination, complementation, suppression, control of gene expression, and recombinant DNA.

MIP496.title: Group Study
MIP496.description: Faculty-supervised investigation of areas of special interest in microbiology, virology, microbial physiology, or microbial genetics.

MIP520.title: Fundamentals of Prion Biology
MIP520.description: Current state of prion research, future research directions, and the relationship of prion disease with other disease systems. Critical reading and synthesis of the literature, with an emphasis on writing skills.

MIP525.title: Flow Cytometry for Immunology
MIP525.description: Understand and interpret flow cytometry principles. Background of flow cytometry, experimental design, applications, and brief explanation of cell sorting.

MIP530.title: Advanced Molecular Virology
MIP530.description: Virus-host interactions at the molecular and cellular level.

MIP540.title: Biosafety in Research Laboratories
MIP540.description: Practical applications of biosafety principles, including lab practices and regulatory aspects of research involving infectious microorganisms and rDNA.

MIP543.title: RNA Biology
MIP543.description: Gene expression and regulation that occurs at the level of RNA (e.g., splicing, stability, export, translation, RNAi, etc.).

MIP545.title: Microbial Metagenomics/Genomics Data Analysis
MIP545.description: Microbiomes, microbes and their genetic material present in a host/environment, are linked to risk of disease in humans, animals, and plants. Metagenomics, including 16S rRNA community survey methods and shotgun metagenomics, use high throughput sequencing technology to provide insight into the composition and potential function of microbiomes. Hands-on experience with using bioinformatics and statistical tools necessary to process and analyze the resulting large datasets.

MIP550.title: Microbial and Molecular Genetics Laboratory
MIP550.description: Use of both in vivo genetics and in vitro molecular techniques to study gene structure, function, and regulation in bacteria.

MIP555.title: Principles and Mechanisms of Disease
MIP555.description: Principles of disease processes; emphasis on reactivity of the diseased cell, tissue, organ, or organism.

MIP563.title: Biology of Disease Vectors
MIP563.description: Vector physiology and genomics, new strategies in vector control, and vector/host interactions.

MIP570.title: Functional Genomics
MIP570.description: State-of-the-art genomic tools with applications to studies of pathogenesis and pathophysiology of infectious diseases.

MIP611.title: Advanced Microbiological Research Methods
MIP611.description: In-depth presentation of the ever-growing arsenal of techniques needed to be an effective experimental microbiologist/molecular biologist.

MIP612.title: Applied Immunology
MIP612.description: Application of classic and modern principles in immunology currently being used in the medical, biotechnology and basic research fields.

MIP613.title: Applied Microbiology and Virology
MIP613.description: Application of bacteria, fungi and viruses in translational research, from drug and vaccine development to the generation of clean energy.

MIP614.title: Medical Microbiology
MIP614.description: In-depth examination of the pathogenic mechanisms of medically important bacteria, fungi, parasites and viruses.

MIP615.title: Ophthalmic Pathology
MIP615.description: Background in normal ocular histology as well as pathologic changes in the eye, taught through a combination of lectures and class discussions.

MIP616.title: Modern Molecular Biology for Microbiologists
MIP616.description: Develop a working knowledge in the theory and applications of modern molecular biology to applied and translational research uses in microbiology.

MIP617.title: Principles of Biodefense/Emerging Pathogens
MIP617.description: In-depth analysis of the physiology, biology and epidemiology of biodefense agents and emerging pathogens.

MIP618.title: MIP Masters Seminar Series
MIP618.description: Foster the development of MIP master’s students by improving communication skills and discussion of cutting edge research.

MIP619.title: MIP Masters Topics
MIP619.description: Foster the development of MIP master’s students by improving communication skills and discussion of cutting edge research.

MIP624.title: Advanced Topics in Microbial Ecology
MIP624.description: Recent conceptual developments in microbial ecology, emphasizing theoretical aspects of microbial ecology, particularly in an evolutionary context.

MIP628.title: Immunity to Infection
MIP628.description: How microorganisms have evolved to counteract the immune system and how the immune system has evolved to resist microbes.

MIP630.title: Advances in Microbial Physiology
MIP630.description: Contemporary developments in bacterial structure, function, metabolism, and genetics.

MIP636.title: Mechanisms of Viral Infection and Disease
MIP636.description: Cytopathic mechanisms, pathogenetic events in viral diseases; host response and antiviral immunity; cancer induction by DNA and RNA viruses.

MIP643.title: Grant Writing for Microbiology/Pathology
MIP643.description: To effectively communicate ideas, goals and approaches in a scientific grant proposal.

MIP651.title: Immunobiology
MIP651.description: Structure, function, regulation of immunoglobulins and the immune system. Cellular immunity including transplantation and cancer.

MIP654.title: Research Policies and Regulations
MIP654.description: Reviews CSU and federal policies, rules, and regulations on integrity, use of humans and animals, authorship, data, genetics, etc., using case studies.

MIP666.title: Writing Scientific Manuscripts
MIP666.description: Writing biological science manuscripts for publication.

MIP670.title: Molecular Immunology and Immunogenetics
MIP670.description: Molecular basis and genetics of immune response. Biochemistry of immunologically mediated diseases.

MIP675.title: Advanced Bioanalytic Pathology
MIP675.description: Laboratory medicine for post-graduate veterinarians and professional veterinary medical students.

MIP700.title: Topics in Microbiology
MIP700.description: Current literature in bacteriology, virology, genetics, and immunology.

MIP720.title: Methods of Carbohydrate Analysis
MIP720.description: Structural analysis of complex carbohydrates using gas chromatography, mass spectrometry, and nuclear magnetic resonance.

MIP730.title: Principles of Flow Cytometry & Cell Sorting

MIP740.title: Microbial and Molecular Genetics
MIP740.description: Molecular biology and genetics of prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells and their viruses; strategies for genetic manipulation.

MIP760.title: Mechanisms of Bacterial Pathogenesis
MIP760.description: Mechanisms of bacterium-host interaction at molecular and cellular levels in pathogenesis of bacterial disease.

MIP765.title: Comparative Neuropathology
MIP765.description: Spontaneous diseases of nervous system of domesticated, laboratory, and wild animals.

MIP766.title: Cytopathology--Clinical Pathology
MIP766.description: Discussion of cytology cases that are diagnostically challenging, medically interesting, or classic case examples. Discussions and microscopic reviews of the cases will be led by a clinical pathologist.

MIP767.title: Advanced General Pathology
MIP767.description: In-depth, detailed study of general pathology and molecular mechanisms of disease. Help prepare students in the Anatomic and/or Clinical Pathology Residency prepare for the ACVP Board examination. Enhance the pathology knowledge and skills of Professional Veterinary Medicine students and graduate students in related disciplines.

MIP768.title: Advanced Clinical Pathology
MIP768.description: In-depth clinical pathology (cytology, hematology, and biochemistry) for post-professional students in CVMBS residency and/or graduate degree programs.

MIP778.title: Pathobiology of Laboratory Animals
MIP778.description: Unique natural biology and diseases of laboratory animal species emphasizing clinical, diagnostic, morphologic and clinical pathologic features.

MIP779.title: Laboratory Animal Pathology Rotation
MIP779.description: Using case material compiled from submissions to the Laboratory Animal Resources necropsy service, the VTH Diagnostic services, the Armed Forces Institute of Pathology, and other resources, analyze selected slides demonstrating histologic pathology in laboratory animals. Prepare a description of the slide, provide a diagnosis and a brief summary of the pathogenesis.

MIP786A.title: Practicum: Comparative Gross and Histologic Pathology

MLSC101.title: Introduction to the Army
MLSC101.description: Basic leadership attributes and the core tactical competencies of an Army officer.

MLSC102.title: Foundations of Agile and Adaptive Leadership
MLSC102.description: Communication, critical thinking, and related core competencies used to lead small Army units.

MLSC201.title: Leadership and Decision Making
MLSC201.description: Principles and theories of adaptive leadership, critical thinking, decision making, and the core tactical competencies used to lead small Army units.

MLSC202.title: Army Doctrine and Team Development
MLSC202.description: Theories and methods of effective leadership of small units, with a focus on military operations, problem solving, and team building.

MLSC235.title: Military Tactical Leadership

Physical conditioning is a significant component of this class.

MLSC250.title: Basic Camp Leader Internship
MLSC250.description: Practical leadership development and management skills in a military operations environment.

MLSC301.title: Adaptive Tactical Leadership
MLSC301.description: The study, practice, and application of the fundamentals of Army leadership, officership, Army values and ethics, personal development, and small unit tactics at the platoon level.

MLSC302.title: Applied Leadership in Small Unit Operations
MLSC302.description: Advanced practice and application of the fundamentals of Army leadership, officership, Army values and ethics, personal development, and small unit tactics at the squad and platoon levels.

MLSC386.title: Advanced Camp Practicum
MLSC386.description: Leadership principles and skills applied to actual field situations.

MLSC395.title: Independent Study
MLSC395.description: Leadership theory and skills as applied to the military.

MLSC401.title: The Army Officer
MLSC401.description: Culminating study of Army leadership focuses on building teams, coordinating and synchronizing training, mentoring subordinates, and preparing students for commissioning into the Profession of Arms.

MLSC402.title: Company Grade Leadership
MLSC402.description: Culminating study of Army leadership and mission command with emphasis on geographical commands, unified land operations, and the application of leadership and Army principles.

MU100.title: Music Appreciation (GT-AH1)

MU475A.description: One hour lessons for students with performance concentration.

MU498.title: Research in Music Therapy
MU498.description: Participation of undergraduate music therapy majors in departmental research projects.

MU510.title: Foundations of Music Education

MU511.description: Arranging and scoring skills related to elementary, choral, wind band, orchestral, and jazz ensembles in K-12 music classrooms. Publishing concerns and intellectual property rights related to both composing and arranging for educational ensembles.

MU512.description: Theory and application of creative musical skills as applied in K-12 music classrooms. Includes pedagogy of improvisation and composition, pedagogy of music theory and aural skills, and the application of original creative works in music classrooms.

MU517.description: Appropriate analytic techniques for Middle Ages, Renaissance, and baroque music.

MU524.title: Eurhythmics for the School Music Classroom
MU524.description: Musicianship, aesthetics, and pedagogy as studied through the body via movement and gesture.

MU534.title: Music of the Romantic Era

MU535.title: Music of the Twentieth Century
MU535.description: Twentieth-century music emphasizing cultural, stylistic, and theoretical concepts.

MU543.title: Advanced Research Methods in Music Therapy
MU543.description: Research techniques used in measuring and recording behavior. Advanced methods used in music therapy research.

MU544.title: Advanced Techniques-Neurologic Music Therapy
MU544.description: Advanced neurologic music therapy techniques used with various clinical populations.

MU545.title: Composition and Improvisation--Music Therapy
MU545.description: Composition and improvisation methods for music therapy practitioners.

MU550.title: Social Psychology of Music Learning
MU550.description: Sociological and psychological theories and issues related to contemporary music education contexts. Apply theory into practice through observation and practicum assignments with public and private education institutions.

MU551.title: Curriculum and Assessment of Music Learning
MU551.description: Examine and apply research related to curriculum development and assessment of student learning to contemporary music education contexts. Emphasizes tenets related to human intelligence and learning, measurement of student learning, and educational policy from the world (UNESCO) and local perspectives (school districts/state mandates).

MU552.title: Contemporary Issues in Music Education
MU552.description: Essential information pertinent to a broad array of domestic and international music education contexts. Critically engaging with and producing original scholarship relative to the examination of contemporary trends.

MU555.title: Choral Techniques, Style, and Interpretation
MU555.description: Techniques for achieving expressive conducting, problems of tone and diction, musical style and interpretation, and rehearsal techniques.

MU556.title: Advanced Instrumental Conducting and Techniques
MU556.description: Score reading and analysis, preparation of instrumental scores for performance; expressive baton techniques, rehearsal methods and procedures.

MU557.title: Advanced Vocal Pedagogy

MU564.title: Collaborative Piano Literature

MU565.title: Piano Literature-1800 to Present

MU630.title: Methods of Music Research
MU630.description: Research, documentation, and bibliography for music history, literature, performance, theory, acoustics, music education, and quantitative testing.

MU649.title: Advanced Practice in Music Therapy
MU649.description: Study of advanced music therapy techniques.

MU669.title: Instrumental Literature
MU669.description: Solo and small ensemble literature for string, woodwind, and brass instruments.

MU671.title: Graduate Recital
MU671.description: Demonstration of graduate-level applied musical proficiency through public performance.

MU692G.description: Seminar on advanced topics in music therapy methods, techniques, and philosophy.

MU744.title: Music Therapy Research to Practice
MU744.description: Critically evaluate research processes pertaining to music therapy clients/consumers/patients and the profession.

NR120A.title: Environmental Conservation (GT-SC2)
NR120A.description: Overview of natural resources environmental concerns including population, pesticides, energy, and pollution.

NR120B.title: Environmental Conservation
NR120B.description: Overview of natural resources environmental concerns including population, pesticides, energy, and pollution.

NR130.title: Global Environmental Systems (GT-SC2)
NR130.description: Studies of the Earth's lithosphere, hydrosphere, atmosphere, and biosphere systems and their interrelations with human dimensions.

NR150.title: Oceanography (GT-SC2)
NR150.description: Introduction to the geology, physics, chemistry, and biology of the world ocean; oceanic relationships with various human dimensions.

NR151A.title: Study Abroad: Oceanography Lab (GT-SC1)
NR151A.description: Witness first-hand the dynamic interactions between the ocean and land that shape the Baja California peninsula, separating the (Gulf of California (Sea of Cortez) and the Pacific Ocean. The Gulf is one of the most diverse seas on Earth with a wide range of endemic and migratory species while the nutrient-rich Pacific Ocean is home to kelp beds and sandy beaches. Learn field-sampling techniques and explore various oceanic processes and learn how these processes relate to marine ecosystems.

NR192.title: First Year Seminar in Environmental Studies
NR192.description: Introduction to the disciplines involved in natural resources through exposure to current issues.

NR193.title: FRS First Semester Seminar
NR193.description: Students are given an introductory overview of their field of study, while being introduced to departmental policies and processes, university resources with assistance from guest speakers, and possible career paths in their field with current professionals.

NR220.title: Natural Resource Ecology and Measurements
NR220.description: Ecology of Rocky Mountains ecosystems. Basic measurements and integrated management of natural resources.

NR300.title: Biological Diversity
NR300.description: Biological diversity examined in context of species; extinction. Principles, techniques of conservation biology utilized to understand and resolve issues.

NR310.title: Ecosystem Services and Human Well-Being
NR310.description: Life-supporting and life-fulfilling benefits that nature provides to humans; theory, case studies, and policy.

NR319.title: Geospatial Applications in Natural Resources
NR319.description: Introduction to global positioning systems (GPS), geographic information systems (GIS) and remote sensing (RS) with natural resource applications.

NR320.title: Natural Resources History and Policy
NR320.description: History, values and institutions, and policy process guiding natural resources management and conservation.

NR322.title: Introduction to Geographic Information Systems
NR322.description: Fundamental concepts of spatial data handling and computer-assisted map analysis.

NR326.title: Forest Vegetation Management
NR326.description: Ecologically-based management to restore and manage forests.

NR330.title: Human Dimensions in Natural Resources
NR330.description: Social, political, cultural, and economic considerations in natural resource management.

NR353.title: Global Change Ecology, Impacts and Mitigation

NR355.title: Contemporary Environmental Issues
NR355.description: Fundamental concepts of energy, population, and ecology applied to range of contemporary environmental issues.

NR365.title: Environmental Education
NR365.description: Principles of interpretation related to natural resource management and public informal education.

NR367.title: Concepts in Vertebrate Nutrition
NR367.description: Concepts in suborganismal and organismal vertebrate nutrition; introduction to nutritional ecology.

NR370.title: Coastal Environmental Ecology
NR370.description: Sensitive and complex coastal area environments and the effects of accelerated change on and offshore caused by human activities.

NR375.title: Environment and Natural Resources Leadership
NR375.description: Environment and natural resources leadership history, skills, and styles. Creation of leadership path and organization prescriptions.

NR377.title: Pre-Internship
NR377.description: Designed to prepare majors in Natural Resource Tourism and Human Dimensions of Natural Resources for experiential learning.

NR380.title: Spatial Analysis of Social Data
NR380.description: Spatial analysis and analysis of socio-economic data; common themes related to land use and landscape change, parks & protected areas, and global tourism.

NR382A.title: Travel Abroad: Social-Ecological Field Methods in Kenya
NR382A.description: Social and ecological field methods commonly used in natural resource management.

NR382B.title: Travel Abroad: Social-Ecological Field Methods in Belize
NR382B.description: Social and ecological field methods commonly used in natural resource management.

NR400.title: Public Communication in Natural Resources
NR400.description: Examine how public communication shapes opinion and understanding of natural resource issues. Combines study of key communication concepts with experiential projects, including critique of a public hearing and creation of media products. Through readings, case studies, and assignments, analyze approaches for effective public communication. Design brochures, websites, videos, etc., eventually collaborating in teams with real-life ‘clients’.

NR401.title: Techniques in Public Relations
NR401.description: Effective communications methods related to natural resource professions; preparation of graphics, organization of programs using slide show format.

NR420.title: Integrated Ecosystem Management
NR420.description: Natural resource management exercises; quantitative integration techniques, group dynamics.

NR421.title: Natural Resources Sampling
NR421.description: Designs, techniques, problems in sampling natural resource populations; analysis, interpretation of data.

NR422.title: GIS Applications in Natural Resource Management
NR422.description: Development and implementation of GIS projects and problems in spatial data analysis.

NR423.title: Applications of Global Positioning Systems
NR423.description: Introduction to concepts and use of global positioning systems with applications to natural resources.

NR425.title: Natural Resource Policy and Sustainability
NR425.description: Principles, concepts, and operating examples of sustainable resource management with a concentration on forest policies and practices.

NR426.title: Programming for GIS I
NR426.description: Fundamentals and applications of programming techniques for geospatial data management and analysis. Introduction to basic computer programming concepts used in a GIS environment. Develop the programming skills needed to create scripts for automating GIS data management and analysis. Emphasize best practices for writing code, error handling, and demonstrates how to share and publish scripts.

NR427.title: Programming for GIS II
NR427.description: Applications and advanced topics in programming techniques for geospatial data management and analysis.

NR432.title: Foundations of National Forest Lands Program
NR432.description: History of U.S. public land law and evolution of National Forests. Nature, policy, trend, and needs of lands program; its integration into management.

NR433.title: Special Uses Management
NR433.description: Authorities, application, and administration; agriculture, aviation, community, public information, industrial, water, treasure trove, and cultural uses.

NR434.title: Linear Uses and FERC Licenses
NR434.description: Rights-of-way authorities and management; road and trail grants and easements; communication uses; Federal Energy Regulatory Commission licenses.

NR435.title: Valuation and Landownership Adjustment
NR435.description: Authorities, coordination, valuation, title; land purchase, donation, exchange, interchange, transfers, sales, condemnation, and negotiation.

NR436.title: Right-of-Way Acquisition
NR436.description: Need, authority, policy, planning, acquiring, negotiating, and managing rights-of-way; cost-share agreements.

NR437.title: Boundaries, Status, Claims, and Withdrawals
NR437.description: Administration of landownership status, title encumbrances, withdrawals, title claims, Native American rights and claims, property boundary management.

NR440.title: Applications in Conservation Planning
NR440.description: Conservation planning method applications that integrate natural resources by conservation organizations and government agencies.

NR444.title: Fire Economics and Policy
NR444.description: Development of wildlife and fuel management economics integrated with critical federal policies.

NR460.title: Wilderness Management
NR460.description: Management of wilderness in the U.S. National Wilderness Preservation System and equivalent international wildlands.

NR477.title: Restoration Case Studies Field Tour
NR477.description: Analysis and evaluation of ecological restoration projects in the field.

NR479.title: Restoration Case Studies
NR479.description: Analysis and evaluation of ecological restoration projects.

NR482A.title: Study Abroad--Chile: Energy Transition
NR482A.description: Understanding energy transition in a middle income country. Consideration of historical and current energy transitions.

NR493.title: Seminar on GIS and Remote Sensing Applications
NR493.description: Techniques, use of remote sensing, GIS technologies for forest, range, wildlife, water, geology, recreation, and other resource management applications.

NR501.title: Leadership and Public Communications
NR501.description: Two-way communication skills used to involve publics, write for various media, and understand role of leadership within natural resources profession.

NR504.title: Computer Analysis of Remote Sensing Data
NR504.description: Computer-aided analysis techniques for extracting resource information from aerial and satellite remote sensing data.

NR505.title: Concepts in GIS
NR505.description: Concepts of geographic information systems and spatial data analysis.

NR506.title: GIS Methods for Resource Management
NR506.description: Current methods in applied geographic information systems and spatial data analysis.

NR510.title: Ecosystem Services--Theory and Practice
NR510.description: Theory and application of ecosystem services drawing upon ecological, economic, and institutional analysis.

NR512.title: Spatial Statistical Modeling-Natural Resources
NR512.description: Statistical techniques used to model natural and environmental resources; GIS, remote sensing, and spatial statistics.

NR515.title: Natural Resources Policy and Biodiversity
NR515.description: Review evolution of natural resource policy, administration, and law emphasizing interdisciplinary concept of managing for biodiversity.

NR522.title: Wilderness Ecosystem Planning
NR522.description: Expertise developed in preparing effective implementation plans for park and wilderness ecosystems.

NR525.title: World Natural Resources
NR525.description: Interdisciplinary approach to overview global problems and solutions in natural resources.

NR527.title: Methods-Human Dimensions of Natural Resources
NR527.description: Human dimensions research in areas of problem identification, research process, survey methods, sampling, validity and reliability.

NR528.title: Analysis: Human Dimensions-Natural Resources
NR528.description: Human dimensions analysis techniques: codebook development and data entry, univariate statistics, and bivariate/multivariate statistics.

NR529.title: Concepts: Human Dimensions-Natural Resources
NR529.description: Concepts guiding human dimensions research: motivations/satisfactions, attitudes, values, attitude/behavior change and norms.

NR530.title: Human Dimensions Application
NR530.description: Application of human dimensions information; incorporate information into decision-making process.

NR531.title: Public Participation
NR531.description: Diagnostic tools for public involvement; appropriate methods for specific situations, issues, and stakeholders.

NR535.title: Action for Sustainable Behavior
NR535.description: Review sustainability issues and develop solutions considering environments; economics; psychology; sociology; law and politics; and administration.

NR541.title: Conservation Policy, Finance, and Governance
NR541.description: Overview of conservation policy, finance and governance issues at the local, national, and international levels.

NR542.title: Global Change and Conservation
NR542.description: Potential ecological, societal, and economic impacts of global change across scales in the context of conservation.

NR543A.title: Catalyzing Change: Conflict and Conservation
NR543A.description: Communication, conflict management, group decision-making theories and tools to effectively create change in the field of conservation.

NR543B.title: Catalyzing Change: Collaborative Conservation
NR543B.description: Collaborative communication theories, methods and tools to effectively create change in the field of conservation.

NR545B.title: Multilevel Views: Society and Conservation- Global
NR545B.description: Myriad and often opposing views of societal and environmental problems across cultures and across scales.

NR546B.title: Socioecological Context: Global
NR546B.description: Background for field site-specific conservation: ecosystems, peoples, politics, and development.

NR547.title: Poverty and Sustainable Development
NR547.description: Theoretical and methodological tools to analyze the interactions between poverty and sustainable development in the field site country.

NR548B.title: Conservation Planning and Management: Global
NR548B.description: Fundamental theories and management practices of protected areas in a global context.

NR549A.title: Conservation and Systems Leadership
NR549A.description: Conservation leadership development by exposure to leadership models, theories, case studies, assessments and trainings.

NR549B.title: Conservation and Systems Leadership: Field
NR549B.description: Effective environmental leadership across cultures through exposure to leadership models, theories, case studies, assessments and trainings.

NR550.title: Sustainable Military Lands Management
NR550.description: Overview of military lands in the U.S.--historical, geographical, environmental--and evolution of military lands as part of the federal lands system.

NR551.title: Cultural Resource Management on Military Lands
NR551.description: Intro to cultural resource laws and policies for broad range of heritage resources, prehistoric and historic, with emphasis on tools and techniques.

NR552.title: Ecology of Military Lands
NR552.description: Landscape ecology of military lands with emphasis on ecological processes and principles as related to militarily-induced disturbances.

NR553.title: DoD Sustainable Building and Infrastructure
NR553.description: Major components of sustainability and sustainable design on U.S. military installations.

NR555.title: Preparation of Grant Proposals
NR555.description: Idea development, preparation, writing, and presentation of research proposals in natural resources.

NR561.title: Habitat Evaluation Procedures
NR561.description: Rationale, philosophy, and use of habitat as a mechanism for conducting environmental impact assessments.

NR562.title: Ecosystem Services in a Changing World
NR562.description: Understanding of ecosystem services and global change.

NR563.title: Research Methods in Conservation--Global
NR563.description: Reviews the contribution of fieldwork/research in addressing conservation issues, social and ecological data collection, and analysis methods.

NR564.title: Systems Thinking and Biodiversity
NR564.description: Social-ecological systems and the implication of social-ecological systems thinking for biological diversity conservation efforts.

NR565.title: Principles of Natural Resources Ecology
NR565.description: Overview of ecological fundamentals examined from the perspective of forest, rangeland, wildlife and fisheries science and management.

NR566.title: Natural Resource Inventory and Data Analysis
NR566.description: Sampling designs, implementation and analysis for inventory and monitoring of forests, rangelands, wetlands and streams.

NR567.title: Analysis of Environmental Impact
NR567.description: Preparation and evaluation of environmental impact statements under NEPA.

NR568.title: Economics of Forests, Restoration and Fire
NR568.description: Overview of basic microeconomics principles as applied to forestry, restoration, and wildland fire management.

NR569.title: Conservation Communication Fundamentals
NR569.description: Communications and public relations theory as they relate to conservation issues and professionals. Successful conservation communication programs are outlined and discussed. Roles for communicators in conservation organizations are examined, including the relevance of outreach and education for conservation management. Audience analysis and diversity are emphasized for achieving goals in conservation communications planning.

NR570.title: Conservation Managers – Media Communications
NR570.description: Conservation communication roles, activities, and practices of the media are examined and analyzed. Critical relationships between the media and conservation practitioners and organizations are also examined. New directions and strategies in conservation communications are analyzed, including ways that conservation professionals can develop and take advantage of opportunities for collaboration with mass media outlets.

NR571.title: New Media Communications for Conservation
NR571.description: Fundamentals of new media, including digital and social media, and popular applications are introduced and evaluated with regard to their relevance for conservation communications. New and emerging digital media channels are discussed and evaluated relating to their use and relevance for conservation organizations and management outcomes. Conservation organizations and practitioners’ use of social media for public information, education, and advocacy are also analyzed.

NR572.title: Strategic Communications for Conservation
NR572.description: Examines relevant conservation communications principles, research, and best practices for the development of strategic communications plans for conservation management programs and organizations.

NR573.title: Conservation Crisis Communications
NR573.description: Examining and developing appropriate conservation communication strategies for conservation/environmental crisis response and recovery. Media, personal and other communications during near- and long-term planning scenarios are examined. Conservation management organizations' and practitioners’ use of different messages and media platforms are also analyzed.

NR574.title: Advanced Communications for Conservation
NR574.description: Advanced communications responsibilities and strategies within conservation planning. Project-based conservation planning processes and mandated public planning processes are both examined.

NR577.title: Wetland Ecology and Restoration
NR577.description: Wetland hydrology, ecology and soils; assessing conditions and identifying common disturbances; restoration techniques, planning and implementation.

NR578.title: Ecology of Disturbed Lands
NR578.description: Analysis of basic and applied ecological principles involved in the restoration of drastically disturbed lands.

NR579.title: Evidence-Based Conservation
NR579.description: There is increasing emphasis in the fields of conservation and natural resources management on evidence-based practice and policy. Explore the rise and adoption of evidence-based practice and policy in conservation and natural resources management, focusing on its usefulness for designing, evaluating, and adapting conservation strategies such as protected areas, financial incentive programs, and community-based conservation.

NR586.title: Conservation Leadership Capstone
NR586.description: Apply knowledge and skills to a project under the supervision of a conservation organization. These applied experiences facilitate learning, and help advance the goals of the conservation organization.

NR600.title: Advanced Public Relations in Natural Resources
NR600.description: Public relations aspects of current natural resource management programs; case history approach.

NR625.title: Community-Based Natural Resource Management
NR625.description: History, theory, practice, and evaluation of community-based natural resource management.

NR678.title: Advanced Ecological Restoration
NR678.description: Analysis of environmental factors influencing restoration of disturbed lands and practices for successful restoration of disturbed ecosystems.

NR687.title: Natural Resources Internship
NR687.description: Field experience and exercises in international natural resources management.

NR693.title: Natural Resources Stewardship Seminar
NR693.description: Invited speakers will present different perspectives on natural resources.

NR793.title: Seminar on Remote Sensing and GIS
NR793.description: Techniques, use of remote sensing, GIS technologies for forest, range, wildlife, water, geology, recreation, and other resource management applications.

NRRT193.title: New to the Major Seminar
NRRT193.description: Introduces students new to the Human Dimensions of Natural Resources and Natural Resource Tourism majors to faculty, department, college and university resources, careers, research, outreach, advising resources, and other students.

NRRT231.title: Principles-Parks/Protected Area Management
NRRT231.description: Provide a broad but comprehensive understanding of the history, challenges, and practices of parks and protected areas management.

NRRT262.title: Principles of Environmental Communication
NRRT262.description: Principles of environmental communication, education, and interpretation for managing natural and cultural resources.

NRRT270.title: Principles of Natural Resource Tourism
NRRT270.description: Tourism and private commercial outdoor recreation industry in America.

NRRT320.title: International Issues-Recreation and Tourism
NRRT320.description: History, development, and preservation of international parks, preserves, tourist and historical sites.

NRRT321.title: Travel Abroad-Marine Ecotourism-Bahamas
NRRT321.description: Environmental and socio-cultural aspects of marine ecotourism in the Bahamas.

NRRT330.title: Social Aspects of Natural Resource Management
NRRT330.description: Review social science concepts and research important to the way humans use and manage natural resources. Using lectures and readings on social theory and management frameworks, dissect current natural resource management issues.  Case study presentations, exercises, and discussions will connect various social science approaches and theoretical frameworks to their natural resource applications.

NRRT331.title: Management of Parks and Protected Areas
NRRT331.description: Comprehensive assessment of problems confronted by park professionals and the techniques and tools applied to their solution.

NRRT340.title: Principles in Conservation Planning and Mgmt
NRRT340.description: Social, economic, legal, and ecological concepts that shape planning and management frameworks within conservation.

NRRT350.title: Wilderness Leadership
NRRT350.description: Practical and philosophical aspects of wilderness usage including safety, group dynamics, and backcountry skills.

NRRT351.title: Wilderness Instructors
NRRT351.description: Preparation to safely lead and instruct groups in outdoor wilderness programs; further refine skills including judgement and leadership.

NRRT362.title: Environmental Conflict Management
NRRT362.description: Theoretical, critical and practical approaches to negotiation, mediation and conflict management strategies related to natural resources.

NRRT371.title: Techniques in Interpretation
NRRT371.description: Intermediate techniques in interpretation including exhibit design and construction, personal program development and visitor studies.

NRRT372.title: Tourism Promotion
NRRT372.description: Explores different approaches for tourism marketing in order to develop a sound background in the field. Addresses the forces that drive change in the tourism marketplace; how marketing managers can most effectively position their services, destination and products, through a systems approach to capture today's traveler. Basic concepts and skills in tourism marketing are examined through problems and characteristics specific to tourism.

NRRT376.title: Human Dimensions Research and Analysis
NRRT376.description: Applies human dimensions (recreation) research and analysis techniques to natural resource issues. Predicated on the assumption that the best way to learn research methodology and statistics is to become directly involved in the process of scientific inquiry. Consequently, a considerable amount of time is devoted to conducting research tasks (e.g., developing surveys, analyzing data).

NRRT382A.title: Study Abroad--Italy: Introduction to Culinary Tourism in Italy
NRRT382A.description: Provides an overview of the culinary tourism industry applied to the leading culinary destination, Italy. Explores defining components of culinary tourism, development of this growing sector in the Tuscan area, Italian culinary attractions, festivals and events, the introduction of marketing, promotion and branding of culinary tourism, current global trends in the culinary tourism industry, related special topics and the future of the industry related to Italy.

NRRT400.title: Environmental Governance
NRRT400.description: Theory and practice of prevalent environmental governance approaches in diverse social and environmental contexts.

NRRT401.title: Collaborative Conservation
NRRT401.description: Guiding principles and practices for effectively engaging stakeholders in conservation issues and natural resource management.

NRRT425.title: Communication for Tourism
NRRT425.description: Exploration and practical application of communication theories, concepts, and techniques for successful communication in the context of tourism industry practice.

NRRT431.title: Integrated Planning for Conservation
NRRT431.description: Integrated planning practices within public and private lands that work at the interface of social and ecological dimensions of conservation.

NRRT439.title: Open Space and Natural Area Management
NRRT439.description: Acquisition of, planning for, and management of local government and private open space and natural areas.

NRRT440.title: Applications in Environmental Communication
NRRT440.description: Application of tools and techniques for communicating to audiences about issues related to conservation, environment and sustainability.

NRRT441.title: Spatial Analysis of Protected Areas
NRRT441.description: Spatial analytical techniques used in planning and managing protected areas, including locating, managing, and assessing parks.

NRRT442.title: Tourism Planning
NRRT442.description: Examines the relationship among tourists, tourist developments and the planning of tourist attractions and services. Focuses on the planning of tourist resources and programs within a geographic region, as well as at a destination and site level. Planning tools and design concepts are reviewed and analyzed. A regional strategic planning process is applied to the development of a regional tourism plan in Colorado.

NRRT460.title: Tourism Event and Conference Planning
NRRT460.description: Foundation in planning, organizing, and producing tourism special events and conferences. Functions and strategies necessary for effective tourism event management.

NRRT462.title: Environmental Communication-Natural Resources
NRRT462.description: Exploration and application of theories, concepts, and techniques for successful environmental communication in natural resources.

NRRT463.title: Non-Profit Administration in Conservation
NRRT463.description: Role of NGOs in protected-area management and conservation education; models for development, including grant writing, in conservation.

NRRT470.title: Tourism Impacts
NRRT470.description: Examine the impacts of tourism from several distinct, but interrelated perspectives: social, political, economical, environmental, and technological. Limits to future tourism growth are discussed and possible strategies to mitigate impacts are detailed. Case studies are used to highlight issues discussed.

NRRT471.title: Starting and Managing Tourism Enterprise
NRRT471.description: Concepts surrounding the starting, planning, and managing of a tourism business with a small business creation and management approach. Focus is given to: (1) connections between commercial recreation/tourism and entrepreneurship, (2) starting and managing a business including selecting the form of business, raising funds, financial/marketing management, and (3) legal aspects including identifying and minimizing risks, supervision of workers and employment laws.

NRRT473.title: Ski Area Management
NRRT473.description: Ski area management; history and trends, ski area operations, human resource management, environmental issues, liability, resort planning and design.

NRRT475.title: Leadership for Conservation Action
NRRT475.description: Develop knowledge and skills important for leading others to achieve positive outcomes in conservation. Fundamental leadership and systems-thinking principles are applied to analyze case studies in conservation, and determine courses of action that positively affect conservation. Through building self-awareness, exploring leadership strategies, and systems-thinking, skills are gained to make a difference in socio-ecological systems.

NRRT499.title: Senior Thesis
NRRT499.description: Independent research project culminating in thesis presented to faculty mentor.

NRRT505.title: Environmental Education History and Theory
NRRT505.description: History and theories, planning and instruction; outcomes, historical events; ecological literacy; experiential learning models.

NRRT506.title: Methods in Environmental Education Research
NRRT506.description: Research methods and designs; literature reviews, needs assessments and program evaluation of environmental education in informal settings.

NRRT507.title: Environmental Education Planning
NRRT507.description: Informal learning theory; evaluation models focused on education in informal settings such as nature centers, zoos, etc.

NRRT508.title: Current Issues in Environmental Education
NRRT508.description: Impact of current events, legislation, demographic changes, and other events on informal environmental education.

NRRT520.title: Perspectives on Ski Area Management
NRRT520.description: Introduction to the history of skiing, the ski industry, and ski area management around the world.

NRRT521.title: Sustainable Ski Area Management
NRRT521.description: Examines sustainability issues that relate specifically to ski resort development and management.

NRRT522.title: Ski Area Operations and Human Resources
NRRT522.description: Examines ski area operations and services.

NRRT523.title: Strategic Ski Area Marketing and Management
NRRT523.description: Examines strategic management and marketing concepts within a ski area context.

NRRT524.title: Ski Area Finance and Investment
NRRT524.description: Examines finance and investment considerations relevant to ski area operations and management.

NRRT525.title: Ski Area Planning and Development
NRRT525.description: Examines the various planning and design considerations for ski area development and expansion.

NRRT530.title: Insight into the Adventure Tourism Industry
NRRT530.description: Definitions of adventure tourism, and relevant leisure, outdoor education, and tourism theories and frameworks are discussed and critically examined. Key stakeholders are identified, along with current and future trends, opportunities, and challenges. The need for sustainable practices and cross-cultural understanding and communication within adventure tourism is also emphasized.

NRRT531.title: Building an Adventure Tourism Enterprise
NRRT531.description: Entrepreneurial skills and know-how to successfully build an adventure tourism enterprise. As most adventure tourism businesses are small-to-medium enterprises, there is a need for students to understand the fundamentals of how to develop an adventure tourism concept and turn it into a successful business.

NRRT532.title: Leading the Adventure Tourism Experience
NRRT532.description: Skills and knowledge to successfully plan and lead an adventure tourism experience. Focus is given to leadership and facilitation strategies, guiding standards and best practices, and the importance of environmental and cultural education and interpretation for guests. This is in addition to quality programming and logistics, ensuring guest safety through risk mitigation, emergency planning and crisis management, public relations, and guest management.

NRRT533.title: Adventure Tourism Policy and Planning
NRRT533.description: Key stakeholders and policies that influence the adventure tourism industry. This involves a detailed examination of adventure tourism standards and regulations, in addition to broader government policies that influence the environment within which the adventure tourism industry is situated. As many adventure tourism ventures operate on public lands, the role of public land agencies and their relationships with adventure tourism operators are also closely examined.

NRRT534.title: Applications in the Outdoor Products Industry
NRRT534.description: Outdoor products industry and the various steps involved in developing an outdoor product and bringing it to market. Focus is placed on identifying and understanding the outdoor products consumer, product development processes, product aesthetics and functionality, the unique characteristics of branding, selling, and distributing outdoor products, current and future trends, and the diverse career opportunities that exist within the outdoor products industry.

NRRT541.title: Overview & Trends of Agritourism Management
NRRT541.description: Introductory agritourism sector concepts and emerging business opportunities. Identify and assess agritourism sector data describing industry supply and demand attributes and examine key distinguishing aspects of agritourism enterprise. Regulatory frameworks and policy, community and economic development dimensions, and relevant case studies specific to new agritourism oriented opportunities.

NRRT542.title: Spatial & Community Dimensions of Agritourism
NRRT542.description: Advanced analysis methodology and the use of data in enterprise valuation, market analysis and the assessment of the agritourism sector. Distinguishing aspects of agritourism supply and economic development dimensions that target tourism demand enhancement. Creative market assessment methods are employed to illustrate concepts and analysis, including spatial, economic impact and trip evaluation techniques.

NRRT545.title: Culinary Tourism
NRRT545.description: Aspects of tourism concepts and assessment of the culinary sector in relation to the supply and demand experience attributes. Explores frameworks related to the culinary community, policy, and training dimensions, and reviews case studies specific to new and ongoing culinary tourism oriented opportunities.

NRRT548.title: Agritourism Enterprise Management
NRRT548.description: Examines the role of agritourism in the agricultural economy and provides students with frameworks to identify and assess opportunities for agritourism development. Focusing on determinants of business success and the role and importance of comprehensive business planning. Students will develop and present a comprehensive business plan for a prototype agritourism business as a requirement of this course.

NRRT550.title: Ecotourism
NRRT550.description: Concept of ecotourism, impacts associated with ecotourism, and role of education/interpretation in mitigating these impacts.

NRRT565.title: Research-Human Dimensions Natural Resources
NRRT565.description: Theory, research, literature review, hypothesis development, scientific writing, proposal development.

NRRT600.title: Tourism Industry Concepts and Practices
NRRT600.description: Fundamental tourism theories and concepts that lay the groundwork for understanding tourists and the tourism industry. Based on the interdisciplinary nature of tourism studies, covers the broad range of fundamental theories and interrelated concepts that guide decision-making in the tourism industry. Focuses on several key themes aimed to capture the primary areas of conceptual thinking and analysis in contemporary tourism.

NRRT601.title: Tourism Quantitative Analysis I
NRRT601.description: Statistical techniques used by researchers to inform and support tourism decision-making. Emphasis is placed on understanding data manipulation techniques and what statistics are appropriate for addressing applied decision–making problems.

NRRT602.title: Tourism Quantitative Analysis II
NRRT602.description: Quantitative analysis methods to specific tourism problems. Students explore visitor intercept techniques and identify other local, regional, national and international institutional data sources, including “Big Data” analytic engines. Using these sources, students estimate destination demand, supply and economic impact as well as perform competitive analysis in a variety of settings.

NRRT605.title: Human Dimensions of Natural Resources Theory
NRRT605.description: Review social science concepts and research important to the management and conservation of natural resources. Examine current conservation issues, and how those issues can be addressed through an understanding of human thought and behavior.

NRRT610.title: Natural Resource Management and Tourism
NRRT610.description: Explores nature-based tourism and the planning and management of experiences and impacts. Review the tourism system as it is applied in the natural resource setting, define and describe outdoor recreation motivations, describe the covenants and institutions that govern international development globally, and apply the measurement of supply, demand, and economic impact in the natural-based tourism realm. Apply these techniques in comprehensive planning and compliance activities.

NRRT615.title: Sustainable Tourism Development Foundation
NRRT615.description: Theory, practice, history, terminology and issues surrounding sustainable tourism development. Sustainable tourism planning and management are examined in the context of sustainable livelihoods. A comprehensive survey of sustainable tourism components – including indicators of sustainability, community participation, poverty alleviation, alternative tourism, governance and power, and socio-environmental responsibility – will be covered from a systems thinking perspective.

NRRT620.title: Organizational Management in Tourism
NRRT620.description: Application of management concepts to tourism organizations. Topics include managing ethics, diversity, and globalization; planning, decision-making, and competitive advantage; organizational structure and design; leading individuals and groups, and controlling communication and information technology. Discussions, exercises, and case studies will allow students to apply management principles to the tourism organizations.

NRRT625.title: Communication/Conflict Management in Tourism
NRRT625.description: Managerial communication skills and negotiation tools and their implications for effective organizational communication and management of potential conflicts faced by managers in the tourism industry.

NRRT631.title: Protected Area Management
NRRT631.description: Introduces fundamental knowledge, skills, and competencies to address park and protected area management challenges. Designed to ensure an understanding of protected area concepts, justifications, governance structures, and issues and challenges. Acquire hands-on experience in planning and implementation of on-the-ground projects, strategies, and techniques used to address protected area issues, as well as leadership skills required of effective managers.

NRRT632.title: Integrated Park and Protected Area Management
NRRT632.description: Provides advanced knowledge and competencies that underpin the professionalism and effectiveness of park and protected area managers. Gain direct experience with a variety of planning processes and types, and be able to make informed strategic decisions about some of the most pressing issues currently facing parks and protected areas.

NRRT634.title: Protected Area Law and Policy
NRRT634.description: Introduction to how protected area law and policy is defined and implemented at local, state, national, and international levels and how it has evolved over time. Issues may change; however, many fundamental principles and processes in protected area law and policy formulation and implementation are enduring. Investigate how laws and policies on other issues such as energy and mining affect PA law, policy, and management.

NRRT650.title: Financial Management in Tourism
NRRT650.description: Apply financial concepts to the management of tourism businesses. Financial accounting aspects of finance, including development and analysis of financial statements are covered. Management accounting aspects of finance include forecasting and budgeting; analysis of profit, and profitability; and working capital management. Application of capital budgeting techniques, time value of money, and business valuation are emphasized.

NRRT655.title: Tourism Marketing Concepts and Applications
NRRT655.description: Marketing theories and concepts and their application within a travel and tourism organizational context. The travel and tourism industry has unique characteristics that create a variety of problems and opportunities specific to that industry and important for tourism marketing professionals.

NRRT660.title: Law and Legal Liability in Tourism
NRRT660.description: Concepts of legal liability, business law, and risk management to travel, tourism,  and hospitality organizations. Topics include contract law; agency law; business organization and formation; torts and legal liability; employment law and labor-management relations, and the protection of organization assets through risk management.

NRRT662.title: Global Tourism Policy
NRRT662.description: Major international policies, trends, and challenges facing tourism. Provides an understanding of policies, programs, and regulations and how international tourism is affected.

NRRT665.title: Survey Research and Analysis
NRRT665.description: Survey research, design, and analysis in human dimensions of natural resources.

NRRT666.title: Qualitative Research in NRRT
NRRT666.description: Qualitative approaches to tourism research and techniques from a range of disciplinary backgrounds; methodological aspects.

NRRT671.title: Strategic Management for Travel and Tourism
NRRT671.description: Factors, tools, and techniques for strategic management of a travel and tourism business or organization.

NRRT679A.title: Current Topics in Nature Based Tourism
NRRT679A.description: Current topics in nature-based travel and tourism.

NRRT679B.title: Current Topics in Nature Based Tourism
NRRT679B.description: Current topics in nature-based travel and tourism.

NRRT765.title: Applied Multivariate Analysis
NRRT765.description: Application and interpretation of multivariate statistics to human dimensions in natural resources, recreation, and tourism.

NSCI170.title: Perspectives and Communication in Science
NSCI170.description: Exploration of personal stories and development as science students through writing assignments, dialogue, and outreach activities. Topics will include effective communication of science principles with a variety of audiences (including K-12) and a diverse group of learners, exploration of how experiences and perspectives affect how individuals perceive and influence the scientific process and learning science concepts.

NSCI192.title: Introductory Seminar
NSCI192.description: Introduction to the culture and values of science and the College of Natural Sciences.

NSCI193.title: College of Natural Sciences Career Seminar
NSCI193.description: Guidance for students in exploring who they are individually, how they might fit into a career or a graduate program in the sciences, how to develop their career path to be competitive in the selection process, and preparation of their marketing materials to be used in the future. Helps students gain a better understanding of their individual abilities, strengths, and interests imperative to being successful in a career search.

NSCI384.title: Supervised College Teaching
NSCI384.description: Supervised experience in a computer lab.

NSCI575.title: Ethical Issues in Big Data Research

NSCI590A.title: Workshop in Instruction: Science Instruction in Rural Colorado

NSCI590B.title: Workshop in Instruction: Mathematics Instruction in Rural Colorado

NSCI590C.title: Workshop in Instruction: Small Scale Science-Teachers as Researchers

NSCI590D.title: Workshop in Instruction: Colorado Science Teacher Enhancement Project

NSCI590G.title: Workshop in Instruction, Small Scale Chemistry

NSCI601.title: Master of Profess. Natural Sciences Ethics

NSCI610.title: Team Research in Quantitative Ecology
NSCI610.description: Interdisciplinary team-based research aimed at studying real-life models in quantitative ecology using mathematical and statistical tools.

NSCI611.title: Leadership in Animal Organizations
NSCI611.description: Management training and specific leadership tools aimed at future professionals leading an animal organization.

NSCI612.title: Myth Busters – Science/Controversy/Evaluation
NSCI612.description: Development and practice of western science; understanding how conflicts between science and culture create controversy; and evaluating claims.

NSCI619A.title: Physics for Educators: Optics
NSCI619A.description: Ray, wave, and particle models of light, with diverse applications. Introduction to special relativity and quantum physics via light. Includes regular at-home, hands-on activities.

NSCI619B.title: Physics for Educators: Mechanics
NSCI619B.description: Classical kinematics and dynamics, with particular attention to phenomena that can be explored using an integrated sensor system for weekly at-home labs.

NSCI620.title: Chemistry for Science Educators
NSCI620.description: Theoretical and experimental chemistry for grade 6-12 science teachers, with emphasis on water chemistry.

NSCI621.title: Workplace Wellness - Animal Organizations
NSCI621.description: Professional training, specifically tailored communication skills, and ways to engage personnel designed to meet the needs of animal professionals.

NSCI630.title: Spectroscopy for Science Educators
NSCI630.description: Theory and applications of spectroscopy for grade 6-12 science teachers.

NSCI631.title: Marketing for Animal Organizations
NSCI631.description: Marketing skills designed to meet the needs of animal professionals.

NSCI640.title: Energetics for Science Educators
NSCI640.description: Production and use of energy for grade 6-12 science teachers, with emphasis on chemical and biological systems.

NSCI650.title: Pollution and Environmental Biology for Educators
NSCI650.description: Biological consequences of energy production and consumption for grade 6-12 science teachers.

NSCI660.title: Evolutionary Biology for Educators
NSCI660.description: Evolutionary theory, with an emphasis on innovative methods for teaching evolutionary biology in grades 6-12.

NSCI670.title: Earth Sciences for Educators
NSCI670.description: Provides a foundation in the Earth Sciences for secondary science teachers, emphasizing their societal relevance and context. Topics include earth science methods and thinking, plate tectonics, minerals and mineral resources, rock formation and identification, geologic time, systems, the hydrologic cycle and water resources, climate, carbon and energy.

NSCI677.title: Microscopic Image Collection & Processing
NSCI677.description: Modern microscopes generate terabytes of data presenting challenges for acquisition, long-term storage and extracting meaningful information to present it in an appropriate way for publication. This course covers fundamentals of data collection, storage and processing. Students will learn different software applications, ranging from commercial to technical computing languages and will develop their own data processing algorithms to synthesize publication-quality images from large data sets.

NSCI687D.title: Internship: Microscopy
NSCI687D.description: Internship in microscopy within the CSU Microscope Imaging Network Foundational Core Facility or within other organizations.

NSCI693.title: Seminar--MPNS
NSCI693.description: Students will present and discuss current research relevant to their specialization(s) and present results of their internships and group projects.

NSCI693C.title: Graduate Seminar: Biological Data Analytics
NSCI693C.description: Presentation and discussion of current research in the analysis of large data applications in the biological sciences, as relevant to a student's specialization and associated with their internship experience.

NSCI693D.title: Graduate Seminar: Microscopy
NSCI693D.description: Presentation and discussion of current microscopy research relevant to a student's specialization and associated with their internship experience.

NSCI695.title: Independent Study for the MNSE
NSCI695.description: Independent study based on review of the primary scientific literature in biology, chemistry, or physics.

NSCI696D.title: Group Study: Microscopy Proposal
NSCI696D.description: Design of an experiment utilizing microscopic imaging to collect quantitative data to test a hypothesis, which may include preparation of specimens, design and construction of a custom microscope, or the writing of software to control the microscope and acquire data. Images will be analyzed to extract quantitative data that tests the hypothesis.

NSCI696E.title: Group Study: Analysis of High-Throughput Sequencing Data
NSCI696E.description: Hands-on experience in analysis of a variety of high throughput sequencing data done in small groups under the supervision of a faculty mentor.

NSCI696F.title: Group Study: Biological Data Analytics Project Proposal
NSCI696F.description: Design hypothesis and method(s) to analyze data from genomic, proteomic, metabolomic, or other -omics experiments; or write software to facilitate analysis of data from -omics experiments.

NSCI696G.title: Group Study: Natural Science Education
NSCI696G.description: Hands-on, inquiry-based teaching and learning strategies for the science, technology, engineering and mathematics classroom.

NSCI698.title: Research Experience in Natural Sciences
NSCI698.description: Research experience in biology, chemistry, or physics.

NB192.title: Introductory Neuroscience Seminar
NB192.description: Introduction to neuroscience; discussion of concentrations, career paths and research opportunities. Group activities and strategies for success.

NB292.title: Research Topics in Neuroscience
NB292.description: A discussion of current research interests of neuroscience faculty.

NB399.title: Thesis Preparation
NB399.description: Preparation for senior thesis in Neuroscience.

NB475.title: Mentored Research in Neuroscience
NB475.description: Mentored research with final written report required.

NB487.title: Internship in Neuroscience
NB487.description: Work experience with an approved preceptor outside of CSU.

NB493.title: Senior Seminar
NB493.description: Topics of current interest in neuroscience.

NB496.title: Group Study in Neuroscience
NB496.description: Faculty-directed exploration of areas of special interest in neuroscience.

NB499.title: Senior Thesis
NB499.description: Interpreting research results (experiential or from the literature) and writing a thesis; oral presentation required; supervised by a faculty mentor.

NB501.title: Cellular and Molecular Neurophysiology
NB501.description: Membrane properties of nerve and muscle; molecular mechanisms of synaptic function; neuromuscular units.

NB586.title: Practicum-Techniques in Neuroscience II
NB586.description: Current research projects in the laboratories of neuroscience faculty.

NB650.title: Computer Analysis of Neuronal Proteins
NB650.description: Theory and practice of using computers to study proteins.

NB750.title: Physiology of Ion Channels
NB750.description: Physiological and structural analysis of membrane ion channels.

NB771.title: Writing, Submitting, and Reviewing Grants
NB771.description: Preparation of NRSA fellowship proposals; proposal review; possible submission to NIH for funding.

NB796B.title: Group Study: Neuronal Growth and Regeneration

OT110.title: Introduction to Occupational Therapy
OT110.description: Roles and activities in occupational therapy.

OT215.title: Medical Terminology
OT215.description: Definition and use of medical terms.

OT355.title: The Disability Experience in Society
OT355.description: Description and exploration of disabling conditions; review of support systems including legal and financial implications.

OT450.title: Biomechanics of Human Occupation
OT450.description: Exploration of performance of the activities of daily living in context as impacted by function/dysfunction of the human musculoskeletal system.

OT601.title: Occupation and Rehabilitation Science I
OT601.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on human performance and participation in everyday occupations.

OT610.title: Professional Decision Making
OT610.description: Exploration of the thought processes occupational therapists use when determining how best to address clients' needs.

OT611.title: Reflective and Evidence-Based Practice
OT611.description: Development of reflective and evidence-based practice skills through integrating and synthesizing fieldwork experiences in OT practice.

OT620.title: Research to Practice I
OT620.description: Critically evaluate qualitative and quantitative research processes pertaining to individuals.

OT621.title: Occupational Performance: Infancy-Childhood
OT621.description: Optimizing occupational performance and participation for infants and children within a contextual framework.

OT630.title: Occupational Performance: Adult to Old Age I Rec
OT630.description: Optimizing occupational performance for adults and older adults with attention to roles, satisfaction, competence and activities.

OT631.title: Program Assessment and Development
OT631.description: Assessment of program strengths and needs, followed by development of proposals to support occupational performance and participation.

OT636.title: Occupational Performance: Adult/Old Age I Lab
OT636.description: Optimizing occupational performance for adults and older adults with attention to roles, satisfaction, competence, and activities.

OT640.title: Research to Practice II
OT640.description: Critically evaluate qualitative and quantitative research processes pertaining to groups and systems.

OT641.title: Occupation and Rehabilitation Science II
OT641.description: Explore historical evolution of topics and the link to future implications for and growth of occupation and rehabilitation science.

OT656.title: Topics on Brain Plasticity and Performance
OT656.description: Multidisciplinary viewpoints on brain plasticity and its relationship to performance across the lifespan.

OT660.title: Occupational Performance:Adult/Old Age II Rec
OT660.description: Foundations of occupational performance for adults and older adults with attention to abilities, skills, and developed capacities.

OT661.title: Occupational Performance: Adolescent-Young Adult
OT661.description: Optimizing occupational performance and participation for youth and young adults within a contextual framework.

OT665.title: Adult to Old Age II Lab
OT665.description: Optimizing occupational performance for adults and older adults with attention to abilities, skills, and developed capacities.

OT666.title: Optimizing Occupation through Technology
OT666.description: Use of technology-based resources and/or strategies (current and emerging) to meet client needs in their everyday occupations and contexts.

OT676.title: Pathokinesiological Conditions and Assessment
OT676.description: Various musculoskeletal imbalances and injuries that present as difficulties in function and participation in everyday activity.

OT686A.title: Fieldwork I: OT Process
OT686A.description: Level I fieldwork in various settings.

OT686B.title: Fieldwork I: Seminar
OT686B.description: Level I fieldwork in various settings.

OT686C.title: Fieldwork I: Adult to Old Age
OT686C.description: Level I fieldwork in various settings.

OT686D.title: Fieldwork I: Infancy to Young Adult
OT686D.description: Level I fieldwork in various settings.

OT686E.title: Fieldwork I: Special Interest
OT686E.description: Level I fieldwork in various settings.

OT687A.title: Fieldwork IIA: Acute In-Patient
OT687A.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687B.title: Fieldwork IIA: Rehab In-Patient
OT687B.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687C.title: Fieldwork IIA: SNF/Acute LTC
OT687C.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687D.title: Fieldwork IIA: General Rehab Out-Patient
OT687D.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687E.title: Fieldwork IIA: Hand Therapy Hospital Out-Patient
OT687E.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687F.title: Fieldwork IIA: Hand Therapy Private Out-Patient
OT687F.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687G.title: Fieldwork IIA: Psych In-Patient
OT687G.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687H.title: Fieldwork IIA: Combined Practice
OT687H.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687M.title: Fieldwork II: Behavioral Health Community
OT687M.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687N.title: Fieldwork II: Older Adult Community
OT687N.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687O.title: Fieldwork II: Older Adult Day Program
OT687O.description: Level II fieldwork in various settings.

OT687P.title: Fieldwork II: Adult Day Program

OT701.title: Occupation and Rehabilitation Science III
