SOCR377.title: Geographic Information Systems in Agriculture
SOCR377.description: Introduction to geographic information systems and global positioning systems with applications to agriculture.

SOCR400.title: Soils and Global Change: Science and Impacts
SOCR400.description: Foundations on the science of global change and its impact on soil processes and biota.

SOCR401.title: Greenhouse Gas Mitigation, Land Use, and Mgmt
SOCR401.description: Introduction to greenhouse gas estimation methods and mitigation project development in the land use sector.

SOCR410.title: Seed Processes: Storage and Deterioration
SOCR410.description: Environmental conditions and management factors influencing storage and deterioration of seeds, including physiological and biochemical changes.

SOCR412.title: Seed Processes: Separation and Conditioning
SOCR412.description: Understanding the physical process required to separate pure seed from contaminants and maintain viability.

SOCR413.title: Seed Vigor Concepts and Testing
SOCR413.description: Provide a basic understanding of the concept of seed vigor, methods for seed vigor testing, and the relationship of crop performance.

SOCR420.title: Crop and Soil Management Systems I
SOCR420.description: Principles of crop, soil management emphasizing environmental factors influencing crop growth and development, interactions with soil organic matter.

SOCR421.title: Crop and Soil Management Systems II
SOCR421.description: Principles of crop and soil management with emphasis on soil erosion control, water conservation, and plant-water relationships.

SOCR430.title: Applications of Plant Biotechnology
SOCR430.description: Current and potential applications of DNA-based biotechnology in crop agriculture and other plant disciplines.

SOCR440.title: Pedology
SOCR440.description: Process of soil formation, characterization, classification of soils; soil survey methods.

SOCR441.title: Soil Ecology
SOCR441.description: An integrative, hands-on experience in the theory and application of ecology principles to the soil environment.

SOCR442.title: Forest and Range Soils
SOCR442.description: Soil and water relationships in forest and rangeland ecosystems; significant properties in their management.

SOCR443.title: Soil Survey Field Practicum
SOCR443.description: Designed to offer the opportunity to conduct soil survey field work with professional soil scientists in pristine natural areas across the state of Colorado. Experience place-based learning, and training to take a project from its initial stages of planning to completion; this includes site determination, data collection, and post-field lab and data analysis. Deliverables include a) soil properties database and b) presentation summarizing finding.

SOCR455.title: Soil Microbiology
SOCR455.description: Microbial activities in agricultural, forest, and grassland soils; in soil-plant relationships; and in maintenance of environmental quality.

SOCR456.title: Soil Microbiology Laboratory
SOCR456.description: Techniques used in study of ecology and activities of soil microorganisms.

SOCR467.title: Soil and Environmental Chemistry
SOCR467.description: Fundamental principles of soil chemistry with respect to environmental reactions between soils and other natural materials and priority pollutants.

SOCR470.title: Soil Physics
SOCR470.description: Physical properties of soils emphasizing mechanical composition, moisture, aeration, temperature, and structure related to management, plant growth.

SOCR471.title: Soil Physics Laboratory
SOCR471.description: Familiarization of techniques and equipment used in evaluation of soil physical properties.

SOCR475.title: Global Challenges in Plant and Soil Science
SOCR475.description: Evaluation of case studies to define problems and develop solutions to address global challenges in plant and soil science.

SOCR486.title: Practicum
SOCR486.description: Directed experiences in the application of soil and crop science principles.

SOCR490.title: Hydrus-1D Workshop
SOCR490.description: Using Hydrus-1D software for flow and transport of water, heat, and chemicals in soil.

SOCR498.title: Undergraduate Research
SOCR498.description: Research in soil and crop sciences.

SOCR500.title: Environmental Measurement Laboratory
SOCR500.description: A hands-on instrumentation lab for making environmental, weather, and soil measurements using low-cost microcontroller boards and sensors.

SOCR522.title: Micrometeorology
SOCR522.description: Microenvironments; physics of environmental variables; plant canopy microclimate; evapotranspiration; surface-atmosphere exchange; instrumentation.

SOCR535.title: Origin and Evolution of Cultivated Plants
SOCR535.description: Origin of crops from viewpoints of archaeology, history, botany, and taxonomy, and continued evolution of plants under cultivation.

SOCR540.title: Soil-Plant-Nutrient Relationships
SOCR540.description: Soil and plant factors affecting nutrient uptake, mechanistic models of uptake, availability and functions of essential elements, diagnostic techniques.

SOCR550.title: Advanced Soil Genesis
SOCR550.description: Modern concepts of specific mechanisms involved in formation of genetic soil groups and their relationship to environmental factors.

SOCR567.title: Environmental Soil Chemistry
SOCR567.description: The chemistry of terrestrial environments and the interactions of soil constituents with bacteria, nutrients, and pollutants.

SOCR570.title: Plant Breeding for Drought Tolerance
SOCR570.description: Principles and practices of evaluation, selection and cultivar development for crops in drought-stress environments with an emphasis on agronomic crops.

SOCR571.title: Foundations of Soil Science
SOCR571.description: Importance of soils in ecology and earth system science with regard to the study and management of the soil resource.

SOCR572.title: Internet-of-Things Environmental Sensors Lab
SOCR572.description: Hands on training with environmental sensors and electronics that have internet-of-things (IoT) connectivity.

SOCR577.title: Principles/Components: Precision Agriculture
SOCR577.description: Principles and components of precision agriculture, including GPS, GIS, remote sensing, and their applications in soil and crop management.

SOCR620.title: Modeling Ecosystem Biogeochemistry
SOCR620.description: Design and build biogeochemical process and ecosystem models with GUI-based software. Analyze and test models and interpret experimental data.

SOCR640.title: Crop Physiology
SOCR640.description: Developmental, physiological, and biochemical determinants of crop yields as controlled by genetic and environmental effects.

SOCR650.title: Research Proposal Development
SOCR650.description: Skills to develop and write an effective scientific research proposal.

SOCR670.title: Terrestrial Ecosystems Isotope Ecology
SOCR670.description: Isotope distribution in biogeochemical cycles, research topics in biosphere-atmosphere interactions; lab experience with isotope techniques.

SOCR675.title: Presentations for Scientific Audiences
SOCR675.description: Organization and presentation of scientific information to audiences in oral and poster format.

SOCR720.title: Advanced Plant Breeding
SOCR720.description: Systems of mating and selection in plants to maximize genetic gain. Evaluation of heterosis, germplasm diversity, strategies, and new technologies.

SOCR720A.title: Advanced Plant Breeding: Methods
SOCR720A.description: Historical perspectives in plant breeding, plant reproduction, genetic gain, breeding and selection systems in self- and cross-pollinated plants.

SOCR720B.title: Advanced Plant Breeding: Tools
SOCR720B.description: Plant breeding strategies, genotype x environment interaction, field plot and genomic tools, breeding for pest resistance, stress tolerance, quality.

SOCR725.title: Quantitative Inheritance in Plant Breeding
SOCR725.description: Quantitative genetic structure of populations, recognition of genetic, environmental variance. Methods of dealing with quantitatively inherited traits.

SOCR730.title: Topics in Plant Breeding and Genetics
SOCR730.description: Current literature regarding mechanisms used for plant improvement.

SOCR731.title: Plant Breeding Data Management
SOCR731.description: Principles and best practices for optimal data management for plant breeding and other data-intensive research programs.

SOCR755.title: Advanced Soil Microbiology
SOCR755.description: Ecology of soil microorganisms emphasizing population and activity relationships, nitrogen fixation, and microbe-pesticide interactions.

SOCR760.title: Advanced Soil Chemistry
SOCR760.description: Surface chemistry of soils, electrical double layer models of surface charge and potential, colloid stability, computer modeling of adsorption.

SOCR770.title: Advanced Soil Physics
SOCR770.description: Description and analysis of principles of storage and movement of water, solutes, heat, and gases in soils.

SPMT511.title: Foundations and Theory of Sport Management
SPMT511.description: Combines theory and practical application to provide an overview of all facets of sports management and administration. Topics include the foundations of sports administration, the amateur sports industry, the professional sport industry, the lifestyle sports industry, secondary and tertiary support functions of athletic departments, and strategies for career success.

SPMT523.title: Communications and Media in Sport
SPMT523.description: Examination of the relationship between media and the sport industry; focus on media relations, sport media management, broadcasting, public relations, social media, media platforms and channels within the sport industry.

SPMT533.title: Economics and Data Analytics in Sport
SPMT533.description: Focus on decision-making with respect to financial and economic considerations, with real-world and hypothetical problems based within the sports industry. Acquired skills help make decisions in any sport industry business platform. Equips aspiring sport managers with the skills to enhance financial decision-making in a management role, including applying concepts to the continually evolving sport industry landscape.

SPMT536.title: Sport and Communities
SPMT536.description: Examines sport as a social institution that enables social interaction, and reflects, reinforces, and creates societal norms.

SPMT545.title: Sport Governance and Policy
SPMT545.description: Examines the governance of sport and policy development at the amateur, collegiate, professional, and international levels.

SPMT547.title: Contemporary Sport, Society and Globalization
SPMT547.description: Explores the relationship between sport and society with regard for how sport is linked to the socially constructed ideas, structural dynamics of social life, and the impacts of sport globalization on communities and society, more broadly.

SPMT554.title: Sport and the Environment
SPMT554.description: Examines environmental management of the sport industry by investigating how different environments (e.g. urban and rural cities, the great outdoors, and specialized settings) are impacted by sport, as well as how specific environments support or limit various sport activities.

SPMT560.title: Sport Law
SPMT560.description: Legal principles affecting sponsors and users of sports programs; liability concepts in tort, contract, civil rights and property law in program planning, development, marketing, and management.

SPMT561.title: Sport Facility and Event Management
SPMT561.description: Multifaceted aspects of sport facility and event management including the planning and designing a sports facility, staff management, facility and event marketing, developing revenue streams, scheduling and operations, and event coordination.

SPMT562.title: Sport and Ethics
SPMT562.description: Investigate moral issues in sport, and judgments about right and wrong behavior among athletes, coaches, spectators, sport managers, and others.

SPMT568.title: Sport Marketing
SPMT568.description: Examines sport marketing information systems, pricing strategies, media relations, promotional methods, and endorsements as they relate to marketing theories. Practical applications and principles.

SPMT572.title: Sport Organizational Communication
SPMT572.description: Examines contemporary philosophies and methods for studying the communication systems within sport organizations, and the challenging issues facing organizational leadership and employees in their efforts to communicate with each other.

SPMT575.title: Risk Management in Sport
SPMT575.description: Provides an in depth study of risk management specifically related to factors essential to the safe delivery of sport and recreational programs, sport activities and events.

SPMT592.title: Sport Management Seminar
SPMT592.description: Synthesize and apply theories, concepts, and practices in the leadership and management of sport organizations.

SPMT641.title: Sport Management Capstone
SPMT641.description: Integrate and apply newly acquired knowledge and skills relevant to the field of sport management.

SPMT687.title: Sport Management Internship
SPMT687.description: Internship applying sport management leadership theories/principles in a professional setting.

STAT100.title: Statistical Literacy (GT-MA1)
STAT100.description: Learn to be an intelligent consumer of statistical information. Concepts of randomness and probability, variation, types of measurement, errors in measurement, experiments versus observational studies, Simpson's paradox, biases in statistical studies, p-value.

STAT158.title: Introduction to R Programming
STAT158.description: Programming using the R Project for the Statistical Computing. Data objects, for loops, if statements, using packages.

STAT192.title: First-Year Seminar in Statistics
STAT192.description: Explore careers in statistics and the variety of problems encountered by statisticians.

STAT201.title: General Statistics (GT-MA1)
STAT201.description: Graphs, descriptive statistics, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, correlation and simple regression, tests of association. Use JMP software to analyze data.

STAT204.title: Statistics With Business Applications (GT-MA1)
STAT204.description: Statistical methods in business; descriptive methods, simple probability, sampling distributions, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, correlation, simple and multiple regression, practical concerns in inference. Use Excel software to analyze data.

STAT301.title: Introduction to Applied Statistical Methods
STAT301.description: Statistical methods in science; descriptive methods, simple probability, sampling distributions, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, statistical power, one-way ANOVA, correlation, simple and multiple regression, interaction, practical concerns in inference (e.g. interpreting p-values, publication bias), reading and evaluating statistical results in published papers and popular media. Emphasis on using software rather than hand calculation to conduct analyses.

STAT305.title: Sampling Techniques
STAT305.description: Sample designs: simple random, stratified, systematic, cluster, unequal probability, two-phase; methods of estimation and sample size determination.

STAT307.title: Introduction to Biostatistics
STAT307.description: Biostatistical methods; confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, simple correlation and regression, one-way analysis of variance.

STAT311.title: Statistics for Behavioral Sciences I
STAT311.description: Statistical literacy, quantitative reasoning, statistical methods in SPSS including ANOVA, regression, logistic regression, and categorical data.

STAT312.title: Statistics for Behavioral Sciences II
STAT312.description: One-way analysis of variance, factorial designs, blocked designs, multiple comparisons of means, and multiple regression.

STAT315.title: Intro to Theory and Practice of Statistics
STAT315.description: Descriptive statistics, probability theory, random variables, sampling distributions, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, ANOVA, simple and multiple regression. R software is utilized for analyzing real world data sets.

STAT316.title: Games and Gambling
STAT316.description: Application of probability concepts to games of chance and gambling contests.

STAT331.title: Intermediate Applied Statistical Methods
STAT331.description: Covers applied regression methods, including: interaction; model assumptions and diagnostics, selection, and validation; penalized estimation; GLMs; mixed models; factorial ANOVA; ANCOVA. Also covers basic categorical data analysis and non-parametrics. Strong emphasis on application and interpretation; lesser emphasis on mathematics. Assignments involve reproducing analyses in published scientific papers and open ended data analysis projects. Data analyses are performed using JMP software.

STAT340.title: Multiple Regression Analysis
STAT340.description: Estimation and testing for linear, polynomial, and multiple regression models; analysis of residuals; selection of variables; nonlinear regression.

STAT341.title: Statistical Data Analysis I
STAT341.description: Estimation and inference based upon Gaussian linear regression models; residual analysis; variable selection; non-linear regression.

STAT342.title: Statistical Data Analysis II
STAT342.description: Single-factor analysis of variance models; multi-factor analysis of variance models; randomized block design; Latin squares; split-plot design.

STAT350.title: Design of Experiments
STAT350.description: Analysis of variance, covariance; randomization; completely randomized, randomized block, latin-square, split-plot, factorial and other designs.

STAT358.title: Introduction to Statistical Computing in SAS
STAT358.description: Statistical procedures and database operations using the SAS programming language.

STAT400.title: Statistical Computing
STAT400.description: Computationally intensive statistical methods: optimization for statistical problems; simulation & Monte Carlo methods; resampling methods; smoothing.

STAT420.title: Probability and Mathematical Statistics I
STAT420.description: Probability, random variables, distribution functions, and expectations; joint and conditional distributions and expectations; transformations.

STAT421.title: Introduction to Stochastic Processes
STAT421.description: Modeling phenomena with stochastic processes and the simulation and analysis of stochastic process models.

STAT430.title: Probability and Mathematical Statistics II
STAT430.description: Theories and applications of estimation, testing, and confidence intervals, sampling distributions including normal, gamma, beta X-squared, t, and F.

STAT440.title: Bayesian Data Analysis
STAT440.description: Applied Bayesian data analysis, Bayesian inference and interpretation of results, computing methods including MCMC, model selection and evaluation.

STAT460.title: Applied Multivariate Analysis
STAT460.description: Principles for multivariate estimation and testing; multivariate analysis of variance, discriminant analysis; principal components, factor analysis.

STAT472.title: Statistical Research--Design, Data, Methods
STAT472.description: Statistical research skills including data analysis, problem solving, report writing, oral communication, and planning experiments.

STAT498.title: Undergraduate Research in Statistics
STAT498.description: Research skills and techniques; includes both oral and written communication of results.

STAT500.title: Statistical Computer Packages
STAT500.description: Comparison, evaluation, and use of computer packages for univariate and multivariate statistical analyses.

STAT501.title: Statistical Science
STAT501.description: Overview of statistics theory; use in agriculture, business, environment, engineering; modeling; computing; statisticians as researchers/consultants.

STAT511A.title: Design and Data Analysis for Researchers I: R Software
STAT511A.description: Statistical methods for experimenters/researchers emphasizing design and analysis of experiments using R software.

STAT511B.title: Design and Data Analysis for Researchers I: SAS Software
STAT511B.description: Statistical methods for experimenters/researchers emphasizing design and analysis of experiments using SAS software.

STAT512.title: Design and Data Analysis for Researchers II
STAT512.description: Statistical methods for experimenters and researchers emphasizing design and analysis of experiments.

STAT520.title: Introduction to Probability Theory
STAT520.description: Probability, random variables, distributions, expectations, generating functions, limit theorems, convergence, random processes.

STAT521.title: Stochastic Processes I
STAT521.description: Characterization of stochastic processes. Markov chains in discrete and continuous time, branching processes, renewal theory, Brownian motion.

STAT525.title: Analysis of Time Series I
STAT525.description: Trend and seasonality, stationary processes, Hilbert space techniques, spectral distribution function, fitting ARIMA models, linear prediction.

STAT530.title: Mathematical Statistics
STAT530.description: Sampling distributions, estimates, testing, confidence intervals, exact and asymptotic theories of maximum likelihood and distribution-free methods.

STAT540.title: Data Analysis and Regression
STAT540.description: Introduction to multiple regression and data analysis with emphasis on graphics and computing.

STAT556.title: Directed Statistical Consulting
STAT556.description: Skills necessary to collaborate with non-statisticians, including project management, presentation, and technical writing. Serve in the walk-in consulting lab. Collaborate on a semester-long active CSU project identified by the instructor. Engage in all phases of the long-term project.

STAT560.title: Applied Multivariate Analysis
STAT560.description: Multivariate analysis of variance; principal components; factor analysis; discriminant analysis; cluster analysis.

STAT570.title: Nonparametric Statistics
STAT570.description: Distribution and uses of order statistics; nonparametric inferential techniques, their uses and mathematical properties.

STAT586.title: Practicum in Consulting Techniques
STAT586.description: Instruction on planning studies, writing reports, and interacting with clients. Attend and critique consulting sessions.

STAT600.title: Statistical Computing
STAT600.description: Optimization and integration in statistics; Monte Carlo methods; simulation; bootstrapping; density estimation; smoothing.

STAT605.title: Theory of Sampling Techniques
STAT605.description: Survey designs; simple random, stratified, cluster samples; theory of estimation; optimization techniques for minimum variance or costs.

STAT620.title: Introduction to Measure Theoretic Probability
STAT620.description: Introduction to rigorous probability theory in real Euclidean spaces based on a foundation of measure theory.

STAT623.title: Spatial Statistics
STAT623.description: Spatial autocorrelation, geostatistical models and kriging, analysis/modeling of point patterns, discretely-indexed spatial models.

STAT630.title: Advanced Statistical Data Analysis
STAT630.description: Advanced statistical modeling techniques and data analysis methods, including likelihood-based methods, M-estimation, bootstrap and EM algorithm, and other advanced topics. For example, Jackknife, permutation tests, and nonparametric statistics.

STAT640.title: Design and Linear Modeling I
STAT640.description: Introduction to linear models; experimental design; fixed, random, and mixed models.

STAT645.title: Categorical Data Analysis and GLIM
STAT645.description: Generalized linear models, binary and polytomous data, log linear models, quasilikelihood, survival data models.

STAT650.title: Design and Linear Modeling II
STAT650.description: Mixed factorials; response surface methodology; Taguchi methods; variance components.

STAT670.title: Bayesian Statistics
STAT670.description: Bayesian statistical theory and applications, including Markov chain Monte Carlo methods which are used to facilitate inference for more complex statistical models.

STAT684.title: Supervised College Teaching
STAT684.description: Guidance and instruction in effective teaching of college courses in statistics.

STAT720.title: Probability Theory
STAT720.description: Measure theoretic probability, characteristic functions; convergence; laws of large numbers; central limit, extreme value, asymptotic theory.

STAT730.title: Advanced Theory of Statistics I
STAT730.description: Minimal sufficiency, maximal invariance; Neyman-Pearson theory; Fisher, Kullback-Leibler information; asymptotic properties of maximum-likelihood methods.

STAT740.title: Advanced Statistical Methods
STAT740.description: Generalized additive models; recursive partitioning regression and classification; graphical models and belief networks; spatial statistics.

SA482.title: Study Abroad
SA482.description: Students participating in a semester study abroad program register for

SA682.title: Graduate Study Abroad
SA682.description: Vehicle to allow graduate students to enroll in a study program abroad as part of their approved program.

SYSE501.title: Foundations of Systems Engineering
SYSE501.description: Functional components of systems engineering, application of systems engineering to practical problems, system life-cycle process.

SYSE530.title: Overview of Systems Engineering Processes
SYSE530.description: Systems engineering life-cycle process and analysis techniques. Reliability and robustness.

SYSE534.title: Human Systems Integration
SYSE534.description: Evaluation of human capabilities and limitations when designing and evaluating complex systems in order to enhance safety, efficiency, usability, and reduce life cycle costs.

SYSE567.title: Systems Engineering Architecture
SYSE567.description: Observation/classification of systems architecture. Systems architecture principles and critical evaluation through design studies.

SYSE569.title: Cybersecurity Awareness for Systems Engineers
SYSE569.description: Cybersecurity principles, practices, technologies, design approaches, and terminology needed to incorporate cybersecurity principles into effective systems designs.

SYSE571.title: Analytics in Systems Engineering
SYSE571.description: Focus on the appropriate application of data mining, knowledge generation, data analytics and data algorithmics to large complex systems. Demystify "big data" for systems engineers as applied to intelligent systems.

SYSE573.title: Cost Optimization for Systems Engineers
SYSE573.description: Techniques and strategies to respond to requirements, design, development and manufacturing decisions, while optimizing for cost at the organizational, program, and project level.

SYSE596.title: Group Study-Systems Engineering Skills
SYSE596.description: Topics related to building specialized skills relevant for the systems engineering field.

SYSE597.title: Group Study in Systems Engineering
SYSE597.description: Special and contemporary topics in the field of systems engineering.

SYSE602.title: Systems Requirements Engineering
SYSE602.description: Introduction to the rigorous requirements process within systems engineering, including system requirements analysis, requirements decomposition, allocation, tracking, verification, and validation.

SYSE603.title: Introduction to Systems Test and Evaluation
SYSE603.description: Test and evaluation of systems at both the component and systems levels to provide insights into how systems succeed or fail based on test methodologies.

SYSE667.title: Advanced Model-Based Systems Engineering
SYSE667.description: Theory and application of formal systems architecture modeling.

SYSE710.title: Leadership/Innovation in Systems Engineering
SYSE710.description: Background in technical leadership skill sets, systems engineering skillsets, and intellectual toolkit to develop a successful applied and translational research project/practicum.

SYSE711.title: Ethics in Systems Engineering
SYSE711.description: Ethical principles and their application to systems engineering.

SYSE786.title: Applied Systems Engineering Practicum
SYSE786.description: Research techniques, critical thinking, evaluation criteria, and methods of technical writing.

SYSE799A.title: Dissertation: PhD
SYSE799A.description: Dissertation for PhD in System Engineering Program.

TH141.title: Introduction to Theatre (GT-AH1)
TH141.description: Theatre as an art form and one of the humanities, its impact on society, and its relationship to other art forms.

TH149.title: Movement for Actors I
TH149.description: A broad survey of different movement theories from Asia, Africa, and Europe.

TH150.title: Introduction to Performance
TH150.description: Imagination as the actor's primary resource: acting exercises, compositions, improvisations to acquire the basic approach to text through action.

TH151.title: Acting I
TH151.description: Imagination as an actor’s resource. Finding action, objective, the art of memory, improvisation, scene study, from simple scenes in realistic plays.

TH153.title: Singing for Actors I
TH153.description: Fusion of acting technique and singing technique for credible performance in the musical genre.

TH160.title: Drawing for the Theatre
TH160.description: Introduction to drawing, drafting, watercolor, and other graphic techniques used by set, costume, lighting, and media designers.

TH161.title: Technical Theatre: Stagecraft
TH161.description: Skills and craft of technical theatre. Knowledge of tools, materials, and techniques essential to production realization.

TH163.title: Costume Construction for the Theatre
TH163.description: Technical side of costuming for live stage performances with an emphasis on all aspects of construction.

TH186.title: Theatre Practicum I
TH186.description: Practical experience in mounting theatrical productions.

TH192.title: Theatre Freshman Seminar
TH192.description: Collaborative creative processes required to transfer storytelling and self-scripting literature to theatrical performance with faculty artists/scholars.

TH240.title: Reading Shakespeare for the Theatre
TH240.description: Reading, speaking Shakespeare texts: comedies, sonnets, romances, to develop various approaches to understand and perform his work to modern audiences.

TH241.title: Text Analysis for the Theatre
TH241.description: Analyzing plays with an aim toward being better prepared, as theatre artists, to understand the dramatic text, the basis of theatre art and craft.

TH242.title: Theatre History I
TH242.description: Theatre from its origins through the Renaissance.

TH243.title: Theatre History II
TH243.description: Theatre history from the English Restoration of 1660 through the postwar developments in Europe and the Americas from 1945 to 1960.

TH250.title: Voice and Movement for the Stage
TH250.description: A broad survey of traditional and topical approaches to voice and movement for the theatre actor.

TH251.title: Acting II
TH251.description: Application of the given circumstances to a text and development of characterization. Selection and preparation of audition material.

TH253.title: Singing for Actors II
TH253.description: Advanced singing techniques, sight singing, using more difficult and challenging music. Preparing for a performance in musical theatre.

TH255.title: Directing Workshop
TH255.description: Practical directing workshop, short directing exercises, short scenes, techniques, theories, readings, staging prompts.

TH260.title: Computer Assisted Drafting for Theatre
TH260.description: Computer-aided drafting and conceptual articulation for theatrical design and production using entertainment industry standard: Vectorworks.

TH261.title: Drawing and Drafting for the Theatre
TH261.description: Fundamental drawing, drafting, and rendering techniques needed by theatrical designers to effectively communicate their visual ideas.

TH262.title: Stage Management I
TH262.description: Duties and responsibilities of stage managers. Communication, rehearsal, performance techniques.  Conceptual approaches to theatre.

TH263.title: Costume Design I
TH263.description: Basic theory and technique for visualization of theatrical characters through costume.

TH264.title: Lighting Design for the Theatre I
TH264.description: Essential principles and theory for stage lighting including design process, control, equipment, and lighting aesthetics.

TH265.title: Set Design I
TH265.description: Theory and techniques for designing scenery for the stage.

TH266.title: Digital Media Design for Live Performance I
TH266.description: Sound and projection design fundamentals: control, design and content creation for live performance settings.

TH267.title: Scenic Painting
TH267.description: Basic techniques and practical applications in scenic painting for the theatre.

TH269.title: Theatrical Makeup
TH269.description: Stage makeup.  Individual skill in character analysis, application in pigment, plastic, hair, makeup, and selection and use of theatrical makeup.

TH286.title: Theatre Practicum II
TH286.description: Practical experience in mounting theatrical productions.

TH292.title: Design and Technology Seminar
TH292.description: Weekly examination of the ongoing production processes and strategies for stage managers and designers assigned productions in the mainstage season.

TH301.title: Theatre Design and Production Special Topics
TH301.description: In-depth study of general interest in design and production.  Possible topics may include history of decor, storyboarding, etc.

TH324.title: Teaching Creative Drama for Children
TH324.description: Theoretical and practical experience in teaching creative drama.

TH343.title: Contemporary Plays and Alternative Theatre
TH343.description: The study of revolutionary movements and alternative staging practices in theatre prompted by plays written from 1960 to the present.

TH344.title: Dramaturgy Protocol Seminar
TH344.description: Training in the application of dramaturgical techniques to facilitate the collaborative creative process in contemporary performance practice.

TH345.title: Global Theatre
TH345.description: Global theatre history, explored through text, style, and cultural context.

TH350.title: Classical Text
TH350.description: The Cicely Berry approach to voice and speech for speaking classical text.

TH351.title: Acting III
TH351.description: Acting Methods for challenges presented in plays by Brecht, Moliere, Chekov, Ibsen, Pirandello, O’Neill, and contemporary re-workings of the Greeks.

TH352.title: Acting for Singers
TH352.description: Acting class specifically for singers: improv, beginning scene work, harnessing given circumstance and augmenting physical character life onstage.

TH353.title: Experimental Performance
TH353.description: Artistic exploration of experimental performance via radical innovations in dance, theatre, music, literature, film, art, and performance art.

TH355.title: Directing Seminar
TH355.description: Theatrical, practical, and creative approaches to directing a play: research, analysis, semiotics, identifying visual metaphor, point of view.

TH361.title: Technical Theatre: Technical Direction
TH361.description: Advanced training and techniques in construction management and technical production for the theatre.

TH362.title: Stage Management II
TH362.description: Problem-solving in the stage manager leadership role: advanced study in production realization, stage management concepts and techniques in practice.

TH363.title: Costume Design II
TH363.description: Theory and practice of advanced costume design techniques.

TH364.title: Lighting Design for the Theatre II
TH364.description: Principles and theory for stage lighting including advanced programming, tour preparation, and presentation techniques.

TH365.title: Advanced Scenic Design
TH365.description: The practice of scenic design from text to idea to realized work. Advanced scenic design techniques in divergent and increasingly complex situations.

TH366.title: Digital Media Design for Live Performance II
TH366.description: Advanced sound and projection design techniques (including sound control, microphone arrays, animation and mapping) in live performance settings.

TH369.title: Advanced Makeup and Hair Design
TH369.description: Advanced techniques in makeup, hair, and wig design for theatre.

TH370A.title: Theatre Assistant: Design
TH370A.description: Assist a guest professional or faculty designer in full production locally or offsite.

TH370B.title: Theatre Assistant: Directing
TH370B.description: Assist a guest professional or faculty director in full production locally or off-site.

TH375.title: Playwright's Workshop
TH375.description: Character, conflict, structure, setting, dialogue, and the process of rewriting, resulting in a finished 10-minute play.

TH386.title: Theatre Practicum III
TH386.description: Practical experience in mounting theatrical productions.

TH392.title: Theatre Seminar
TH392.description: Various current theatre topics taught by visiting professionals, for example, “The League of Regional Theatres is our National Theatre.”

TH400.title: Theatre Production Workshop
TH400.description: Explores both the practical and dramaturgical essences of the production of a play.

TH401.title: Theatrical Design and Prod Advanced Topics
TH401.description: Intensive study for advanced TD&P students, e.g., property design, advanced costume technology, wigmaking, company management, rigging, pyro, etc.

TH449.title: Commedia and Masks
TH449.description: Playing comedy, including commedia del’arte techniques, clown work, masks, circus techniques, mime, and scene work from comic scripts.

TH450.title: Professional Actor Preparation
TH450.description: Portfolios, casting, breakdowns, reels, agents, managers, interviews, cold reading techniques, on-camera work, marketing.

TH451.title: Advanced Topics in Acting
TH451.description: Author-specific actor challenges (e.g. Brecht, Beckett, Shakespeare, Chekhov, Moliere, and contemporary writers).

TH455.title: Advanced Directing
TH455.description: Intensive practical experience in stage direction, focusing on specific directional challenges posed by various types of texts and multiple collaborative projects.

TH460.title: Design Portfolio and Professional Preparation
TH460.description: Creating effective portfolio and design presentation; digital portfolios, storyboarding, articulating concepts, professional preparation for career.

TH471.title: Capstone in Theatre Practice
TH471.description: Major production assignment in acting, design, production, or dramatic literature.

TH475.title: Advanced Playwriting
TH475.description: Development of imaginative capabilities and insights, to articulate an individual voice as a writer of longer and more complex plays for theatre.

TH478.title: Theatre in London Seminar
TH478.description: Seminar to prepare for study in London for theatre research as an evolving art form rich in historical and artistic traditions.

TH479.title: Theatre in London: Travel Abroad
TH479.description: To foster theatre research as an evolving art form rich in historical and artistic traditions. Students will attend 13-15 live theatre productions.

TH482.title: Theatre in London--Travel Abroad
TH482.description: Study abroad in and around London to foster research into theatre as an evolving art form with rich historical and artistic traditions.

TH486.title: Theatre Practicum IV
TH486.description: Advanced topics in applied theatre production.  Challenges in developing and mounting a theatrical performance.

TH487.title: Theatre Internship
TH487.description: Advisor-approved position at a professional regional theatre, a professional training program, or professional summer theatre.

TH491.title: Repertory Theatre Workshop
TH491.description: Principles and practice of repertory theatre operation; practical experience offered.

TH492.title: Theatre Seminar
TH492.description: Contemporary theatre practice, trends, in-depth study of genres, authors, current theatre research, e.g., “Theatre of Revolt", “Beckett’s Theatre".

TH498.title: Theatre Research
TH498.description: Scholarly research paper in theatre.  Topic approved by faculty advisor.

TH499.title: Theatre Thesis
TH499.description: Written thesis in theatre. Topic approved by faculty advisor.

VM603.title: Veterinary Science: Research and Methods
VM603.description: Conduct of responsible research, contributions of research to the practice of veterinary medicine, and career opportunities.

VM606.title: Veterinary Immunology
VM606.description: Infectious agents, immune-mediated diseases, immune deficiencies, and principles of vaccination.

VM610.title: Foundations of Veterinary Medicine I
VM610.description: Development of professional skills (ethics, communication, physical exam, surgical skills) necessary for the practice of veterinary medicine.

VM611.title: Foundations of Veterinary Medicine II
VM611.description: Development of professional skills (ethics, communication, physical exam, surgical skills) necessary for the practice of veterinary medicine.

VM612.title: The Healer's Art
VM612.description: Exploration of student experiences, beliefs, and values related to their work as veterinary medical professionals.

VM616.title: Functional Anatomy
VM616.description: Intensive study of the gross anatomy of domestic animals. Anatomy studied comprises canine, feline, bovine, equine, small ruminant, and porcine species. Emphasis is on canine and equine anatomy. Comparative understanding of the anatomy of organ systems will support clinical instruction in the professional curriculum.

VM618.title: Veterinary Physiology and Histology
VM618.description: Physiology and microscopic anatomy of endocrine, hemopoietic, lymphatic, cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and urinary systems in selected domestic animals.

VM619.title: Veterinary Neurobiology
VM619.description: Structural and functional foundations of nervous system activity; introduction to clinical neurology.

VM620.title: Introduction to Spanish for Veterinarians
VM620.description: Focus on basic Spanish structures and lexicon relevant to small and large animal veterinary communication with Spanish-speaking pet owners and livestock workforces. Familiarizes the fundamental grammatical functions and vocabulary necessary for productive communication in Spanish in the veterinary care language domain.

VM621.title: Exotic Animal Anatomy and Husbandry
VM621.description: Applied veterinary anatomy and husbandry of birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish.

VM623.title: Veterinary Nutrition and Metabolism
VM623.description: Intermediary metabolism, nutrients, and animal nutrition.

VM624.title: Veterinary Feeds and Feeding
VM624.description: Description, advantages, and limitations of feedstuffs fed to domestic livestock; nutrient requirements and formulation of rations for various needs.

VM637.title: Veterinary Bacteriology and Mycology
VM637.description: Biology of bacterial and fungal pathogens of animals with emphasis on common infectious diseases encountered in veterinary practice.

VM638.title: Veterinary Parasitology
VM638.description: Biology of helminth, arthropod, and protozoan pathogens of animals with emphasis on common infectious diseases encountered in veterinary practice.

VM639.title: Veterinary Virology
VM639.description: Biology of viral pathogens of animals with emphasis on common infectious diseases encountered in veterinary practice.

VM640.title: Biology of Disease I
VM640.description: Introduction to mechanisms of subcellular, cellular, tissue, and organ response to injury and associated pathological processes.

VM648.title: Food Animal Production and Food Safety

VM707.title: Emerging Issues in Animal Health
VM707.description: Important topics in veterinary medicine and public health.

VM710.title: Foundations of Veterinary Medicine III
VM710.description: Development of professional skills (ethics, communication, physical exam, surgical skills) necessary for the practice of veterinary medicine.

VM711.title: Foundations of Veterinary Medicine IV
VM711.description: Development of professional skills (ethics, communication, physical exam, surgical skills) necessary for the practice of veterinary medicine.

VM714.title: Veterinary Preventive Medicine
VM714.description: Principles of health promotion and disease prevention in populations.

VM716.title: Principles of Shelter Veterinary Medicine
VM716.description: Introduces the principles of veterinary shelter medicine. Emphasis on management of small animals with herd health concepts.

VM719.title: Evidence-Based Medical Herbology
VM719.description: Critical evaluation, mechanisms of action, indications, contraindications, herb-drug interactions for botanical medicines used in veterinary medicine.

VM720.title: Alternative and Complementary Therapeutics
VM720.description: Mechanisms and efficacy of alternative and complementary therapeutics used in veterinary medicine.

VM721.title: Non-Mammalian Vertebrate Medicine
VM721.description: Diagnosis and treatment of diseases of non-mammalian vertebrates.

VM722.title: Veterinary Pharmacology
VM722.description: Basic and clinical pharmacology, therapeutic practice, and pharmacy management.

VM724.title: Bioanalytical Pathology
VM724.description: Mechanisms, interpretation, and applications of laboratory analyses for solving diagnostic problems.

VM728.title: Principles of Imaging Interpretation
VM728.description: Review and practice radiographic anatomy and interpretative skills of diagnostic imaging with emphasis on the small animal abdomen and thorax, equine and small animal musculoskeletal systems, and small animal axial skeleton and skull.

VM730.title: Applied Animal Behavior
VM730.description: Identification, characterization, and treatment of common disorders of animal behavior encountered by practicing veterinarians.

VM731.title: Biology and Diseases of Small Mammals
VM731.description: Diagnosis and treatment of diseases of small mammals.

VM733.title: Principles of Surgery
VM733.description: Principles and concepts of general and orthopedic surgery.

VM735.title: Animal Welfare
VM735.description: Animal welfare key concepts, including both science and ethics; sociological/cultural influence on animal welfare; animal welfare assessment; role of veterinarians in animal welfare; contemporary challenges in animal welfare.

VM737.title: Principles of Anesthesia
VM737.description: Integration of physiological and pharmacological principles in clinical anesthesia.

VM739.title: Clinical Diagnostic Microbiology
VM739.description: Infectious disease diagnostic tools found within the veterinarian's practice toolbox and how they work. Plans to approach a common clinical case presentation and use the tools to solve the problem. Analysis of cost/benefit ratios of in-clinic versus send-out use of different tools available.

VM741.title: Biology of Disease II
VM741.description: Pathogenesis of organ system diseases and integrated systemic pathology.

VM742.title: Biology of Disease III
VM742.description: Pathogenesis of disease in organ systems, systemic pathology.

VM744.title: Theriogenology
VM744.description: Reproductive function and disease, including mammary gland and endocrine regulation of reproduction and lactation.

VM745.title: Clinical Sciences I
VM745.description: Diagnostic approaches to common medical problems of the gastrointestinal tract (including dentistry), liver / pancreas, and endocrine systems in small animal, food animal, and equine species are covered. A clinical reasoning process for approaching clinical problems is reviewed and reinforced.

VM747.title: Clinical Sciences II
VM747.description: Diagnostic approaches to common medical problems of organ systems.

VM749.title: Clinical Sciences III
VM749.description: Diagnostic approaches to common medical problems of organ systems.

VM751.title: Veterinary Clinical Toxicology
VM751.description: Common toxicants and poisonous plants encountered by companion and farm animal species, their pathophysiological effects, and clinical treatments.

VM753.title: Clinical Sciences IV
VM753.description: Diagnostic approaches to common medical problems of organ systems.

VM757.title: Bovine Herd Medicine
VM757.description: Health management, and diagnosis and treatment of diseases of food animals.

VM763.title: Equine Medicine and Surgery
VM763.description: Health management, and diagnosis and treatment of diseases of horses.

VM772.title: Veterinary Professional Development
VM772.description: Topics include euthanasia training, contract and animal law, resumes, CVs and cover letters, career development, personal wellness and leadership, and personal finance and debt management.

VM773.title: Small Animal Medicine and Surgery I
VM773.description: Health management, and diagnosis and treatment of diseases of dogs and cats.

VM774.title: Small Animal Medicine and Surgery II
VM774.description: Health management, and diagnosis and treatment of diseases of dogs and cats.

VM775.title: Veterinary Practice Management
VM775.description: Introduction to management of veterinary practice finances, marketing, personnel, and client relations.

VM777.title: Feline Medicine
VM777.description: Emphasizes the historical and examination findings, diagnostic evaluation, therapeutic approach, and prognosis relevant to common diseases of cats.

VM782A.title: Study Abroad--Africa: Wildlife Health and Conservation Medicine
VM782A.description: Visit Kruger National Park in South Africa and Victoria Falls Wildlife Trust in Zimbabwe. Learning opportunities for veterinary students interested in careers in wildlife health and conservation medicine. Topics covered are in wildlife medicine and conservation, disease, forensics, anesthesia and capture.

VM786A.title: Junior Practicum
VM786A.description: Training in clinical procedures for the diagnosis and treatment of animal diseases.

VM786B.title: Senior Practicum
VM786B.description: Training in clinical procedures for the diagnosis and treatment of animal diseases.

VM796R.title: Group Study: Food Animal Clinical Problems
VM796R.description: Diagnostic, therapeutic, management, and monitoring tools used to deal with food animal health problems.

VMBS100.title: Introduction to Biomedical Sciences Major
VMBS100.description: Introduction to biomedical sciences major and faculty; academic and career planning; information sources in biomedical sciences.

WR406.title: Seasonal Snow Environments
WR406.description: Evaluation of the physical environment; characteristics of snow; methods of studying snow; snow safety.

WR416.title: Land Use Hydrology
WR416.description: Fundamental concepts in hydrology and effects of land use on hydrologic processes.

WR417.title: Watershed Measurements
WR417.description: Instrument and field techniques in watershed science. Project design and data analysis.

WR418.title: Land Use and Water Quality
WR418.description: Physical, chemical, biological water quality parameters affecting land use; land management to maintain water quality; water quality standards, legislation.

WR419.title: Water Quality Analyses
WR419.description: Analyze freshwater samples for water quality constituents. Analyze data along with public water quality datasets.

WR440.title: Watershed Problem Analysis
WR440.description: Capstone integration of spatial watershed issues, focused on problem solving in watershed science.

WR474.title: Snow Hydrology
WR474.description: Snowfall, accumulation, distribution, physical processes in the snowpack, energy balance, ablation and runoff, measurement methods, runoff forecasting.

WR486.title: Watershed Field Practicum
WR486.description: Field visits to watershed management projects and sites of significant field studies.

WR487.title: Internship
WR487.description: Supervised work experience in professional settings related to Watershed Science.

WR510.title: Watershed Management in Developing Countries
WR510.description: Watershed management problems, approaches, and solutions in developing countries.

WR511.title: Water Resource Development
WR511.description: Basic principles of water resource management including surface and subsurface flows.

WR512.title: Water Law for Non-Lawyers
WR512.description: Basics of water law and policy for Colorado, western states, and the U.S.

WR514.title: GIS and Data Analysis in Water Resources
WR514.description: Exposure to multiple data analysis and GIS tools used to study water resources. Assess online data sources, download and pre-process digital data, and analyze water information.

WR516.title: Cumulative Effects and Watershed Analysis
WR516.description: Definition, causal processes, and modeling of cumulative watershed effects; comparison and evaluation of current watershed analysis procedures.

WR520.title: Evapotranspiration
WR520.description: Theory, estimation, measurement, simulation, and application of evapotranspiration processes in hydrology.

WR574.title: Advanced Snow Hydrology
WR574.description: Snow processes in hydrologic cycle; physical and conceptual methods of modeling; techniques for measuring different states and change rates.

WR575.title: Snow Hydrology Field Methods
WR575.description: Field course offering hands-on experience in snow hydrology.

WR616.title: Hillslope Hydrology and Runoff Processes
WR616.description: Hillslope hydrology and runoff processes in different environments; implications for management and modeling.

WR671.title: Advanced Topics in Watershed Science
WR671.description: Explores advanced topics in watershed hydrology, biogeochemistry, and ecology.

WR674.title: Data Issues in Hydrology
WR674.description: Types of data, data sources, data quality, missing data, spatial data, data usage, sensitivity in models, error, presentation of data and results.

WR712.title: Watershed Systems
WR712.description: Dynamic simulation of watershed behavior; application and evaluation of current hydrologic models.

WR714.title: Water Quality for Wildland Managers
WR714.description: Sampling, statistics of sampling, concepts of ionic equilibrium, water quality modeling, instream flow requirements.

WS200.title: Introduction to Women's Studies
WS200.description: Examination of gender roles in work, education, spirituality, relationships, health, institutions and organizations.

WS268.title: Whiteness, Gender, and Sexuality
WS268.description: Examines categories and ideas of whiteness and white supremacy in the United States to understand the connections between whiteness, sexism, and heterosexism. Explore the history of whiteness and racialized definitions of gender and sexuality.

WS269.title: Women of Color in the United States
WS269.description: Surveying the contemporary experiences of women of various racialized ethnicities in the United States.

WS270.title: Feminist Theory
WS270.description: Contemporary feminist theories from multiple perspectives, including topics such as gender, race, sexuality, and oppression.

WS322A.title: Study Abroad--Ghana: Youth Development, Transnational Perspectives

WS323A.title: Study Abroad--Spain: LGBTQ
WS323A.description: Examine advocacy and policies affecting the LGBTQ communities in Spain. Explore how one country’s journey toward equality can inform other countries, by engaging in intentional activities, lectures, and events. Examine how social identities weave into the complexities of policy (e.g. race, socioeconomic status, etc.).

WS472.title: Seminar in Multiracial & Decolonial Feminisms
WS472.description: Through an interdisciplinary and comparative approach, this course explores multiracial and decolonial feminist social theory and scholarly practices.

WS484.title: Supervised College Teaching
WS484.description: Assist the instructor in women’s and gender studies courses.

WS487.title: Internship
WS487.description: Internship placement in women’s/gender organization, institution, or program.

WS510.title: Women and Sustainability
WS510.description: Examination of sustainability issues with a focus on development policies and impacts on communities from an international feminist perspective.

WS601.title: Foundations of Feminist Research
WS601.description: Feminist perspectives on epistemology and methodologies for conducting and interpreting research.
